story:
About Project

The time has come to bring the true Anunnaki origins of humanity to the masses. The goal of this campaign is to raise funds to make this happen in the form of a Movie and/or Pilot for an eventual series.

This movie will be based on the theories of Zecharia Sitchin, my original screenplay, research, and graphic novel, "In The Beginning : The Epic of the Anunnaki", (released in 2013). The plan is to introduce the Anunnaki (Anu, Enki, Enlil, Inanna, and many others), Planet Nibiru, early mankind (Adam, Eve, Enoch, etc. with accurate skin tones), the Great Flood, and much more.

Please SHARE!

See the trailer here:


What We Need & What You Get

The $$$ goal set in this campaign is obviously not nearly enough to make a movie, but it is not a limit either. If we raise the amount set, we can take some of the next steps required to make this goal a reality, such as:
  • Hollywood-experienced screenwriter polish the existing screenplay
  • Prepare a professional pitch package
  • Produce additional video promos
If we raise more, then we will continue on with the path towards seeing this a reality...possibly even enough to produce the movie on our own. The more we raise, the further we will take this. All money raised (aside from IndieGoGo and related processing fees) will go towards funding this project.
Please SHARE!

Since I'd like to keep the contributors involved, here are the perks:
ALL CONTRIBUTORS will gain access to an Exclusive Private Group on Facebook, with Behind-the-Scenes Updates on the project. (We already have a professional Hollywood screenwriter involved.)

  • Other rewards include:
  1. Autographed copy of "In The Beginning : The Epic of the Anunnaki" Graphic Novel.
  2. Autographed "In The Beginning : The Epic of the Anunnaki" Poster
  3. "In The Beginning : The Epic of the Anunnaki" T-Shirt
  4. "In The Beginning : The Epic of the Anunnaki" Sticker

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford to help financially, not even a $1, then that's understandable. You can still help by SHARING this with your friends and social networks online.

TOGETHER, WE CAN MAKE THIS HAPPEN!

story:
We built up a following of more than 100k on Twitter and 100k on Facebook  as part of the first campaign and had a reach of 5 million by the time Jeremy was elected Labour Leader in 2015.

We have continued this project unofficially as Volunteers over the last year and throughout the 2016 Labour leadership contest - bringing our reach to over 13 million, and followers of over 230k!

We have continued building Jeremy's unofficial social media and taking on the myths and smears of the main stream media where we can. #Wearehismedia

Continuing to act as a shield for both Jeremy and the politics he stands for.

Jeremy was elected with the biggest mandate ever on those politics and we remain unashamedly pushing them on. 

We are in no doubt that in order to make Labour successful again we need to take these issues out to a wider audience. 

As volunteers we have all put in thousands of hours of work and will continue to do so. 

To get to the next stage though we do need some help, we need you to help us fund some social media advertising, to fund staff to push our project on a full time basis, to help us reach even more people and make a Labour victory under Jeremy Corbyn possible. 

If everyone of our online supporters gave £1 we could run a significantly bigger online operation for the next 2 years! We don't only want your money though, send us in your idea's, graphics, video's and get involved.

Thank you for all your support so far in building our social media, whether that's sharing our memes, liking our pages or helping us why content.

Thanks

The Jeremycorbyn4pm team

story:
Director's Update:

The response has been heart-warming, but we still need your help.  The music community graciously gave us tremendous support in the making of this film.  Can you pitch in to help us finish it?  We promise you'll enjoy the result.

The long-awaited Billy Vera documentary is almost done!  Thanks to forty or so hours of interviews with a Who's-Who of the music business -- people like Dolly Parton, Mike Stoller, Benny Golson, Nona Hendryx, Joe Smith, 97-year-old Art Rupe, and on and on, plus Billy himself -- the result is spectacular.  To make it complete, we want to include hits that Billy wrote for the likes of Bonnie Raitt, Lou Rawls, and Dolly.  That, needless to say, requires money.  For those of you who have not participated, please help our cause.  And for those of you generous to help in the past, please consider helping us reach the finish line.


DIRECTOR: Alan Swyer
Alan Swyer has been writer, director, and/or producer on films ranging from HBO’s award-winning “Rebound” to “The Buddy Holly Story;” “Alfred Hitchcock;” and the award-winning “Spiritual Revolution.”  Among his other work are the documentaries “Beisbol,” Imagen Award winner for best feature-length documentary,;"The Diabetes Epidemic,” named Best Network Documentary for 2008; and the recent festival hit "El Boxeo; plus numerous music videos and commercials.  His novel "The Beard" will be published in April by Harvard Square Editions.

CINEMATOGRAPHER: Brad Spurr

Brad Spurr is an Emmy nominated sound mixer. Brad is known for his work on LET'S MAKE A DEAL, @MIDNIGHT with CHRIS HARDWICK and THAT 70's SHOW.



 .

story:
Short Summary

  • My name is Ryan Powell. I'm a recent cinema production graduate from Utah Valley University. By day I work as a video editor for Molio Inc., an advertising agency based in Utah. By night I patrol the streets as the vigilante "Roundhouse", ensuring that no thief, murderer, or jaywalker goes unpunished. I mostly just tattle on them.
  • The script "Just a Hit of Garlic" is something I'm very proud of. It's been through several script analysis workshops where it's received overwhelmingly positive feedback. Those who have read it have expressed great enthusiasm for it to be made which has given me the confidence and drive to take it from the script to the screen. It's a comedy commenting on the consequences of addiction in a way that I don't think I've ever seen done. We want to say something and have fun doing it. 

  • The intention is to create a short film that will be submitted to film festivals, and depending on its success, garner more attention and support to create bigger and better things. This is a fun and important project by itself, but it also has the potential to lead to more. With your help we'll be able to do it.

What We Need & What You Get

  • Everyone working on this is donating their time and many are donating their resources. But to make this film we need to raise some money to pay for everything else. This will be going to camera and audio equipment rentals, paying for locations to film in, costume materials, set decorations, props, and food to feed the crew on our days of filming.
  • The prizes we offer for donating keep to the theme of the film. Vials of (fake) blood, signed copies of the script, mini movie posters, a personalized video of one of the crew drinking a garlic smoothie dedicated to YOU (That's right, YOU! They'll call out your name before chugging it.), your very own producer credit to appear in the film's end credits, and either the opportunity to be an extra in the film OR a personalized gift basket that includes a blu ray of the film. Whichever you prefer.
  • If we don't reach our entire goal we will decide, based on what we have raised, if we can still make the film with the expense of certain elements. If we decide we cannot then all contributions will be refunded and I'll cry myself to sleep.

The Impact

  • Be a part of something that could really be something. Think, if this goes to a film festival or festivals YOU will have been a part of that! When people are contemplating the consequences of addiction or choking on their popcorn because they're laughing too hard you can sit back and think "Ah yeah. That's because of me." Pretty cool, right?
  • This is the longest short film I'll have made, but I'm no stranger to the production process and good storytelling. I've been involved with video production for brands like Orabrush, Orapup, and all of the spots you'll find on the Molio Youtube channel, which includes brands like Poo~Pourri, Wilson Golf, and Mile IQ. Also, check out "Star Wars Baseball: The Umpire is a Quack" https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8pEwFlz2AVE. Did that a while ago using my own money (what little I had).
  • If we get the funding we need this WILL be a good film. My team and I will make sure of it. I will not have my name on something that I can't be proud of. I'm like the next Calvin Klein.

Risks & Challenges

  • When filming, there can be obstacles. Equipment could malfunction, an actor or crew member could get hurt or sick, costumes could get ruined, etc. But never fear. I'm a problem solver and somewhat of a genius (just ask my mom). This film will absolutely get done, again, as long as we get the funding :)
  • If someone drops out, I'll be able to replace them. There's enough highly capable people that want to help with this. If equipment malfunctions we'll be able to replace it. I have no doubt. If we run out of food on set I'll wash dishes at a restaurant for as long as they want so that the crew and actors are fed. I might go do dishes just for the heck of it. I find it therapeutic and that's where I get my best ideas. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can't donate but you would like to help please share our video! That in and of itself would be a great help and we would be very grateful. 
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Once A Marine:

Once a Marine is a documentary about coming home from war from the perspective of the Marine infantrymen that fought on the front lines of the war in Afghanistan. 

After getting out of the military, many veterans struggle with depression, loss of purpose, and suicidal ideation. The effects of PTSD have been well publicized, but for the men with the diagnosis, the symptoms they suffer are part of a much larger experience that changed them forever, both for good and for bad. No matter how successful combat veterans end up "transitioning" back to the civilian world, war was the most formative and, to date, most significant part of their lives.

Once a Marine tells the story of adjusting to civilian life after war.


From the Director:

My name is Stephen Canty and six years ago I was a Marine infantryman fighting in Marjah Afghanistan, a place that was called at the time "the last Taliban stronghold" Now, as a civilian I am trying to make a documentary about the Marines I fought alongside in Afghanistan and their struggle to return to civilian life. 

Combat is indescribable. It is humanity at both its best and worse. I never felt more alive than when I was that close to death. But when we started to lose marines from our company, I found I had to get comfortable with the idea of not coming home to deal with the realities of war. Six months after my second deployment to Afghanistan, I was out of the military and back in my hometown. 

I joined the Marines in 2007 at just seventeen years old. Technically, I was still a high-school senior. At the time I was enrolled in the best courses my high-school had to offer, pursuing all those things middle class kids do to look good for college admissions officers. But I felt I needed to prove something to myself. So I left from all of my advanced classes and graduated early in order to go to boot-camp in the middle of my senior year. My teachers said I was throwing away my education. Little did they know, hell I didn't even know, what kind of education I was about to get. 

I didn't plan much before I got out. I just wanted to be done. I got a job, went to college and tried to move on. I was doing well by all accounts, but still felt numb towards life. I couldn't maintain personal relationships, started drinking and doing drugs, and struggled to find a purpose. One day I bought a camera and started filming everything around me. 

I started looking at film schools and thought a  documentary about the transition from combat to civilian life would be unique enough to get me in. Little did I know that the film would taken on a life of its own.

 I called some of the guys I was in with to see if they'd be willing to talk. Many of us hadn't spoken since we'd gotten out of the Marines. I'd assumed everyone was doing better than I was. We'd only spoken on Facebook and never about anything important. I called a few guys up and our phone calls lasted for hours. As it turned out, we were all in the same boat.

After talking with just three of them, I realized that they all mentioned the same issues; depression, lack of purpose, bitterness, and difficulties that they had in dealing with the loss of friends. We thought about Afghanistan all the time. The budding film-maker in me realized there was a story here. 

I couldn't film much besides interviews; I didn't have the budget to stay in any location for more than a weekend or the equipment to make any handheld shooting look more than amateur video. But I cut a trailer and people started to take notice of what I had. They saw that these guys were willing to talk with me openly and honestly because I was one of their own and they had at one point trusted me to watch their backs. 

Marines I served with messaged me on Facebook tell me, "I'm glad to know I'm not the only one that feels this way." Marines I hadn't served with told me they were glad someone was finally telling our story. 

A few weeks after posting the trailer, one of my closest friends from the Marine Corps, Doss, came down on a train from Schenectady, New York to spend the weekend with me. He paid for the ticket himself because I couldn't afford it. He'd kicked the heroin habit he'd developed shortly after getting out of the Marines and wanted to sit down for an interview. Doss got out 3 months before me. I used to call him just to hear how awesome it would be when I got out. 

By the time I got out, Doss had less positive things to say about being a civilian. In the first few months after getting out, many of us had tried calling him but he started answering less and less. In the Marine Corps, Doss was always comic relief. He wasn't so funny as heroin took over his life. 

I realized that this was something greater than making a short documentary for film school. I was telling a story that had never been told. 

What We Need Money For:

As it stands the film is about 80 percent done. I've gotten the film as far as I can alone. The content and story of the film is in place. However, it lacks the polish that only money can buy-sound design, color correction, titles, and additional B-roll. The goal of raising money on Indiegogo is to make the film look the best that it can. I'll spend two weeks traveling the East Coast where the film's subjects are located shooting additional footage and adding the finishing touches to the story. 


I've been carrying this burden for three years and finally the end is in sight. I'm proud of the Marines that participated and myself for never giving up on this project. With your help, I can finish this project and bring this story to the world.

story:
Short Summary

Nude Art Re:Public Philadelphia, will be the first Episode of a "behind the scenes" look at how these photographs are created.

  • I'm Harvey, your friendly public nude artist, known for "pulling off" the photos that have become known over the last 22 years across North America. With 30 cities, 2500+ locations and approximately 4,000 volunteers, I can say I've written the book on Pubic Nudity. Now I'm going to take this rare art form to the next level, with the use of modern technology and the help of a full crew. 
  • I want to capture the beauty of Philadelphia, and pay proper respect to the tradition and history of this rich source of what makes me proud to be an American!
  • With proper planning and execution, and a well-trained crew (5 people and myself), I could shoot 100 locations in just two weeks. This would take me months or even years on my own.
  • Help contribute to the making of Art History! When you see the news coverage, you can smile knowing you helped make it happen.
  • We are planning to depart on the morning of May 12th, (2016) and return on May 26th. 3 Major Festivals begin on May 21 .

What We Need & What You Get

Where the money will be used:

  • I need $36,000 to upgrade my equipment and bring a crew to Philadelphia for two weeks.

    My current equipment consists of a 10-year-old Nikon P100, I paid $84 for it at a pawn shop in Detroit three years ago when I went "digital". I use a Hero 2 GoPro for video capture.

    The quality of the images have suffered greatly in some circumstances because I have to shoot "on the run" without a tripod, and using the cheap digital camera without digital stabilization can sometimes be a waste of effort on everyone's behalf. Also, using my antiquated GoPro camera draws a lot of attention; the chest strap looks like I'm wearing a gun holster from behind, and the camera itself sticks out like a sore thumb - when the point is to try to operate in stealth. I have done my homework, and have come to the conclusion that following equipment is ideally suited for my needs:

    Sony - HDR-AS50R HD Action Camera - Black Model: HDRAS50R/B with digital stabilization and high definition will allow for crystal clear video captures of the entire process, even "on the run." Five cameras (controllable from one wrist unit) 5 x $250 = $1250. Wrist unit = $100. Total= $1350.

    Wireless-hands-free communication system: Motorola sells a walkie-talkie system that will allow the team to communicate with each other at a distance of up to a quarter mile. The cost is $250 for the four person communication package. 

    Apple - MacBook® Pro - 15.4" Display - Intel Core i7 - 16GB Memory - 1TB Flash Storage - Silver Model: Z0RG1LL/A This will allow us the capacity to edit video on site, and to broadcast "live" on the Internet. $3199.99

    Epson - WorkForce WF-7620 Wireless Wide-Format All-In-One Printer - Black Model: C11CC97201 $299.99. This will allow me to give every volunteer an 8 x 10 of every location they appear in within a day, and make large prints for a gallery show at the tail-end of the visit.

  •  Sony - Alpha a7 II Full-Frame Mirrorless Camera with 28-70mm Lens - Black Model:ILCE7M2K/B $1999.99 each X2 = $3999.98 . This camera has the fastest auto focus in the world and 5 point stabilization along with 24.3 megapixels. This will help me deliver crisp shots that can be blown up to any size.

  • Of course the daily expenses of food, transportation, lodging, parking, gas and a dozen small "nickle and dime" things (e.g. laundry, snacks, tips, bottled water) are a significant part of the expense of this trip. The bulk of the budget will go to the crew: five very skilled people will have to commit two weeks of their lives to this project. One, the video editor, will continue on for several days after the visit. For the crew portion of the budget I have set aside $15,000. This budget, distributed proportionately, will allow me to compensate the crew fairly for each of their roles. 
  • Lodging: $3000
  • Food: $ 3000
  • Car rentals: $2500
  • Gas: $500
  • Parking: $300
  • SD cards $1500
  • Cameras, laptop, printer and video equipment listed above: $5550
  • Paper & ink: $1200
  • Miscelaneous expenses ( laundry, tips, beverages, snacks): $750
  • $2,700 Reward fulfillment & postage
  • TOTAL= $36,000
  • If we don't reach our entire goal, the funds will go toward upgrading the equipment, e.g. just 1 camera and 1 video and I would go alone or with just one other person, and shoot as much as I can. This is the way I've been doing it for 22 years. At least the new equipment would ensure better quality shots, even if there are fewer taken. 
  • The perks we offer are some of the most unique you will find. From collectible postcards, limited edition images, access to behind the scenes videos and the opportunity for you to "pick a location".

The Impact

I think it is important to go into the greatest cities in the world and pay homage to their: architecture, culture, history and local tradition. This is my first visit to Philadelphia. Join me on an adventure that will entertain you while you are learning about USA's 5th largest city (America's first capitol).  It seems appropriate that the First Episode of Nude Art Re:Public takes place in Philadelphia. 

  • Nude Art Re:Public will take you to the most famous and loved landmarks in this iconic city; the kinds of places locals take their friends when they can only come to town for a day.
  • Over the last 22 years, I have developed a method of shooting Public Nudes in such a way that it is almost impossible to catch me now. Over the last three years I have developed a "model" for shooting multiple locations on a daily basis for a sustained period of time, within a very tight radius, without incident.
  • Risks & Challenges
  • Although a large emphasis has been put on the "getting away with it," in actual fact, because so much care is taken to avoid shooting in front of minors, and there are no sexual overtones, and because these photographs have artistic and social merit, we are not breaking any laws (Miller vs. California). I just like to execute these photos so quickly that no uninformed police officer makes an arrest that will eventually be dismissed, but will cost the team valuable time and resources.
  • In the past, the main challenge was manpower. I have been going into major metropolitan centers completely solo, with equipment that is far from ideal, and I have still been delivering some action-packed images. Allow me to upgrade my equipment and provide me with a crew, and watch what can be done.

Other Ways You Can Help

There are lots of ways that you can help, besides sending money.

  • Do you like what you see? Tell someone else! Volunteer. Visit the website www.Harveyphotos.co
  • Share the Indiegogo campaign with everyone you know that loves art adrenaline!
story_txt:
Short Summary Nude Art Re:Public Philadelphia, will be the first Episode of a "behind the scenes" look at how these photographs are created.  I'm Harvey, your friendly public nude artist, known for "pulling off" the photos that have become known over the last 22 years across North America. With 30 cities, 2500+ locations and approximately 4,000 volunteers, I can say I've written the book on Pubic Nudity. Now I'm going to take this rare art form to the next level, with the use of modern technology and the help of a full crew. 
I want to capture the beauty of Philadelphia, and pay proper respect to the tradition and history of this rich source of what makes me proud to be an American! With proper planning and execution, and a well-trained crew (5 people and myself), I could shoot 100 locations in just two weeks. This would take me months or even years on my own.
 Help contribute to the making of Art History! When you see the news coverage, you can smile knowing you helped make it happen.

We are planning to depart on the morning of May 12th, (2016) and return on May 26th. 3 Major Festivals begin on May 21 .  What We Need & What You Get
 Where the money will be used:  
I need $36,000 to upgrade my equipment and bring a crew to Philadelphia for two weeks.
My current equipment consists of a 10-year-old Nikon P100, I paid $84 for it at a pawn shop in Detroit three years ago when I went "digital". I use a Hero 2 GoPro for video capture.
The quality of the images have suffered greatly in some circumstances because I have to shoot "on the run" without a tripod, and using the cheap digital camera without digital stabilization can sometimes be a waste of effort on everyone's behalf. Also, using my antiquated GoPro camera draws a lot of attention; the chest strap looks like I'm wearing a gun holster from behind, and the camera itself sticks out like a sore thumb - when the point is to try to operate in stealth. I have done my homework, and have come to the conclusion that following equipment is ideally suited for my needs:
Sony - HDR-AS50R HD Action Camera - Black Model: HDRAS50R/B with digital stabilization and high definition will allow for crystal clear video captures of the entire process, even "on the run." Five cameras (controllable from one wrist unit) 5 x $250 = $1250. Wrist unit = $100. Total= $1350.
Wireless-hands-free communication system: Motorola sells a walkie-talkie system that will allow the team to communicate with each other at a distance of up to a quarter mile. The cost is $250 for the four person communication package. 
Apple - MacBook® Pro - 15.4" Display - Intel Core i7 - 16GB Memory - 1TB Flash Storage - Silver Model: Z0RG1LL/A This will allow us the capacity to edit video on site, and to broadcast "live" on the Internet. $3199.99

Of course the daily expenses of food, transportation, lodging, parking, gas and a dozen small "nickle and dime" things (e.g. laundry, snacks, tips, bottled water) are a significant part of the expense of this trip. The bulk of the budget will go to the crew: five very skilled people will have to commit two weeks of their lives to this project. One, the video editor, will continue on for several days after the visit. For the crew portion of the budget I have set aside $15,000. This budget, distributed proportionately, will allow me to compensate the crew fairly for each of their roles. 


Lodging: $3000
Food: $ 3000
Car rentals: $2500

SD cards $1500
Cameras, laptop, printer and video equipment listed above: $5550

TOTAL= $36,000 
If we don't reach our entire goal, the funds will go toward upgrading the equipment, e.g. just 1 camera and 1 video and I would go alone or with just one other person, and shoot as much as I can. This is the way I've been doing it for 22 years. At least the new equipment would ensure better quality shots, even if there are fewer taken. 

The perks we offer are some of the most unique you will find. From collectible postcards, limited edition images, access to behind the scenes videos and the opportunity for you to "pick a location".

I just like to execute these photos so quickly that no uninformed police officer makes an arrest that will eventually be dismissed, but will cost the team valuable time and resources.


In the past, the main challenge was manpower. story:
I first got involved in CAD 3D modelling and jewellery design in 1994, and have combined my many years of experience in creating a design which is unique, sophisticated and modern.

As a pioneer of 3d printing in jewellery since 2001, I have continued to develop my skills, becoming a specialist in the 3D printing industry.

I have a great creative passion, and wanted to showcase the skills I’ve mastered by creating a piece which demonstrates the uniqueness and complexity of the heart as it is the centre of our emotions.

The pendants are made in the UK, cast in Sterling silver and laser hallmarked with my unique makers mark, by the London Assay office.

                      

What We Need & What You Get

As a startup project we need funding to produce more of the current designs and develop new designs as a start up business.

  • You will receive access to designs at a reduced price from a industry expert starting out on his own projects.
  • They are unique designs that utilise the latest cutting edge 3D technology, combined with highly skilled craftsmanship.
  • Heart pendants are also unisex in design.
  • Funds will go towards production and material costs and the development of new designs.

                              

  • Feminine half of heart.                                                                                                   Weighs 10 grams of Sterling Silver which is laser Hallmarked with my markers Hallmark                                    Dimensions 38.3 mm x 19.6 mm x 9 mm
  • Masculine half of heart.                                                                                                     Weighs 16 grams of Sterling Silver which is laser Hallmarked with my markers Hallmark                                    Dimensions 42.9 mm x 21.2 mm x 12.4 mm

story: Two detectives have accused Anderson of crimes he didn't commit. His only choice now is to take matters into his own hands to clear his name.  Can he do it?
story_txt: Two detectives have accused Anderson of crimes he didn't commit. His only choice now is to take matters into his own hands to clear his name.  Can he do it?

story:
America Made Me Black is a documentary that aims to highlight the relational tensions present within the black community in America.The film follows MaryBeth Omido, a first-generation Kenyan-American who has experienced these tensions in her own life and wrestles with where she belongs as a "third culture kid".  Seeking to dive into the conversation of blackness in America, MaryBeth hears stories from black Americans, African immigrants, and Afro-latinos about how they have walked through these tensions and what it means to be black in America.


What We Need & What You Get

  •  We've stayed pretty local, interviewing people and attending events in Oklahoma and Kansas.  However, this conversation is bigger than the midwest, and we would love to be able to broaden the scope of the documentary and interview people who live in various parts of the country.  In order to do that we will need to raise funds to travel, and depending on how much we raise, we would also love the opportunity to travel outside the USA so that we can document what blackness looks like outside of America and how the American perception of blackness has influenced cultures worldwide. 
  • One of our goals with this documentary is to submit it into various film festivals around the country. Many of these film festivals have submission fees that we would like to get covered through this campaign. 
  • We have a number of fun perks that you get as a contributor. From buttons and stickers, to t-shirts and photo books! Be sure to check 'em out on the next page! 

The Impact

Over the last few months we have been blown away by the amazing people who have shared their experiences with us - the stories and struggles of so many people who are working out all the nuances of the black identity in America. Our hope for this documentary is that it will start a conversation about the walls that people put around themselves and others. Yes, this documentary focuses on the walls that are found in the black community, but these same walls exist in other racial and ethnic groups in America.  We want this documentary to acknowledge these walls and act as a launchpad for those who wish to tear them down.  


Other Ways You Can Help

Share the campaign with your friends and follow us on social media! 

  • Website// americamademeblack.com
  • Facebook// America Made Me Black
  • Twitter// @americamademe
  • Instagram// @americamademeblack 
  • Remember//Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
From the makers of Dishonoured comes this new romantic comedy...

Film Synopsis....

Jack Green is a successful and very wealthy businessman who has everything money can buy - the big houses, holiday homes, expensive fast and luxurious cars, jet planes, yachts - you name it, he has it all...

But the one thing he so desperately wants is something that money simply cannot buy... true love!

With just his closest friends Rose and LJ, both guiding him into finding a girl that loves him and not his wealth, this romantic comedy will take us on a journey we shall never forget as Jack tries to take both their conflicting advice resulting in hilarious consequences! 

Stephan Genovese
(Writer, Executive Producer & Lead Actor)

Stephan was born and bred in Holbeach, Lincs, and has been involved in the entertainment industry for many years. In the last few years, Steph has been involved in film and tv, and was recently in Sky Atlantic's Fortitude, The new Huntsman Movie as a Huntsman, and also the new Pan movie to name a few recent projects.

Natalie Rose Mills
(Producer, Script Editor & Lead Actress)

Natalie was born in West Ham and has had a passion for acting for many years, and up until recently has mainly been a stage actress, before appearing in the movie Dishonoured and also the Goob. Natalie has also taken part in short movies and is now bringing her experience of stage to the big screen in her first movie starring role.

Whats the funding for?
Because the film is being made on a voluntary level, our costs are very minimalistic compared to most movies, as we only require funding for insurance, locations, props and costumes which we are unable to get for free.

story:
Tales of the Sword: "Exit Strategy"

Each episode of Tales is a stand-alone short focusing on a different time period and weapon.  

In Episode One:  "A Lady's Honor," we focused on America circa 1790 with the Spadroon and Dagger as the featured weapons. 

Watch Episode One Here: 
Tales of the Sword: "A Lady's Honor"

In Episode Two: "The Scarlet Stalker," we focused on a modern tale of Cosplay with the Broadsword as the featured weapon.

Watch Episode Two Here:
Tales of the Sword: "The Scarlet Stalker"

Now we're gearing up for Episode Three: "Exit Strategy," a Conan the Barbarian-esque fantasy featuring a variation on the Pudao.  

We'll have three main fighters again, two using the Pudao and the other using the Broadsword or Scimitar.  But we'll also have a large melee scene involving other fighters that our two heroes have to take on before they can get to the Boss Fight!  We'll be posting pre-production designs and rehearsal pics as the episode gets underway, so you'll be able to be part of the excitement as we plot the fun to come!


What We Need

We're starting with a $1000 goal, with stretch goals up to $9,000.


Why do we need so much?  Well, the last two episodes were one day shoots and had three characters on screen.  "Exit Strategy" is being planned as a two day shoot, and along with the three main characters, there's a number of other fighters.  This means we'll have a great melee battle to show you, but we've also got to feed, clothe, and pay the other fighters!

This episode also involves more complicated costume and production design, which means we'll need both a Costume Designer and Production Designer to figure things out, and money to make it all happen.  


We've got some great perks, but also keep in mind that at the end of this, you'll have an episode you can watch again and again!

story:
So who is the cast and crew behind The Last Day:

ANDY TURNER - COLT - Andy will be playing the lead in the film of Colt, a sociopath with an agenda, but is he all he seems.

http://www.3takesproductions.co.uk/

PETE NOAKES - BRAY - Colt’s 2nd in command, a former special ops fallen on hard times, doing a job he is reluctant to do and landing head first in an experience that nightmares are made of.

http://www.3takesproductions.co.uk/

ADI THOMPSON - JASON - A retired conglomerate type with a kinky and dangerous mind, Jason is a former titan of industry with secrets many would kill to get hold of.

http://www.3takesproductions.co.uk/

MATTHEW DYLON KNIGHT - CO-CREATOR/ WRITER/ DIRECTOR/ ACTOR/ EDITOR.

 Brewer of beer by day , Film maker by night like Batman, but only less serious...

During the day I make real Ale for a living, which is a fantastic, physical experience. (Even Kevin Smith had to start somewhere, right?)

After brewing throughout the day, My evenings are spent conjuring ideas and turning them into movies, this is how I started with a small movie here and there, soon before I knew it I was bitten and soon found myself as an extra in a few feature film productions such as The Convention of The Dead (Release date: TBA), the Harry Hill Movie (Release Date: Out Now) and the band Deaf Havana's music video Friends like these (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4zPmv2MC6I4, can be seen at 2;46 of the video's runtime)

It was at this point I decided that with what I had seen and learnt I wanted to take my skills one step further and develop my own feature film, hence why I am now asking for contributions to help make "The Last Day" a success story.

I have a long term goal and the Last Day is going to be the first of many features, so watch this space...


RITCHIE JOHNSTON - CO CREATOR/ WRITER/ EXECUTIVE PRODUCER.


This is Ritchies first full length feature film and his second shot project to date, his first was a pilot for a series called “The Guardian” a project currently being shot by Aturn Films in association with P.O.M.M Films and 3Takes Productions.

Ritchie has a deep love of film stemming back to childhood and it has always been his passion to deliver an on the edge of your seat experience with each of his projects.

His current portfolio consists of 20 Feature length and Pilot scripts. 

Ritchie has currently been writing since 2010.

JAMES KILCOIN- CINEMATOGRAPHY -

I am a full time professional wedding photographer in the Norwich and Norfolk area.

I love my job and couldn’t imagine doing anything else.

I try to be as discrete as possible while I document the day, capturing all the special moments which may pass you by during all of the excitement. When I am not photographing a wedding or editing, I like to get out on my mountain bike or go for a run. I also like to head out on the North Norfolk coast and take some landscape/seascape photographs. I find this a great way to practice with composition and lighting, which are both essential in wedding photography.


http://jameskphoto.co.uk/blog/hunstanton-at-sun...


LOCATIONS:

R.A.F Neatishead - RRH Neatishead is a Royal Air Force Remote Radar Head in the English county of Norfolk, East Anglia established during the Second World War. It consists of the main technical site, and a number of remote, and sometimes unmanned sites. (** source Wikipedia **)

The Fox and Hounds Pub in Heacham - https://www.facebook.com/Fox-Hounds-Heacham-64438071329/


Heacham, West Norfolk - Heacham is a town in West Norfolk, England, located beside The Wash, between King's Lynn, 14 miles to the south and Hunstanton, about 3 miles to the north. It has been a seaside resort for a century and a half. (** source Wikipedia **)


R.A.F Raynham - Royal Air Force West Raynham or more simply RAF West Raynham is a former Royal Air Force station located 2 miles west of West Raynham, Norfolk and 5.5 miles southwest of Fakenham, Norfolk, England. (**source Wikipedia**)


Segeford Hall, Sedgeford, Norfolk - A very warm welcome awaits you at my family home, Sedgeford Hall. Set in our 1200 acre farming and shooting estate in a beautiful North Norfolk Valley with rolling hills, yes in Norfolk, and fantastic scenery, Sedgeford Hall offers a truly superb house in which to holiday, celebrate, or entertain. (** source http://www.sedgefordhall.com **)


WHAT WE NEED YOUR MONEY FOR:

So, you’re asking why we need the cash?... That is a fair enough question to ask. Well, we are about to wrap up filming on the 25th of September 2016 and to ensure we can deliver a final scene truly worthy of a visual, shock and awe experience we need to raise a little fund for the make up and special effects on that day (The Last Day.. Of filming.. Like what I did there?)

The film has relied on using practical effects as the director prefers this to the use of c.g.i, we want to make it look as real as possible and that is where the contributions will make the difference.

Now, we want you to feel awesome for contributing so if you do; any contributor will get a thanks in the end credit of the movie. Not only that, from a donation of £20.00 onwards you will get a digital link to the film a week before the general release of the film, you will be the first to experience THE LAST DAY before anyone else (well except for the next awesome person who reads this and donates, then you get to watch it the same time as them, unless your friends and then why not make it a viewing party?!... Obviously feel free to invite us!) 

Like I said before, we have 90% in the can and a final shooting date and everything else is ready on the editing front, so at this point we are (pretty ballsy in saying it, but..) confident that the project is going to get finished regardless.


The only challenge, is that if the goal isn't met we just have to reduce the practical effects to meet the budget we have.

Of course you don't just have to contribute to help out, if you could share the trailer and this indiegogo across social media that contributes greatly to the cause, the more people that get to hear about the project the more buzz we can create.
story_txt:
So who is the cast and crew behind The Last Day:


ANDY TURNER - COLT - Andy will be playing the lead in the film of Colt, a sociopath with an agenda, but is he all he seems.
http://www.3takesproductions.co.uk/
PETE NOAKES - BRAY - Colt’s 2nd in command, a former special ops fallen on hard times, doing a job he is reluctant to do and landing head first in an experience that nightmares are made of.
http://www.3takesproductions.co.uk/
ADI THOMPSON - JASON - A retired conglomerate type with a kinky and dangerous mind, Jason is a former titan of industry with secrets many would kill to get hold of.
http://www.3takesproductions.co.uk/
MATTHEW DYLON KNIGHT - CO-CREATOR/ WRITER/ DIRECTOR/ ACTOR/ EDITOR.



 Brewer of beer by day , Film maker by night like Batman, but only less serious...During the day I make real Ale for a living, which is a fantastic, physical experience. (Even Kevin Smith had to start somewhere, right?)After brewing throughout the day, My evenings are spent conjuring ideas and turning them into movies, this is how I started with a small movie here and there, soon before I knew it I was bitten and soon found myself as an extra in a few feature film productions such as The Convention of The Dead (Release date: TBA), the Harry Hill Movie (Release Date: Out Now) and the band Deaf Havana's music video Friends like these (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4zPmv2MC6I4, can be seen at 2;46 of the video's runtime)It was at this point I decided that with what I had seen and learnt I wanted to take my skills one step further and develop my own feature film, hence why I am now asking for contributions to help make "The Last Day" a success story.I have a long term goal and the Last Day is going to be the first of many features, so watch this space...


RITCHIE JOHNSTON - CO CREATOR/ WRITER/ EXECUTIVE PRODUCER.


This is Ritchies first full length feature film and his second shot project to date, his first was a pilot for a series called “The Guardian” a project currently being shot by Aturn Films in association with P.O.M.M Films and 3Takes Productions.
Ritchie has a deep love of film stemming back to childhood and it has always been his passion to deliver an on the edge of your seat experience with each of his projects.
His current portfolio consists of 20 Feature length and Pilot scripts. 
Ritchie has currently been writing since 2010.
JAMES KILCOIN- CINEMATOGRAPHY - 

I am a full time professional wedding photographer in the Norwich and Norfolk area.
I love my job and couldn’t imagine doing anything else. 
I try to be as discrete as possible while I document the day, 
capturing all the special moments which may pass you by during all of 
the excitement. When I am not photographing a wedding or editing, I like
 to get out on my mountain bike or go for a run. I also like to head out
 on the North Norfolk coast and take some landscape/seascape 
photographs. I find this a great way to practice with composition and 
lighting, which are both essential in wedding photography.

http://jameskphoto.co.uk/blog/hunstanton-at-sun...

LOCATIONS:

R.A.F Neatishead - RRH Neatishead is a Royal Air Force Remote Radar Head in the English county of Norfolk, East Anglia established during the Second World War. It consists of the main technical site, and a number of remote, and sometimes unmanned sites. (** source Wikipedia **)


The Fox and Hounds Pub in Heacham - https://www.facebook.com/Fox-Hounds-Heacham-64438071329/


Heacham, West Norfolk - Heacham is a town in West Norfolk, England, located beside The Wash, between King's Lynn, 14 miles to the south and Hunstanton, about 3 miles to the north. It has been a seaside resort for a century and a half. (** source Wikipedia **)



R.A.F Raynham - Royal Air Force West Raynham or more simply RAF West Raynham is a former Royal Air Force station located 2 miles west of West Raynham, Norfolk and 5.5 miles southwest of Fakenham, Norfolk, England. (**source Wikipedia**)



Segeford Hall, Sedgeford, Norfolk - A very warm welcome awaits you at my family home, Sedgeford Hall. Set in our 1200 acre farming and shooting estate in a beautiful North Norfolk Valley with rolling hills, yes in Norfolk, and fantastic scenery, Sedgeford Hall offers a truly superb house in which to holiday, celebrate, or entertain. (** source http://www.sedgefordhall.com **)






WHAT WE NEED YOUR MONEY FOR:
So, you’re asking why we need the cash?... That is a fair enough question to ask. Well, we are about to wrap up filming on the 25th of September 2016 and to ensure we can deliver a final scene truly worthy of a visual, shock and awe experience we need to raise a little fund for the make up and special effects on that day (The Last Day.. Of filming.. Like what I did there?)
The film has relied on using practical effects as the director prefers this to the use of c.g.i, we want to make it look as real as possible and that is where the contributions will make the difference.
Now, we want you to feel awesome for contributing so if you do; any contributor will get a thanks in the end credit of the movie. Not only that, from a donation of £20.00 onwards you will get a digital link to the film a week before the general release of the film, you will be the first to experience THE LAST DAY before anyone else (well except for the next awesome person who reads this and donates, then you get to watch it the same time as them, unless your friends and then why not make it a viewing party?!... Obviously feel free to invite us!) 
Like I said before, we have 90% in the can and a final shooting date and everything else is ready on the editing front, so at this point we are (pretty ballsy in saying it, but..) confident that the project is going to get finished regardless.

The only challenge, is that if the goal isn't met we just have to reduce the practical effects to meet the budget we have.
Of course you don't just have to contribute to help out, if you could share the trailer and this indiegogo across social media that contributes greatly to the cause, the more people that get to hear about the project the more buzz we can create.

story: I created this drink to make a change, a change in the way people think and feel. Brainstorm energy drink not only gives you increased energy and mental focus, but it also includes key brain boosting supplements, B-vitamins and natural blueberry fruit extract to help memory and cognitive responses. This has been said before but this is not just another energy drink. I started Brainstorm when I was a student meanwhile working at a local vitamin store. The strain school and work put on me was immense. At the end of each long day when it came time to study I took brain boosting supplements and energy drinks to keep me awake. The brilliant idea came to mind. There is nothing similar to Brainstorm on the market today. After months of research and hardwork I decided to pursue this dream.

story:
Objective: Create an Action/ Adventure/ Sci-fi short film that would be entered into film festivals and would serve as a proof of concept for the much larger story.

 

Parameters:

        -Must have Epic landscapes

        -Must incorporate VFX

        -Must be shot in the Air, on Land and in Water

        -Must have Stunts

        -Must be done on a Micro Budget

 

So Valcorian was structured in such a way that it could be shot in few remote desert locations and in the kelp forest at the bottom of the Pacific Ocean.

 

Synopsis:

In a post-apocalyptic future, a fearless drone hunter embarks on a solo mission to activate a satellite transmitter far beyond the protection of his team. The predator becomes the prey in this nail biting manhunt.   

 

Shooting a Movie:

We knew we had set mammoth challenges for ourselves, but the adventure was too great to pass up. We ended up facing even greater challenges than we had anticipated: two multi-day location scoutings throughout the American Southwest, one horrible day of location scouting in the Pacific which destroyed a camera and various other pieces of equipment, three desert locations, one vehicle breaking down on the highway costing us half of a shoot day, another vehicle getting stuck in the desert, a technical camera failure during a big stunt, crew getting lost in the desert, cold pizzas served three hours after scheduled lunch, a dusty overnighter in a downtown Los Angeles warehouse, one day at sea, never enough hours of daylight, crappy hotel/night in the car, cheap food, sleepless nights and all the usual shortcomings of a shoestring budget short film.

 

However, we assembled a team of very talented and driven filmmakers who could think outside of the box and overcome these hurdles. We faced adversity along the way but did everything possible not to compromise the quality of images we were taking into the edit room, and we are very happy we did because it looks awesome.


 

Why We Are Raising Funds:

As of now, Valcorian has been completely self funded and with over 120 VFX shots and shooting underwater, it hasn’t been cheap. We are in the last stages of post production and we need to finish even stronger than we started. We want to give the film the same attention to quality that we did when capturing it, but the load has been heavy and that’s where your help is needed.

The money raised will be allocated to these remaining areas as follows:

        -40% goes towards Sound(Score, SFX, Surround Sound Mastering)

        -40% goes towards VFX

        -10% goes towards Color Grading

        -10% goes towards Film Festival Submissions and Promotions


Please take a look at our pledges and see which best suits you. Whether you pledge $29, $5 or just Share the link, your support is appreciated. We invite you to join us on Facebook https://www.facebook.com/Valcorian-160209810335... . We will be posting pictures and reporting back to fans on our film festival progress as things unfold. We’d love for you to be a part of the Valcorian experience.

The Team:

        

        

        

 

           

         

      

We cannot wait to see Valcorian completed and show all of you what you’ve helped make.

Thank you for your time,

Sincerely,

Team Valcorian

story:
Who Are We?

Tall, Tan, Young and Lovely Film Productions is a coordinated effort from youthful film makers in the Seattle Area. Our team is made up of motivated and talented individuals and artists alike, with a common vision in mind.  

Writer/Director: Born in Brooklyn, Leo Galen grew up as a visual artist drawing since the age of 2. His work has been featured in the Seattle Art Museum and Bespoke Test Prep Books as well as the Ballard Talisman school newspaper.

Director of Photography: Sebastian Mesler is an award winning filmmaker, his films have been featured in various festival including the National Film Festival for Talented Youth (NFFTY). You can find his work here: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCqb-tsRujsX-wi...

Camera: Miles Andersen is another accomplished filmmaker from the Seattle area. His works have also been featured in NFFTY alongside Mesler's. You can catch Miles Andersen's award winning music video "Hologram" here: https://vimeo.com/150612313

A couple of Miles Andersen's awards include:

Award of Excellence, Music Video - Northwest High School Film Festival

Student Production Award, Photographer/Editor - Northwest Regional Emmy Awards
Best of Show - Eppfilms & Artistic by Design Center 2015 Film & Photography Showcase
Official Selection - National Film Festival for Talented Youth

Art Director: Emma Obrietan is another visual artist, whose work has also been on display in the Seattle Art Museum. 

Audio Technician/ Composer: Practically born in front of the keyboard, Scotty Mckinney has been making amazing music for as long as anyone can remember. He is the lead singer and keyboard artist of the small Seattle band, 400-40. You can catch a recording of their live set at Egan's Jam House here

Best Boy: Jesse Romero, our "Best Boy", worked with Miles Andersen on the music video Hologram. She has also received numerous honorable mentions from the Northwest High School Film Festival.

Jesse's awards include:

Award of Excellence, Music Video - Northwest High School Film Festival Student Production Award, Photographer/Editor - Northwest Regional Emmy Awards
Best of Show - Eppfilms & Artistic by Design Center 2015 Film & Photography Showcase
Official Selection - National Film Festival for Talented Youth

Producer: Beyond simply being an integral part of our team, producer Katy Baker has wrote, directed, and starred in several short films of her own, including one on Earth's most valuable resource, water. 

What We Need & What You Get

We're looking for 8,000 USD, yes 8,000 dollars. While it might seem like a whopping amount, film making is expensive, and the costs of equipment and lodging are a serious burden for the wallet of a teenager. Your contributions to our project however, will be handsomely rewarded. Any money you send our way will be greatly appreciated, and all contributors are, in our minds, part of the team.

Beach Club

Beach Club is more than a movie. This project is not only TTYL's initial step into the movie industry as a production company, but also a work of inspiration for other young dreamers.  Our goal is for the audience not to be able to tell that this is a super low budget film made in one month. Of course challenges come with that, but we hope that with your support we can prove that not every movie has to be made by a middle aged man backed by a multi-million dollar corporation. Beach Club is not just about the futility of human desire, but also about film as an art form instead of a corporate venture. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If your wallet is feeling awfully light, don't fret, we relate. You're playing a part in our cause simply by sharing this link and telling your friends about our project!

Thanks for reading, we hope you can help us make our dreams come true.

story:
Forever! Or Almost...


Brève description du projet (Brief description of our project)
"Inspiré de millions d'histoires vraies..."

Il s'agit donc d'un projet de court-métrage de fiction qui devrait durer environ 30 minutes et dont le tournage s'étalera sur 10 jours, entre la fin du mois de mai et le début du mois de juin.

Nous souhaitons ensuite faire vivre ce film dans d'autres événements et festivals!

Aidez-nous à concrétiser notre beau projet!

--------------------

"Inspired by millions of true story..."

This project consists of a 30 min fiction short-film for which production should last 10 days, with shooting starting around the end of May and ending at the beginning of June.

We then wish to share this film throughout numerous events and festivals! Please, help make this wonderful project of ours reality!


Synopsis :
Aveuglé par le tourment causé par le départ de Mélanie, Martin se lance dans une quête de réponses qui l'amènera à découvrir un douloureux secret. Avec l'aide de ses amis, Julien et Léa, Martin est prêt à tout pour donner un sens à cette rupture, qui est pour lui insurmontable. C'est alors que commence une aventure insensée qui mènera Martin dans des situations absurdes. De la colère à la tristesse, il passera aussi par le désir de la reconquérir pour parvenir à aller de l'avant...


Note d'intention (Our intentions) :

Forever! Or Almost… est le résultat de nombreuses versions d’écriture dont les premières ébauches ont été faites il y a trois ans. À l’époque le film n’était alors qu’un très court-métrage d’une dizaine de minutes. Quelques années plus tard, le scénario original fut repris, modifié et amélioré, pour former la version actuelle du projet, triplant également sa durée (30 minutes). 

Forever! Or Almost… traite principalement de la rupture amoureuse et à été écrit en réponse à cet événement qui survient dans la vie de tout le monde un jour ou l’autre. Il est donc basé sur des faits réels mais reste tout de même un film de fiction. C’est ainsi que le film s’appuie sur la phrase finale « Inspiré de millions d’histoires vraies… ». Le film s’inspire également d’événement réellement vécus par ses co-réalisateurs ce qui lui donne un ton plus personnel par moments.

Le choix de traiter l’histoire par le biais du personnage masculin était d’amener un regard nouveau sur un sujet le plus souvent traité du point de vue de la femme. Le film vient alors montrer que ce n’est pas toujours l’homme qui est en tord comme semble le montrer la plupart des films hollywoodiens actuellement à la mode. Ce film dépeint le portrait d’un jeune homme de nos jours qui tente de trouver sa place à travers les relations interpersonnelles. 


Le choix de tourner ce film en anglais a été pris très rapidement, dès l’écriture, bien que le scénario ait été écrit en français puis adapté à l’anglais dans un second temps. Ce choix s’explique notamment par le fait que le sujet traité dans le film est un sujet sans frontière, qui arrive à tout le monde et que l’anglais était la langue la plus appropriée pour que le film puisse être vu  et compris dans le monde entier.



Qui sommes nous ? (Who are we?)

BIO DE MARIE

Jeune français expatrié au Québec depuis près de 5 ans, Valentin Verrier est actuellement étudiant en cinéma à l’Université de Montréal, après avoir travaillé comme reporter-monteur et producteur exécutif en France pour LMDL production qu’il avait co-fondée. Suite à ses envies d’entreprendre la production cinématographique au Québec, il co-fondera Welcome Aboard en septembre 2015 avec Stéphanie Demers-Hébert. Lui donnant alors la possibilité d’exercer le poste de producteur délégué mais aussi de s’essayer à la réalisation de projets de fiction tel que Forever! Or Almost… . Le Jouet Extraordinaire est quant à lui le deuxième film dont il endosse le rôle de producteur délégué.


Notre équipe (Our team):

Jeunes et passionnés par le cinéma, les membres de notre équipe ont tous en tête le même but : réaliser un film professionnel en se basant sur nos expériences passées sur d'autres productions ainsi que sur celles acquises lors de nos études. Ce projet est également rassembleur car toutes les Universités montréalaises sont représentées au sein de notre équipe.

Welcome Aboard est un organisme de production et de distribution cinématographique créé par Stéphanie Demers-Hébert et Valentin Verrier en Septembre 2015. Forever! Or Almost... est son second projet de production, précédé par le court-métrage Notre histoire, réalisé par Romain Ebran en 2015. En parallèle, Welcome Aboard se charge de la distribution de projets tel que le court-métrage Contretemps, réalisé par Claire Bottalico.

Nous sommes également soutenus par Aino Creation Studio qui réalisera les effets visuels et le générique de fin du film!




Pourquoi nous aider ? (Why help us?)

Votre impact est concret et va nous être très utile.

En effet, nous avons besoin de financement principalement pour la location du matériel technique, pour l'achat des accessoires, des costumes et des décors, ainsi que les autres frais relatifs à la nourriture, aux transports, aux droits musicaux etc.

Notre projet est ambitieux : l'histoire se déploie dans plusieurs décors publiques qu'ils soient extérieurs ou intérieurs qui demandent des permis et autorisations. Nous sommes très conscients du fait qu'un tel projet demande un investissement important et des moyens conséquents. Votre aide financière nous permettra de concrétiser nos intentions afin de donner le meilleur résultat possible.

En contribuant, vous nous permettrez donc de faire de ce projet la meilleure expérience cinématographique possible! Vous pouvez être assurés de faire une différence, chaque dollar ira directement à l'écran!


 

Restez informé sur le projet (Stay informed on the project):

Suivez-nous pour tout savoir sur l'actualité et l'avancement du projet, voir de magnifiques photos et avoir l'impression d'être sur le plateau de tournage  !

Facebook : https://www.facebook.com/foreveroralmostmovie/

Album photo :  À venir... 

--------------------

Follow us to stay informed on the project's numerous production states, see different production stills, etc. It'll be as if you were on set with us!

Facebook : https://www.facebook.com/foreveroralmostmovie/

Photo album: coming soon... 


D'autres façons de nous aider (Other ways to help us):

Si vous ne pouvez pas contribuer financièrement, vous pouvez quand même être utiles pour le film :

  • Partager cette page de socio-financement  sur vos réseaux et auprès de vos proches.
  • Faites du bouche-à-oreille !
  • Venez visiter, liker et partager notre page Facebook.
  • N'hésitez pas à nous encourager ! :)

 Merci de votre aide !!

--------------------

If you can't be financially support us, rest assured that you can still very much help us:

  • By sharing this socio-financing page with your close relatives.
  • Word of mouth!
  • Visit, like and share our Facebook page.

Avec l'aide de ses amis, Julien et Léa, Martin est prêt à tout pour donner un sens à cette rupture, qui est pour lui insurmontable. C'est alors que commence une aventure insensée qui mènera Martin dans des situations absurdes. De la colère à la tristesse, il passera aussi par le désir de la reconquérir pour parvenir à aller de l'avant...


Note d'intention (Our intentions) :




Forever! Or Almost… est le résultat de nombreuses versions d’écriture dont les premières ébauches ont été faites il y a trois ans. À l’époque le film n’était alors qu’un très court-métrage d’une dizaine de minutes. Quelques années plus tard, le scénario original fut repris, modifié et amélioré, pour former la version actuelle du projet, triplant également sa durée (30 minutes). 
Forever! Or Almost… traite principalement de la rupture amoureuse et à été écrit en réponse à cet événement qui survient dans la vie de tout le monde un jour ou l’autre. Il est donc basé sur des faits réels mais reste tout de même un film de fiction. C’est ainsi que le film s’appuie sur la phrase finale « Inspiré de millions d’histoires vraies… ». Le film s’inspire également d’événement réellement vécus par ses co-réalisateurs ce qui lui donne un ton plus personnel par moments.
Le choix de traiter l’histoire par le biais du personnage masculin était d’amener un regard nouveau sur un sujet le plus souvent traité du point de vue de la femme. Le film vient alors montrer que ce n’est pas toujours l’homme qui est en tord comme semble le montrer la plupart des films hollywoodiens actuellement à la mode. Ce film dépeint le portrait d’un jeune homme de nos jours qui tente de trouver sa place à travers les relations interpersonnelles. 

Le choix de tourner ce film en anglais a été pris très rapidement, dès l’écriture, bien que le scénario ait été écrit en français puis adapté à l’anglais dans un second temps. Ce choix s’explique notamment par le fait que le sujet traité dans le film est un sujet sans frontière, qui arrive à tout le monde et que l’anglais était la langue la plus appropriée pour que le film puisse être vu  et compris dans le monde entier.




Qui sommes nous ? (Who are we?)




BIO DE MARIE


Jeune français expatrié au Québec depuis près de 5 ans, Valentin Verrier est actuellement étudiant en cinéma à l’Université de Montréal, après avoir travaillé comme reporter-monteur et producteur exécutif en France pour LMDL production qu’il avait co-fondée. Suite à ses envies d’entreprendre la production cinématographique au Québec, il co-fondera Welcome Aboard en septembre 2015 avec Stéphanie Demers-Hébert. Lui donnant alors la possibilité d’exercer le poste de producteur délégué mais aussi de s’essayer à la réalisation de projets de fiction tel que Forever! Or Almost… . Le Jouet Extraordinaire est quant à lui le deuxième film dont il endosse le rôle de producteur délégué.
Notre équipe (Our team):
Jeunes et passionnés par le cinéma, les membres de notre équipe ont tous en tête le même but : réaliser un film professionnel en se basant sur nos expériences passées sur d'autres productions ainsi que sur celles acquises lors de nos études. Ce projet est également rassembleur car toutes les Universités montréalaises sont représentées au sein de notre équipe.


Welcome Aboard est un organisme de production et de distribution cinématographique créé par Stéphanie Demers-Hébert et Valentin Verrier en Septembre 2015. Forever! Or Almost... est son second projet de production, précédé par le court-métrage Notre histoire, réalisé par Romain Ebran en 2015. En parallèle, Welcome Aboard se charge de la distribution de projets tel que le court-métrage Contretemps, réalisé par Claire Bottalico.
Nous sommes également soutenus par Aino Creation Studio qui réalisera les effets visuels et le générique de fin du film!




Pourquoi nous aider ? (Why help us?)
Votre impact est concret et va nous être très utile.
En effet, nous avons besoin de financement principalement pour la location du matériel technique, pour l'achat des accessoires, des costumes et des décors, ainsi que les autres frais relatifs à la nourriture, aux transports, aux droits musicaux etc.
Notre projet est ambitieux : l'histoire se déploie dans plusieurs décors publiques qu'ils soient extérieurs ou intérieurs qui demandent des permis et autorisations. Nous sommes très conscients du fait qu'un tel projet demande un investissement important et des moyens conséquents. Votre aide financière nous permettra de concrétiser nos intentions afin de donner le meilleur résultat possible.
En contribuant, vous nous permettrez donc de faire de ce projet la meilleure expérience cinématographique possible! Vous pouvez être assurés de faire une différence, chaque dollar ira directement à l'écran!



 

Restez informé sur le projet (Stay informed on the project):
Suivez-nous pour tout savoir sur l'actualité et l'avancement du projet, voir de magnifiques photos et avoir l'impression d'être sur le plateau de tournage  !
Facebook : https://www.facebook.com/foreveroralmostmovie/
Album photo :  À venir... 
--------------------
Follow us to stay informed on the project's numerous production states, see different production stills, etc. It'll be as if you were on set with us!

Facebook : https://www.facebook.com/foreveroralmostmovie/
Photo album: coming soon... 

D'autres façons de nous aider (Other ways to help us):

Si vous ne pouvez pas contribuer financièrement, vous pouvez quand même être utiles pour le film :
Partager cette page de socio-financement  sur vos réseaux et auprès de vos proches.
Faites du bouche-à-oreille !
Venez visiter, liker et partager notre page Facebook.
N'hésitez pas à nous encourager ! :)
 Merci de votre aide !!--------------------If you can't be financially support us, rest assured that you can still very much help us:
By sharing this socio-financing page with your close relatives.
Word of mouth!

Visit, like and share our Facebook page.

story:
The Story

WHERE OUR WORLDS MEET is a short dramatic film about a gay man who struggles with the death of his fiancé and decides to become a Buddhist monk to help his partner cross over.

The story is inspired by a personal tragedy where I wasn't allow to visit the love-of-my-life when he died of AIDS in the hospital in Atlanta, GA in 2005.  His family shut me out of the ICU so I never had closure. This film is my goodbye love letter to him.

The screenplay was a finalist in the 2015 Austin Film Festival Screenwriting Competition.  The last LGBT feature film I helped produced (Associate Producer) I LOVE YOU BOTH (2016) won the New Vision Award at Cinequest and is currently doing the festival circuit.  In 2014, I was chosen as one of the fellows to attend a two day workshop at FUSION: Outfest.  

I came to Hollywood as an actor in 2006, and found a lack of roles for Asian actors.  I was heartbroken, disillusioned and disenfranchised.  I resolved to create opportunities for myself and went back to school to study film production at Santa Monica College's Film Program.  Now my goal is to develop a platform that can showcase starving Asian talent in Hollywood.

This film is a culmination of both my life experience and my hard work. Your contributions will help us do justice to this unique yet universal love story.  I’ve been told this story is monumental work for the LGBT community of Southeast Asian descent.  I want to give gay Asians stories that reflect our complexities.You will also help us make this film that shines light on homophobia within the Latino community, pushes the envelope on gay spirituality within the Southeast Asian Buddhist community and advances the diversity conversation in Hollywood.

A YEAR AGO WE SHOT A PROOF-OF-CONCEPT VIDEO.

NOW WE NEED YOUR HELP TO TURN THIS CONCEPT INTO A FILM.

HOW DOES YOUR DONATION HELP AND WHAT DO YOU GET FOR IT!?

Your donation funds the entire production until the film is in your inbox! You're basically paying in advance to see this film, plus getting other cool rewards, too!

This includes all phases of production starting in September 2016 through final submissions to film festivals in 2017. Our goal is to shoot for 8 days in September. Thanks to flexible funding we get to keep whatever donations we receive, so if we don't meet our funding goal we STILL get to make the movie! YES!! And you'll still get to see it! BUT:

If we don't make our full funding goal, we will have to make serious changes to the script, cut down the schedule, and shoot with less-fancy equipment so that we can afford to produce it and we don't want to do that! We have worked so hard over the past three years.  This is an epic short film and we want to make the best version of this movie possible! That means we really need to meet our goal!  

WE REALLY NEED YOUR HELP TO MAKE THAT HAPPEN! What we need are:

1. Donations.

2. Sharing on social media/email.

In return for your donations, we have all kinds of rewards, as you'll see to the right, including being the first to see the finished film! 

EVERY DONATION MATTERS! Not just because of the money, but for the support in general and to raise our number of backers. And if you simply cannot donate even $1, but you love the project as much as we do, PLEASE SHARE ON YOUR SOCIAL MEDIA BY CLICKING THE "SHARE TOOLS" ABOVE AND ASK YOUR FRIENDS TO DO THE SAME! A LITTLE GOES A LONG WAY! 

Ultimately, our goal is for this film to get programmed at a major film festival, so we can reach a large audience and hopefully find distribution!

WHO ARE WE!? 

  SINAKHONE KEODARA - WRITER / DIRECTOR / PRODUCER

Sinakhone is a recognized screenwriter and award-winning producer.  In 2015, his screenplay for WHERE OUR WORLDS MEET placed as a finalist at the Austin Film Festival's Teleplay & Screenplay competition. Sinakhone was chosen as one of the fellows to attend the NBCUniveral Talent Lab as part of the Fusion: Outfest Film Festival in the spring of 2014.  He was educated at Santa Monica College's Film Program where he focused on directing, producing and screenwriting. In 2015, Sinakhone associate produced LGBT comedy I LOVE YOU BOTH (2016) that won New Vision Award at Cinequest Film Festival and is currently making the festival circuit. 

  CHRISTINE NG - DIRECTOR OF PHOTOGRAPHY

Christine Ng is a New York based director of photography and a graduate from New York University’s Tisch School of the Arts. Since beginning her career as a DP, Christine has shot various commercials, music videos, and independent film projects, both documentary and narrative. 

The first commercial she shot, Honda’s 50 states aired during Super Bowl XLVI. The web series, The Better Half, which she co-created, executive produced and DP’ed garnered rave reviews in IndieWire and the Huffington Post. Her first narrative feature, The Widowers, premiered at the San Antonio Film Festival and her first feature-length documentary, Everything is Copy: Nora Ephron Scripted and Unscripted, which she co DP’ed with Bradford Young premiered on HBO.  

Steffinnie Phrommany as Channapha

Laos born actress Steffinnie Phrommany started her career on stage but much of her work now is in Film, TV, and Commercials but she occasionally makes her way back to the stage.

She is known for her work in “The Advocate”, “Adulterers” and “Teeth and Blood.” She has recently been cast as Leading Lady, “Susie” in the pilot “Marlo Lasker” and as the Lead in an “Untitled Web Series” both to be filmed this summer. You will also see her in upcoming Intel print ads.

Her full list of credits can be seen at http://IMDb.me/steffinnie

She met her husband working on a production in Paris, France and now has two beautiful children whom she adores. She is a Foodie at heart and a self-taught Chef.

She is eager to further her acting career and bring more awareness to the Lao community.

What We Need, Where The Money Goes

We have applied for ScreenCraft's $20,000 Short Film Production Fund as matching funds.  

Here is a breakdown of where your money will go! We will pull as many favors as possible for free locations, but at the end of the day, the cost of making a movie adds up, especially when you want top-tier talents.  

CAST  (Our Director will have to play himself in a movie about him if we don't make our goal; we don't want to go that route!):  $1,200

CREW (8 days of camera crew, hair and makeup, sound, etc.! ):  $8,335

EQUIPMENT AND SET OPERATIONS (8 days of camera, lights, transportation!): $11,840

LOCATION (plus Stage/Green Screen): $9,580

OTHER PRODUCTION EXPENSES (insurance, permits, food, loss & damage, etc.): $3,100

POST (CGI, SFX, editing, coloring, sound, video delivery): $3,100

FILM FESTIVAL SUBMISSION COSTS: $2,000

INDIEGOGO'S FEE (5% of what we raise): $1,975

CREDIT CARD FEES (3% of what we raise): $1,185

TOTAL = $42,315

The Impact

This story is important because it tells how a Southeast Asian gay man who happens to be Buddhist deals with grief and how he goes about finding closure. The story also fosters a lot of Lao culture and the contributor can even learn something from other cultures by looking not at our differences but the similarities we all share on a basic human level.  This project will employ Asian American and Latino American actors for the lead roles; it will add to the growing arsenal of Asian films and will put more people of color actors' faces out there on film.  We are also employing Christine Ng as our Director of Photography and our Director is a gay Asian man of Lao descent.  Your contribution will help further the cause of diversity in Hollywood by putting Asian American players in front of and behind the camera.  

Risks & Challenges

In the interest of authenticity, this epic short will be shot in three languages: Lao, English and Spanish.  Specifically, scenes with the Lao family will be shot in Lao and scenes with the Latino family will be shot in Spanish.  Part of the challenge is there is a lack of Lao actors in Hollywood and so our director will have to work with actors and teach them how to deliver the lines in Lao.  Thankfully, Director Keodara can read, write and speak Lao fluently.  The other challenge is for Director Keodara to monitor performances of actors who are delivering the lines in Spanish as he does not speak Spanish.  Preparation will be costly as we would have to pay actors for rehearsals.  The plan is to romanized dialogue of the Lao language into English so our actors can successfully and believably deliver those lines during their performances.  

The other major obstacle would be to figure out how to shoot two green screen scenes where two actors--one elderly and one minor--walk across a moving log while crossing a turbulent river.  These are major scenes in the movie and in order to mitigate the risk of injuries to our actors, we'd have to set aside funding and find a post-house that is willing to work with us on compositing a CGI world from Green Screen shots (actors walking across moving log) and combining it with SFX shots of practical elements of the environment (river bank, turbulent water, bridge, fog, etc.) in these two scenes.  We foresee shooting these scenes being tricky but doable; however, it has to be done right in order for it to look good.  In short, it's going to cost money. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Another important way you can help us out is to Get media coverage for our campaign.

If you have any connections to bloggers, vlogers, journalists or podcasters, radio personalities and TV news anchors who are willing to cover us, please send them our way.  Have them contact us at laofilmsandtv@gmail.com.  Thanks!
