story:
"Forget not that the earth delights to feel your bare feet and the winds long to play with your hair" - Kahlil Gibran


About Our Film

          TARAB  follows Mena, a single, successful female lawyer, who is married to her career. While her Lebanese mother & family push her to find marriage in hopes of grandchildren, Mena realizes she has been working so hard that she has not noticed how much time has passed. She has lost her spark or light within herself. Until, one day, she finds her passion within a form of dance that is not widely accepted as a professional career in her culture: belly dancing. But how long can Mena keep up this double life? If her secret gets out, her family will be shocked and embarrassed. Will she lose her job? Will she have to give up the one thing that has re-connected her to herself? Find out in this truly incredible story of acceptance, culture, family, community, diversity, equality & love that is TARAB.

"TARAB  is Arabic for musical ecstasy, bliss, or enchantment; an extreme emotional transformation leading to intense feelings of joy, sorrow, or sadness; a concept with no exact English translation."


Tarab's Impact

Our goal is to inspire others to find their own path in life by telling a powerful story with heart and humor that stems from a place of truth.

  • One of the recurring themes in our story is 'Acceptance.' Acceptance of other's differences is crucial, especially in our increasingly polarized society. TARAB  sheds light on Middle Eastern culture, and, specifically, Lebanese Maronite culture, in new and enlightening ways, which the film world has not seen popularized in this way before.  It shows Mena's struggle to gain acceptance from her family, co-workers & society for being a woman who is not only a lawyer, but also a belly dancer who makes non-traditional choices in life.
  • This film champions diversity and will help change the film industry with its timely themes and  strong cultural  focus. We are proud to have a female screenwriter (Maria Nadia Michaels) and an extremely diverse cast and crew. In addition,  our lead actor is a woman and there are several other key female supporting roles (strong roles for female characters are under-represented, and, in 2015, women were paid significantly less than their male counterparts, as seen in the chart below). Middle Eastern actresses are even more under-represented (see chart below for more).  
  • We need your help to spread our message & to change the film world one step at a time.


What We Need & What You Get

Let's break it down for you folks:

  • We have tons of great perks you will get in return for making such a generous contribution to the making of our project. There are many unique perks that you can check out on the right!
  • With your generous contribution, we will be funding post production costs, rental costs, pay for the actors & the crew, food / transportation for the cast & crew, costumes, hair, make up etc.
  • Even if we do not reach our final goal, we will still work our very best to keep funding and use your contribution to see this film to completion. 


Risks & Challenges

As you may know, there are many risks & challenges in making a feature film and especially one of this nature.

  • We know that this film is not playing by the "rules" of the Mainstream Media.  In challenging the status quo, we are aware we are taking a risk that this film may not get the same viewership as a more mainstream product. We are not creating it for viewership, we are creating this to promote change. While we are taking steps towards equality and diversity within the film community, there is still a long way to go.
  • There are also many issues that arise during the process of filming and post-production. The Ally Artists Group  have a fully equipped staff and have assembled an amazing crew that will be able to handle these situations with professionalism & great detail! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Help us to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!
  • Remember, Indiegogo has some great 'Share Tools' so we can get other viewers to this campaign page!
  • Another way to help is to LIKE US on Facebook, FOLLOW US on Twitter & Instagram and SUBSCRIBE to us on YouTube!
Thank you for your Support & we cannot wait to collaborate with you!
* Special Thanks to Le Souk Restaurant & Lounge (510 LaGuardia Pl, New York, NY 10012) and Rustico (135 1st Avenue, New York, NY 10009) for committing as our location sponsors. We are still looking for office and apartment locations. Please contact us for more information.


WHO WE ARE

We know that you want to fund ideas you can be passionate about & TRUST. Here is a little bit about us:

Maria Michaels (Executive Producer and Screenwriter of Tarab). She is a New York-based actor/dancer/singer/producer/writer of Lebanese and French background. Maria has starred in numerous short films and is currently set to play Camila Rosario in In the Heights with CK Productions NY. The Metropolitan Opera cast her in two principal roles, the Vision Dancer and the Oriental Dancer, in the opera, Thais. Her most recent stage appearances include Miss Grace Farrell in Annie and Gymnasia in A Funny Thing Happened on the Way to the Forum. "St. Francine of Okra",  her one-act play,  recently had a reading at the Richmond Shepard Theatre in NYC.  As one of NYC"s leading belly dancers, she has performed for numerous celebrities including Sir Ben Kingsley, Shakira, Justin Timberlake, Sarah Jessica Parker and many more.  Favorite film/tv roles include principal dancer in Sex and the City II and James Bond Belly dancer with Vanessa Bayer on Saturday Night Live. As artistic director and choreographer of the Middle Eastern dance company, Nadia and Dancers, she has performed and taught at numerous world class venues including The Public Theatre, Joyce Theatre Soho, The United Nations, Barnard College, Princeton University and many others. Maria has an MFA from the Tisch School of the Arts at NYU. For more information visit www.mariamichaels.com and www.nadiadance.com

Joyce Lao (Producer/Production Manager) is a New York based performer and Music Director. She has a degree in Psychology (pre-med), Special Education, Ma in Music and attended Stella Adler School of Acting. She has produced, acted and written a number of short films that have been screened in the film festival circuit. She is also the co-creator/producer of a new webseries endorsed by Youtube entitled, “These Three Girls”. Her Directorial debut, “Hecuba” won Runner – up as Best Ensemble and she also won Runner-up for Best Director at the Ancient Drama Festival 2012. She also won Best Performance of an Ensemble for the musical "Alien Adventure- The Adventure" written by Jon Freda for her performance as Capt. Duda  at the Midtown International Theater Festival Awards in 2014. Her last original work, "Behind the Wall-An Autism Performance Piece" with Andy Miyamotto at the NYC Fringe Festival 2015 was well received and is in the process of development to be shown on tour. As an artist and performer, she is geared towards original work, she also has the passion to help and promote other talents - most especially multi-talented people of color and of Asian descent. This passion turned into a vision and she therefore founded The Ally Artists Group (www.allyartists.com) . For more information, visit her website at www.joycelao.net.

Zilong Zee (Producer) is an actor, singer, dancer and producer. Zilong grew up in China. After discovering his love for acting and music he moved to Paris and attended the European acting school “Cours Florent”. While in France, Zilong appeared in a variety of French theater, concert and TV shows, independent films, music television videos, as well as commercials for Pepsi and Amnesty International. His main focus is performing pop music, musical theater, plays, film and television. He has starred in several independent films in New York and many are currently playing in the festival circuit. His short film "Will Of Fortune" has been accepted into 67th Annual Cannes Film Festival for the Short Film Corner. Zilong has also got nominated as "BEST ACTOR" in Asians On Film Festival in Los Angles, 2015. He also worked with the TONY-AWARD nominated "Best Director", Marcia Milgrom Dodge, in the Maltz Jupiter Theater's new version of the Broadway hit " The King & I". www.zilongzee.com

CAST

KAREN LYNN GORNEY is the romantic star of Saturday Night Fever (1977): the dance partner and fantasy girlfriend who said "no" to John Travolta, and won his heart in this mega-hit film, released on DVD to raves. Miss Gorney was also the original "Tara Martin" (Tad's big sister, Erica's mortal enemy) on ABC's award-winning All My Children (1970-1976). A classically trained Actress, and winner of the People's Choice and European Bravo Awards, Karen holds a BFA from Carngie Mellon and MFA from Brandeis University in Acting and Speech. She has received raves in New York City and throughout the United States performing everything from William Shakespeare to Neil Simon. Karen's many films include A Crime, with Harvey Keitel, and Searching for Bobby D. [DeNiro], with Sandra Bernhard; Late Phases with Nick Damici; The Imperialists are Still Alive with Élodie Bouchez; and The Cradle Will Rock and Men in Black.

JON FREDA . Recent Film: Luc Besson’s The Family, Run, Friends & Romans, Crooked & Narrow, and Las Vegas Film Festival award winner L’Accordatore (The Piano Tuner). TV: Law & Order SVU, Nikki & Sara Live, and The Joe Buck Show. Recipient of the Outstanding Actor Award for The Cannes Film Festival entrant Sisyphus’ Supper. Theater:  Off Broadway in his critically acclaimed solo show Imagine Dat! (Jimmy Durante), Wild Children (Carmine), On A Darkling Plain (George), and Foreclosure (Ben).  Off-Off Broadway: Dummies (Golub), Loyalties (Ricardo), and A Gathering Of Eagles (Roger). Selected Regional credits: Breaking Legs (Mike), Over The River And Through The Woods (Nunzio), The Miracle Worker (Anagnos), Wait Until Dark (Roat), Born Yesterday (Brock), and The Pink Panther Strikes Again (Clouseau). www.jonfreda.com.

ALLEN ENLOW  is known for his role as Dr. Harry Winer in the hit show, "The Sopranos", he was the voice of the Joker  in the Batman animation, "Dark Tomorrow". He played a Biologist in the current HBO Mini series THE NIGHT OF. He just won BEST ACTOR in a short film called JAM at the METROPOLIS film festival. This month at HOBOKEN FILM FESTIVAL Allen played the starring role of ex ROCK GUITARIST in feature film LINER NOTES. He's also in the final writing stages of his one man show- PRAISE THE LORD I'M GOING TO HELL. www.allenenlow.com

 MESSERET STROMAN. (SAG/AFTRA & AEA) TV/Film -The Sopranos, Law & Order, HBO's Rebound, Another World, America's Most Wanted, The Kitchen, Law & Order:SVU. Theatre Credits -ArenaStage & Roundabout Theatre Company/Charles Randolph-Wright's BLUE*, Delaware Theatre Company & StageWest-MA./ August Wilson's Joe Turner's Come and Gone, New Perspectives Theatre/ Melissa Maxwell's Unrequited Love, Women's Project/Judy Tate's The Point, The Negro Ensemble Company/Samm-Art Williams' The Waiting Room, Harlem 9's 48 Hours...In Harlem 2015/Chisa Hutchinson's Pull Of Gravity, Columbia University/Robert O'Hara's INSURRECTION:Holding History, Village Gate/Susan Watson Turner's Just A Night Out. www.MesseretStroman.com

TAMIR is an actress, poet and playwright, author and performer of three one-woman shows “In the Land of Israel” and “I Belong Elsewhere.” Her CD of devotional readings “Poetry on Prayer” is an interfaith celebration of the human spirit. Some of her roles are: Maria Callas, Medea, Bernarda Alba and Leah in the “Dybbuk.” Her new play “Next!” is a humorous and poignant monodrama about the audition process. She also wrote “The Way of the Heart” as a play for four women about dying consciously and the struggle of letting go, which incorporates some of these verses, stories and music as well as dance and whirling. Also see www.actresstamir.com

PETE MACNAMARA. Recent credits include “The Lennon Report” (film), “The Blacklist” (TV), “Woman at the Funerals” (stage). Longtime musician, producer & photographer who tells stories by any means necessary. Often portrays law-enforcement, “suits” and musicians, hence “The Mambo Kings,” (while also coaching Antonio Banderas on trumpet), Carlito’s Way, The Manchurian Candidate, Law & Order: Criminal Intent, SVU, One Bad Choice,Third Watch. Still writes the odd TV jingle (nationals for Cover Girl, Toyota, Ashley, etc.) and eminently proud of his song used in “F*ck – The Movie.” Increasingly involved with coaching and mentoring across creative disciplines.

BILL BEYDOUN is a member of the OnTheRoad Repertory Theater Company, where he trains year-round with Alice Spivak. He has appeared in many independent film projects, off-broadway theatrical productions and also writes his own screenplays. For further information, please visit: www.BillBeydoun.com

VICTORIA VANCE.  Film credits include: House Hunting (Currently running on Amazon Prime), Lullaby (Lionsgate/FEARnet), Sneakers and Soul. TV credits include: The Affair/Showtime, Veep/HBO. Commercials include: AMEX, British Airways. Off-Broadway credits include: A Persistent Memory/The Beckett, Unbroken Circle/St. Luke's Theatre, Engaging Shaw/The Abingdon Theatre. Other NY & NJ credits include: Mentshn/New Worlds Theatre, Bright Ideas (World Premier)/12 Miles West. 

LESLIE FRYE was fortunate enough to book a supporting role in the international cult film favorite, CAMP, directed by Todd Graff (Band Slam, Joyful Noise).  This led her to other roles on Law and Order-SVU, All My Children and a recurring stint as a nurse on One Life to Live.  She has appeared in several commercials for companies such as, The Food Network, Comcast Cable, Nickelodeon, The Lifetime Network and Sports Illustrated just to name a few.  As the Facilitator for the MoriahCity Players at Mount Moriah AME Church, she wrote and directed many of their most successful outreach plays such as The Truth About Christmas, which won the Creative Arts Team the African American Heritage award. 

CATHERINE TAORMINA is a full time performer and content creator. Performance on film includes playing a young Olympia Dukakis in the Paul Reiser movie “The Thing About My Folks”. As a singer-songwriter-guitarist musician, she performs original and cover pop rock funk punk tunes as Rockstar Sissy. She produces shorts and has won a number of creative contests including an episode of Flea Market Flip currently airing on GAC & HGTV. A recent finalist with the Fly International Film Festival, her 1 minute film on dreams will be screened in Enid, Oklahoma August 2016. She is also the proud producer of her downloadable feature film “Twelfth Night” by William Shakespeare having also designed and made most of all of the costumes, directed, edited, acted in and composed music for the film.  Visit her websitewww.catherinetaormina.com for links to all!

ELI WALKER. After performing almost every character from Lily Tomlin and Jane Wagner's "the search for signs of intelligent life in the universe," in various high school acting competitions, Eli knew she'd found her calling and headed to New York.  With a BFA from NYU's Tisch School of the Arts and training from the Lee Strasberg Institute, Experimental Theatre Wing and Stone Street Studios, as well as the Upright Citizens' Brigade, she produced her first original one-woman show, "steps," at the Wings Theatre in the west village, directed by emmy-award winning Blake Bradford. She performed her second original one-woman show, "counting," at the experimental theatre wing at NYU, before beginning her professional career acting for tv, film, voice over and commercials. Eli is a libra sun, scorpio moon, and aries rising...just so you know.
story_txt:
"Forget not that the earth delights to feel your bare feet and the winds long to play with your hair" - Kahlil Gibran

About Our Film
          TARAB  follows Mena, a single, successful female lawyer, who is married to her career. While her Lebanese mother & family push her to find marriage in hopes of grandchildren, Mena realizes she has been working so hard that she has not noticed how much time has passed. She has lost her spark or light within herself. Until, one day, she finds her passion within a form of dance that is not widely accepted as a professional career in her culture: belly dancing. But how long can Mena keep up this double life? If her secret gets out, her family will be shocked and embarrassed. Will she lose her job? Will she have to give up the one thing that has re-connected her to herself? Find out in this truly incredible story of acceptance, culture, family, community, diversity, equality & love that is TARAB."TARAB  is Arabic for musical ecstasy, bliss, or enchantment; an extreme emotional transformation leading to intense feelings of joy, sorrow, or sadness; a concept with no exact English translation."
Tarab's Impact

Our goal is to inspire others to find their own path in life by telling a powerful story with heart and humor that stems from a place of truth.


One of the recurring themes in our story is 'Acceptance.' Acceptance of other's differences is crucial, especially in our increasingly polarized society. TARAB  sheds light on Middle Eastern culture, and, specifically, Lebanese Maronite culture, in new and enlightening ways, which the film world has not seen popularized in this way before.  It shows Mena's struggle to gain acceptance from her family, co-workers & society for being a woman who is not only a lawyer, but also a belly dancer who makes non-traditional choices in life.
This film champions diversity and will help change the film industry with its timely themes and  strong cultural  focus. We are proud to have a female screenwriter (Maria Nadia Michaels) and an extremely diverse cast and crew. In addition,  our lead actor is a woman and there are several other key female supporting roles (strong roles for female characters are under-represented, and, in 2015, women were paid significantly less than their male counterparts, as seen in the chart below). Middle Eastern actresses are even more under-represented (see chart below for more).  

We need your help to spread our message & to change the film world one step at a time.






What We Need & What You Get
Let's break it down for you folks:

We have tons of great perks you will get in return for making such a generous contribution to the making of our project. There are many unique perks that you can check out on the right!
With your generous contribution, we will be funding post production costs, rental costs, pay for the actors & the crew, food / transportation for the cast & crew, costumes, hair, make up etc.
Even if we do not reach our final goal, we will still work our very best to keep funding and use your contribution to see this film to completion. 



Risks & Challenges
As you may know, there are many risks & challenges in making a feature film and especially one of this nature.

We know that this film is not playing by the "rules" of the Mainstream Media.  In challenging the status quo, we are aware we are taking a risk that this film may not get the same viewership as a more mainstream product. We are not creating it for viewership, we are creating this to promote change. While we are taking steps towards equality and diversity within the film community, there is still a long way to go.
There are also many issues that arise during the process of filming and post-production. The Ally Artists Group  have a fully equipped staff and have assembled an amazing crew that will be able to handle these situations with professionalism & great detail! 

Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

Help us to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!
Remember, Indiegogo has some great 'Share Tools' so we can get other viewers to this campaign page!
Another way to help is to LIKE US on Facebook, FOLLOW US on Twitter & Instagram and SUBSCRIBE to us on YouTube!

Thank you for your Support & we cannot wait to collaborate with you!
* Special Thanks to Le Souk Restaurant & Lounge (510 LaGuardia Pl, New York, NY 10012) and Rustico (135 1st Avenue, New York, NY 10009) for committing as our location sponsors. We are still looking for office and apartment locations. Please contact us for more information.


WHO WE ARE
We know that you want to fund ideas you can be passionate about & TRUST. Here is a little bit about us:
Maria Michaels (Executive Producer and Screenwriter of Tarab). She is a New York-based actor/dancer/singer/producer/writer of Lebanese and French background. Maria has starred in numerous short films and is currently set to play Camila Rosario in In the Heights with CK Productions NY. The Metropolitan Opera cast her in two principal roles, the Vision Dancer and the Oriental Dancer, in the opera, Thais. Her most recent stage appearances include Miss Grace Farrell in Annie and Gymnasia in A Funny Thing Happened on the Way to the Forum. "St. Francine of Okra",  her one-act play,  recently had a reading at the Richmond Shepard Theatre in NYC.  As one of NYC"s leading belly dancers, she has performed for numerous celebrities including Sir Ben Kingsley, Shakira, Justin Timberlake, Sarah Jessica Parker and many more.  Favorite film/tv roles include principal dancer in Sex and the City II and James Bond Belly dancer with Vanessa Bayer on Saturday Night Live. As artistic director and choreographer of the Middle Eastern dance company, Nadia and Dancers, she has performed and taught at numerous world class venues including The Public Theatre, Joyce Theatre Soho, The United Nations, Barnard College, Princeton University and many others. story:
GOOD THINGS COME

When their grandmother passes away, a camera is left to 3 estranged grandchildren with only 6 photos remaining. Fred, Carey and Robbie reluctantly accept their 'Mam-Mam's' dying wish and set off on a road trip across Wales. As they attempt to heal their relationships in the gorgeous countryside, they find that forgiveness and forgetfulness rarely come as a pair.

ABOUT THE PROJECT

We are raising funds for our first Feature Film: 'Good Things Come', in which 3 siblings inherit their grandmother's camera with only 6 photos remaining. Fred, Carey and Robbie attempt to reopen their frosty relationship whilst taking the final photos on a road trip across Wales. 

My name is Oli Warrilow, Director of Skytail Productions and the writer of Good Things Come. This is our first feature-length film at Skytail, which simultaneously makes it the most exciting and the most challenging project that we've ever embarked upon. We are most comfortable as a small, focused team and all of our crew for Good Things Come have previous experience with Skytail across our most recent films: psychological drama 'What Price Solitude', madcap comedy 'Little White Cottage' and original superhero mockumentary series 'ULTRA: The Golden Generation'.

Good Things Come will be an immensely personal film to anyone who's had the dubious pleasure of siblings, and a sheer nostalgia trip to those who have been children. It feels great to have finally found a story that suits our micro-budget work ethic and performance-driven style of filmmaking; to the point that it's already starting to feel like Skytail's biggest success by some distance. This campaign is of huge importance to Good Things Come and at Skytail we are passionate about making this film to the quality it deserves; starting with finding the perfect environment in which to capture the performances. If successful, the film will be able to shoot in the most glorious and far-reaching corners of Wales; as well as opening up the chance to present Good Things Come to an ever widening audience.

Good Things Come comes across not only as a film of nostalgic escapism - but also a charming and heart-warming drama that introduces the (very British) group-based comedy, brought into view by the likes of Richard Curtis. The quaint rural setting nestled within the breathtaking Welsh surroundings brings a feeling of Ransome's 'Swallows and Amazons' novels - if the children have grown up, fallen out and are now re-walking the footsteps of their younger selves. Meanwhile, the film's protagonist, Fred Marlow, leads the audience through an uplifting adventure that smacks of the likes of Stiller's 'The Secret Life of Walter Mitty'. This film suits us at Skytail down to the ground: when our performance-centred style meets these hugely relatable characters in such evocative and reminiscent locations... how could an audience not be engaged?

WHY WE NEED YOU

Once more, we are looking to work to an extremely modest budget in order to secure both the very best of locations and as great an audience as possible on a small scale festival and art-house release. Our starting target is £3,000 - we are looking do divide that up between locations, sourcing the best of artistic talent as well as the aforementioned amount of distribution to an audience. I have already added £2,000 from my own pocket on Skytail's behalf which is enough to to cover both the cost of equipment, design and the general expenses of shooting a feature film in such remote locations. In the current funding situation, the production team will be operating voluntarily, but in the instance of an increase in funds this is the first place extra money will be sent.

Finding the best locations is key to Good Things Come. Wales has three spectacular national parks: Brecon Beacons, Pembrokeshire Coast and Snowdonia, all of which we have ambitions to film in. This will create the stunning rural aesthetic that we're looking for, but inevitably, these locations do come at a price.

Good Things Come is set to contain an eclectic mix of Photography, Music and Food in order to bring forward our ideas of introducing the culture and artistic side of Wales in new ways rather than solely using it as a backdrop.

Naturally, we are desperate for a wide audience to see Good Things Come and to this aim we will look to enter it into festivals before pursuing the audience - possibly through more local arthouse screenings, followed by online and DVD distribution. At Skytail we are excited to make a film that taps in to the current nostalgic outlook of the millennial generation. With characters of similar ages to this demographic, we feel that audiences will relate strongly to the characters, thus being able to enjoy the story and comedy more.

If the goal is not reached, we will STILL shoot the film! The locations and art needed for the production of Good Things Come will operate on a continuum: the more funding we receive, the better they will get. Whatever the weather, there will be a finished product. Whilst the distribution will undoubtably been sorely effected, we will look to secure further funds after the film is complete.

AND THIS IS HOW GRATEFUL WE'LL BE...

However, when the funding comes in, we'll be raring to dive into the whole process of making a feature film and this will undoubtably shine through in the perks and rewards! We've compiled an extensive list of opportunities for those of you who get involved; from invitation to visit set, appear in the film and even say your own line, all the way to nostalgia-coated gifts tailored just for you in keeping with the films mood. We're offering chances to get involved in the DVD extras in various capacities and even some behind-the-scenes swag from the production process - there's great fun to be had however you choose to involve yourself!

Aside from monetary support, Good Things Come is relying on a great mix of different contributors from all fields of walk. So, share this campaign on every platform you can! Social Media! Word of mouth! Indiegogo itself! Just tell everyone you know that we're here and that you'll be a part of our audience!

Be it from funding the film, offering your specialist set of skills or spreading the word of Good Things Come to all and sundry. We would love to have you in the Skytail team for this film and we shall be very publicly grateful!

Thank you all,

Oli Warrilow.
story_txt: GOOD THINGS COMEWhen their grandmother passes away, a camera is left to 3 estranged grandchildren with only 6 photos remaining. Fred, Carey and Robbie reluctantly accept their 'Mam-Mam's' dying wish and set off on a road trip across Wales. As they attempt to heal their relationships in the gorgeous countryside, they find that forgiveness and forgetfulness rarely come as a pair.ABOUT THE PROJECTWe are raising funds for our first Feature Film: 'Good Things Come', in which 3 siblings inherit their grandmother's camera with only 6 photos remaining. Fred, Carey and Robbie attempt to reopen their frosty relationship whilst taking the final photos on a road trip across Wales. My name is Oli Warrilow, Director of Skytail Productions and the writer of Good Things Come. This is our first feature-length film at Skytail, which simultaneously makes it the most exciting and the most challenging project that we've ever embarked upon. We are most comfortable as a small, focused team and all of our crew for Good Things Come have previous experience with Skytail across our most recent films: psychological drama 'What Price Solitude', madcap comedy 'Little White Cottage' and original superhero mockumentary series 'ULTRA: The Golden Generation'.Good Things Come will be an immensely personal film to anyone who's had the dubious pleasure of siblings, and a sheer nostalgia trip to those who have been children. It feels great to have finally found a story that suits our micro-budget work ethic and performance-driven style of filmmaking; to the point that it's already starting to feel like Skytail's biggest success by some distance. This campaign is of huge importance to Good Things Come and at Skytail we are passionate about making this film to the quality it deserves; starting with finding the perfect environment in which to capture the performances. If successful, the film will be able to shoot in the most glorious and far-reaching corners of Wales; as well as opening up the chance to present Good Things Come to an ever widening audience.Good Things Come comes across not only as a film of nostalgic escapism - but also a charming and heart-warming drama that introduces the (very British) group-based comedy, brought into view by the likes of Richard Curtis. The quaint rural setting nestled within the breathtaking Welsh surroundings brings a feeling of Ransome's 'Swallows and Amazons' novels - if the children have grown up, fallen out and are now re-walking the footsteps of their younger selves. Meanwhile, the film's protagonist, Fred Marlow, leads the audience through an uplifting adventure that smacks of the likes of Stiller's 'The Secret Life of Walter Mitty'. This film suits us at Skytail down to the ground: when our performance-centred style meets these hugely relatable characters in such evocative and reminiscent locations... how could an audience not be engaged?WHY WE NEED YOUOnce more, we are looking to work to an extremely modest budget in order to secure both the very best of locations and as great an audience as possible on a small scale festival and art-house release. Our starting target is £3,000 - we are looking do divide that up between locations, sourcing the best of artistic talent as well as the aforementioned amount of distribution to an audience. I have already added £2,000 from my own pocket on Skytail's behalf which is enough to to cover both the cost of equipment, design and the general expenses of shooting a feature film in such remote locations. In the current funding situation, the production team will be operating voluntarily, but in the instance of an increase in funds this is the first place extra money will be sent.Finding the best locations is key to Good Things Come. Wales has three spectacular national parks: Brecon Beacons, Pembrokeshire Coast and Snowdonia, all of which we have ambitions to film in. This will create the stunning rural aesthetic that we're looking for, but inevitably, these locations do come at a price.Good Things Come is set to contain an eclectic mix of Photography, Music and Food in order to bring forward our ideas of introducing the culture and artistic side of Wales in new ways rather than solely using it as a backdrop.Naturally, we are desperate for a wide audience to see Good Things Come and to this aim we will look to enter it into festivals before pursuing the audience - possibly through more local arthouse screenings, followed by online and DVD distribution. At Skytail we are excited to make a film that taps in to the current nostalgic outlook of the millennial generation. With characters of similar ages to this demographic, we feel that audiences will relate strongly to the characters, thus being able to enjoy the story and comedy more.If the goal is not reached, we will STILL shoot the film! The locations and art needed for the production of Good Things Come will operate on a continuum: the more funding we receive, the better they will get. Whatever the weather, there will be a finished product. Whilst the distribution will undoubtably been sorely effected, we will look to secure further funds after the film is complete.AND THIS IS HOW GRATEFUL WE'LL BE...However, when the funding comes in, we'll be raring to dive into the whole process of making a feature film and this will undoubtably shine through in the perks and rewards! We've compiled an extensive list of opportunities for those of you who get involved; from invitation to visit set, appear in the film and even say your own line, all the way to nostalgia-coated gifts tailored just for you in keeping with the films mood. We're offering chances to get involved in the DVD extras in various capacities and even some behind-the-scenes swag from the production process - there's great fun to be had however you choose to involve yourself!Aside from monetary support, Good Things Come is relying on a great mix of different contributors from all fields of walk. So, share this campaign on every platform you can! Social Media! Word of mouth! Indiegogo itself! Just tell everyone you know that we're here and that you'll be a part of our audience!Be it from funding the film, offering your specialist set of skills or spreading the word of Good Things Come to all and sundry. We would love to have you in the Skytail team for this film and we shall be very publicly grateful!Thank you all,Oli Warrilow.

story:
Short Summary

CASSETTE is a romantic fantasy film, about a lonely man who falls in love with a language teacher at the school he cleans at after hours. To impress her he attempts to learn languages on old cassette tapes he listens to. As his infatuation grows, he has romantic fantasies about the teacher and the tapes he listens to. The film aims to be a sincere character portrait and it has the potential to be very poignant and heartfelt.

Your funding will help us make this film a reality, and the more you give, the more we can give back. The budget of the film will determine the production value, art direction, us getting great acting talent, and giving our film a chance to reach a greater audience!

 

What We Need & What You Get

We have already funded some of the film through bake sales and events, but we need your help with the rest! 

We are looking to raise an additional 850£ through crowdfunding to make sure our ambitious project will reach its full potential. Our core crew is composed of 9 members (and we're all getting graded on this). Additionally we will bring on emerging filmmaking talent from university and beyond. Our film is not only an opportunity to make a film, but to help other emerging talents showcase their skills as part of our team. We will need to take care of travel, food, location, and our acting talent throughout the shoot which funding will greatly help with. 

Your contribution will go towards things such as the art department (props & costume), equipment hire, actors, locations, and eventually festival submission and distribution of the film. All these aspects are very important to creating a great film, and will help it look and feel the way we envision. 
Below is a chart to clearly present our budget:

As a reward for your contributions we are offering a range perks, including; credits in the film (even your company),  a copy of the film upon release, concept artwork, film poster, prop cassettes, and more! We want you to be part of the process and we will update you as we go along with the film! 

If we don't reach our goal we will still complete the film and make it the best possible film we can. But the more you give, the better the film will be!

The Impact

All of our team are currently working hard to achieve the best film possible, but without your help we won't be able to make the film that we envision.

This is an ambitious project that has great potential to do well in film festivals; it is the lead up to our graduation films and so you're not just investing in a film, but our creative futures as filmmakers! 

Risks & Challenges

We face various challenges with this project, but nothing we can not handle. Locations, Set Decoration and Acting talent is what our film most hinges on. The more help we can get with these, the more achievable and better quality these aspects will be. 

We already have a script and have begun casting and sourcing locations. We work efficiently and transparently so you can safely trust us!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some of you may be unable to contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Ask your friends and family to support and share our project
  • Share this project on social media!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Mad Mozzies Bar has been an iconic retreat for visitors to Inhambane, Praia de Barra, Mozambique. We built it with passion, the help of our loyal staff and a lifetime of savings, and so, it was with a heavy heart that we had to stand back and helplessly watch it burn down to mere cinders and ash in the early hours of October 8th, 2016.Short Summary

Over the last 10 years, this family-run bar and restaurant has meant many things to many people. To the local staff, it has not only been a source of livelihood for their families, but a source of enablement and hope for a brighter future. To holidaymakers, it has been a warm and vibrant setting for unforgettable memories and fun-filled nights spent with great friends. To couples, it has been a backdrop to their most intimate of vows and a witness to the start of their journey as newlyweds. To us, Andre and Ansie Greyling, it has been a labour of love and a nesting egg that we hoped to pass on to our children and grandchildren.

Which is why we owe it to the Mozambican community, to you and to ourselves to rebuild Mad Mozzies, so that it can continue to touch lives as it once did. We have mourned its loss, but it’s time to raise the Phoenix from the ashes and we can’t do it without your support. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are only asking for the cost of materials required to rebuild, not a penny more. The cost has been worked out based on a simple redesign of the bar to be up and running by December. Fire insurance was something we tried repeatedly to get but proved impossible.

​We are offering T-shirts, and a place on the wall of fame which will have the names of all the people who contributed significantly to the rebuild. We will also be giving generous contributors 3 free nights stay at Casas Delight Resort.

story:
Brown Sugar 

In a struggle to overcome an excessive drug addiction, Bonnie gets a little help from an unwarranted guest. 

 

This film is an emotional drama that will run approximately 15-20 minutes over a wide variety of locations that really capture the essence of drug addiction the problems that come with it. 

 

 

Meet the Crew

We are a group of seniors at Quinnipiac University in Hamden, CT. As our final capstone to graduate, we decided to come together and make a short narrative that means a lot to us. Written by a fellow student at the university, Brown Sugar centers around emotion and struggling with inner problems. This script has a lot of challenges within and we cannot wait to take this project by the horns and run with it! We thank you in advance for your interest! Please, read on!

Sean Davis (Producer) has spent a lot of time in the film department directing and editing music videos as well as performing in a large number of theater productions. He found his passion for the early in his career during high school where he succeeded in a intro-level film course. from there on he has worked hard to put his experience with film and his love for the arts together and is extremely excited to be part of this amazing production.

 

Elexis Sutton (Assistant Director)  gained interest in the Arts through her love for photography. As a freshman is high school, she joined her church's Audio, Video Technology where she worked with a team to broadcast services and other special events. She has, also, worked on many student films such as music videos and small projects giving her the experience needed to be successful in her future. 

 

Bradley Groleau (Director) gained his interest in film in high school and continues to pursue it in college. He has found his passion within set decorating and making sure everything looks exactly how it should. He has worked along side may directors for short films as well as some feature films, too. He truly believes his passion in film will aid him in his current project of directing Brown Sugar. He will use his past experience and his love for set dressing to make the most appealing and emotionally driven film. 

 


Derek Young (Director of Photography) has been working in film since he started as a freshman in high school. He moved to college to further his education in Film and while doing that, he's done a lot such as work live television productions, news packages, short narratives, and music videos. The thing that always drove his passion for film has been the visuals and effects. He chose to be the Director of Photography to convey the story through images and to make a captivating and appealing story.

 

Emma Soviero (Editor) became passionate about film four years ago when she realized she wanted to change people's lives through strong, compelling visuals. She has dedicated herself to editing since her return from two internships in Los Angeles. While across the country, she worked with professionals to create wonderful art. She is very excited to get started on Brown Sugar and is honored to be a part of it!

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are asking for $5,000. That money is going to go toward a number of things such as:
    • Actors - Brown Sugar carries a large message of overcoming drug addiction as well as the powerful love between and mother and he son. The acting is really going to carry these themes and make the film glorious. 
    • Locations - This film isn't a film that can be shot anywhere. We have very specific ideas for how it should look and we need funds to get the perfect place for the perfect shots. 
    • Equipment - On our team, we are missing a person who is strong with sound. Without decent sound equipment and someone to operate it, our film will fall short. A big portion of the funds will go toward a sound operator and good equipment. 
  • Perks and Recognition
    • With every generous donation, we as a team thank you. The funds we raise from this will help us achieve our goal as filmmakers. Of course, will every generous donation, we'll give you a treat:
      • $1 (just one dollar!) will get you a link to the finished product of Brown Sugar
      • For every $30 donation, you will receive a special letter from the crew thoroughly thanking you for your donation and help. 
      • $75 gets YOUR name in the credits of the film. You are part of the team at that point!
      • $150 gets you a special signed movie poster as well as a DVD of the film
      • $500 donations award you with an Associate Producer credit!

We welcome any size donations, of course. Every little bit helps us a lot and we will be sure to thank each and every one of you for doing so!

 

Why Brown Sugar?

  • Our film focuses on a woman's struggle with a drug addiction. We recognize that drug addictions are very real and we want to bring light to it. This detrimental lifestyle is something that we, as a team, are passionate about. 
  • This is our commentary on drug addictions and how it effects this particular family. We think everyone will be able to relate to struggles such as this. 

Hurdles

We've encountered some big hurdles on our run so far. We're a smaller group so we are lacking a sound department. As students, we are limited in resources such as location scouting and casting so we need a lot of help getting the proper equipment to make a truly spectacular film. 

Please help us out on making the amazing film. It means a lot to us and we can't do anything without help!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this with your friends and family! As we said before, every penny helps! The more people who see this the better. 

If you can't donate, we understand, but maybe someone you know can donate! You never know until you hare, share, SHARE!

Please help us out on making the amazing film. It means a lot to us and we can't do anything without help!

story:
Who the hell are we?

We are three young performers living in NYC, working to bring a voice to the entertainment industry for an underrepresented population of the LGBT community-- the nerd!

With the positive outpouring from season one-- and the successes of web series like My Gay Roommate and The Guild-- viewers have shown that they relate to our characters and our brand of storytelling. They love us! They really love us!

 

The Queens Project Team:

Creator/Writer/Executive Producer: Ken Arpino

Production: It Gets Funnier 

Producing: It Gets Funnier and Wolfbane Productions 

Cast: 

BJ Gruber, Ken Arpino, Trey Gerrald, Tim Murray, and Noam Ash

Plus some fun, new characters we can't wait to introduce to you.

 

Why do you boys want my donation?

Season One was an amazing-- we have an incredible team assembled, but production takes time, equipment, marketing, and so much more-- all of which demands those Benjamins. In order to bring you the best product we can, we need your support!

We’ve crunched the numbers and trimmed the fat.

Budget Items Breakdown:

Crew

Cast

Camera Equipment

Lighting Equipment

Audio Equipment

Craft Services (especially for Ash)

Locations/Transportation

Post-Production!

Publicity/Marketing Costs

Entrance fees for festivals

Graphic Design  

No donation is too big-- I mean too small-- and every little bit helps! We understand that not everyone can show their support through financial donations. That’s okay! Help us out by spreading the word, share this page with your friends and follow us on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram for updates on the project! But most importantly, KEEP WATCHING.

Thank you for all your love and support! We look forward to bringing you smiles and laughs with season 2 of The Queens Project!

WATCH AGAIN FROM THE BEGINNING: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLFx06_B-...

story:
STRANGE MATTERS: RESTORATION AND COMPLETION

HELP MAKE SOME FILM HISTORY WITH STRANGE MATTERS: A SUPERNATURAL MOVIE 

“As a kid I loved spooky movies and shows like The Outer Limits and the Twilight Zone. I  enjoyed horror comedy such as Abbott and Costello meet Frankenstein. As an adult I appreciated Hitchcock, Kubrick, Tod Browning, Fritz Lang and the gang. This movie is a tribute to all that mysterious jazz.” -- Writer-director Philippe Mora

Philippe Mora has directed over 40 films in all genres. Many are now regarded as classics in their genre including COMMUNION (Scifi), THE BEAST WITHIN (horror), BROTHER CAN YOU SPARE A DIME, SWASTIKA (documentaries), MAD DOG MORGAN (historical), RETURN OF CAPTAIN INVINCIBLE (musical), ABSOLUTELY MODERN (mockumentary) and HOWLING 3 (parody).

He started filming the supernatural themed STRANGE MATTERS in 65MM in 2004 at the Frank Lloyd Wright Ennis House in Los Angeles, co-sponsored by Panavision and Eastman Kodak. Zelda Rubenstein (Poltergeist) headed the cast as Agnes Sampson, channeler extraordinaire. Thorsten Heinze, Marcel Marceau’s long time colleague, Austen Tayshus, the brilliant Australian comic, actor Jonathan Ball and Mora rounded out the main cast.

Mora plays Dr. Lovestrange, a psychiatrist treating people who believe they are famous historical figures. The going gets very weird when Lovestrange and Sampson realize these patients may be channeling the real people from a netherworld. When Zelda Rubenstein and then Jonathan Ball passed away, Mora had not finished the film although their scenes were complete.

Mora, deeply saddened by his friends’ passing only recently was inspired to finish the film as a tribute to these great talents. He is hoping to crowd fund an essential remaining $9500 to restore and complete the film's score and visual effects. A prologue and epilogue will be filmed.

For fans of genre films and adventurous cinema this will prove to be a unique entry in the horror  and experimental pantheon.  One of the last films ever shot in 65MM it already acquires cult status.

Your contribution will help make some film history and support independent cinema !
story_txt:
STRANGE MATTERS: RESTORATION AND COMPLETION
HELP MAKE SOME FILM HISTORY WITH STRANGE MATTERS: A SUPERNATURAL MOVIE 
“As a kid I loved spooky movies and shows like The Outer Limits and the Twilight Zone. I  enjoyed horror comedy such as Abbott and Costello meet Frankenstein. As an adult I appreciated Hitchcock, Kubrick, Tod Browning, Fritz Lang and the gang. This movie is a tribute to all that mysterious jazz.” -- Writer-director Philippe Mora
Philippe Mora has directed over 40 films in all genres. Many are now regarded as classics in their genre including COMMUNION (Scifi), THE BEAST WITHIN (horror), BROTHER CAN YOU SPARE A DIME, SWASTIKA (documentaries), MAD DOG MORGAN (historical), RETURN OF CAPTAIN INVINCIBLE (musical), ABSOLUTELY MODERN (mockumentary) and HOWLING 3 (parody).
He started filming the supernatural themed STRANGE MATTERS in 65MM in 2004 at the Frank Lloyd Wright Ennis House in Los Angeles, co-sponsored by Panavision and Eastman Kodak. Zelda Rubenstein (Poltergeist) headed the cast as Agnes Sampson, channeler extraordinaire. Thorsten Heinze, Marcel Marceau’s long time colleague, Austen Tayshus, the brilliant Australian comic, actor Jonathan Ball and Mora rounded out the main cast. 
Mora plays Dr. Lovestrange, a psychiatrist treating people who believe they are famous historical figures. The going gets very weird when Lovestrange and Sampson realize these patients may be channeling the real people from a netherworld. When Zelda Rubenstein and then Jonathan Ball passed away, Mora had not finished the film although their scenes were complete.
Mora, deeply saddened by his friends’ passing only recently was inspired to finish the film as a tribute to these great talents. He is hoping to crowd fund an essential remaining $9500 to restore and complete the film's score and visual effects. A prologue and epilogue will be filmed.
For fans of genre films and adventurous cinema this will prove to be a unique entry in the horror  and experimental pantheon.  One of the last films ever shot in 65MM it already acquires cult status.
Your contribution will help make some film history and support independent cinema !

story:
Who Am I?

My name is Abdelrehman AlHalawani, 23 years old. I'm from Jordan, And I wrote my psychological change after living abroad in Germany for one year into a universal short film, which is taking part as my graduation project at the German Jordanian University. 

"Darb" meaning in Arabic is Path, The life path of every single one of us. do we stick with the future offered to us, or do we seek a different one and be up to the consequences of our decisions.

For me I decided to seek a future I have desired, First step was to step out from the family business and follow my passion in the film production field. In September 2015 I got on my very first flight, heading to Germany. I was very interested in meeting different people in different countries in Europe, and I was amazed by the young people traveling around seeking their own future, and the responsibility they had towards their independent decisions. In these people I saw my passion in finding out what relies beyond every horizon my eyes saw. 

The Story

I have started writing the story about five months ago, and translating my experience and thoughts into how the story it is now was really challenging.

The story is about a young Bedouin going through one of his most important coming of age decisions. After being pushed by his father's desire, he decides to step up for his own decisions, and how he acts with the consequences of his decisions while everything around him seems to fall apart.

Logline

A young Bedouin man on the verge of a traditional marriage. on a quest to prove him self he loses his hearing, pushing him to follow his desire in finding what life holds away from him living in the tribe.

Synopsis

SALEM a 20 years old Bedouin living with his small tribe in the desert along with his desire in finding what life might hold beyond the horizon. His father's desire in marrying him to AIN creates a race between his desire and reality. As a self-proving request by Ain's mother before the marriage he takes off to the desert to hunt a wolf down. On his first contact with the wolf Salem realizes that the wolf represents exactly the freedom he him self in longing for. If he takes the wolf freedom he lose his own as well. Later on a close sudden appear of the wolf Salem rushes to pull the trigger while taking couple of steps backward, he slips off a cliff and loses his hearing due the fall. Failing to accomplish his mission puts him to his first coming of age decision in following his desire. During his journey he faces the challenges of the desert and the wolf becomes his companion on his exploration. Salem finds out that after the horizon there is just another horizon waiting. shortly before giving up he is put to a close encounter with death, but Ain shows in the very moment to prevent it. Together they remain exposed to their own promising future. 

If you are interested to read the script please do not hesitate to contact us!

What We Need

With your contribution we will be able to cover the production expenses, as stated our budget is 9000$, Specifically it will be used to cover the expenses of:

  • Crew accommodation.
  • Catering.
  • Equipment rentals.
  • Transportation.
  • Cast.
  • Props and costumes.
  • Animals and handlers.
  • International festivals submissions.

We are currently applying a plan to lower some expenses of the production, for example we offered some corporate design work for the camp, so that we get a lower rate for the crew accommodation in return, so far we are standing at the rate of 30$ per crew member per night, so if we lock the crew to 20 members and we lock the shooting period to our estimated 10 days of shooting, we already have 6000$ as accommodation expenses to cover.

Based on the contribution we will be able to update the crew size we can cover.

All contributions will be used smartly to realize our film in the best way possible, and we will provide you with a specific budget breakdown.

Why Fundraising?

We decided to approach fundraising for many reasons. The film industry in Jordan is still growing, and it is more likely to get the financial support from investors than donors. Investors who we have approached asked for a clear and obvious placeholder for their products, having said that, our story happens in the middle of a desert in the 1930s, it wouldn't make any sense to show the characters holding mobile phones, or driving luxury cars. We decided to protect the good story we have from such investors, specially when they asked for a guaranteed financial income from a student film! 

Our Perks for Your Generosity

With each contribution we've offered a Perk in return, from the lowest to the highest contribution we will give something in return to thank you. Starting from a social media shoutouts, customized exclusive gifts, and all the way to covering accommodation in the desert of Wadi-Rum in Jordan. Here are couple of the items included in our Perks!

 

Risks & Challenges

Our pre-production is getting more solid with everyday passing, and with your contribution helping us reach our goal we will be able to put our plans to action. In case we don't reach our goal in time, we will use what we have raised to still tell the world our story in the best way we can cover.

Our main challenges currently is the budget. Since we are filming in the Desert of Wadi Rum we need to cover first the expenses of accommodation and transportation, we have already reached an agreement with a tourists camp for the accommodation. the camp is well equipped for the production crew. If we reach our goal we will be able to work with enough crew to members to have a smoother production and we will be able to deliver the story in it's best shape.

In case if we don't reach our goal we will have to minimize our crew, which means more pressure on the rest of the crew and much harder time on set, and we are afraid it will affect the quality as well. If we exceed our goal we will use the money in post-production, music composing, sound design and color grading.

 

Low on funds? you may still help us! 

Getting more people familiar with what we are trying to achieve here will raise the chances of reaching the next possible donors, by sharing our campaign with friends and family you will help us in reaching our goal.

If you've found something missing in the campaign and it makes you having second thoughts about donating please feel free to contact me, my name is Abdelrehman AlHalawani, and I am a student giving my best to make it real! :)

story:
About Me

I am a 22 year old student, born and bred in the East London.  I am now in my final year of my degree studying at Coventry University.  Living in London for my whole life and being from a mixed background (white and black Caribbean), I have lived amongst a diverse range of people from various cultures.  Looking back at my time in school, I got some grief for having white skin, with fellow black classmates often questioning my background as they often thought I was lying about where my family originate.  This didn’t have a detrimental effect on me, however it allowed me to understand how race and ethnicity is viewed in today’s Western culture, and that is through a very narrow lens. 

The Concept

Observing events which have taken place throughout the course of the 10 years passed, I have witnessed how the issue of racial prejudice has ruined and ended the lives of those underserving on a worldwide scale.  The events of recent, which have been taking place in the United States, have been magnified by the use of social media and the emergence of mobile journalism, having an effect on social relationships and practices.  Being a Brit, I have personally been affected by events such as the brutal killing of Alton Sterling and many others, but only through the media that I am allowed access to such as the news and social media feeds.

My long term interest of these issues, has led to a level of engagement which has motivated me to step out of my comfort zone and go and find some facts myself.  By going to California for 6 days, I will be producing a documentary which explore the Black Lives Matter Movement as well as other racial issues in modern U.S. society.  

I am currently in the process of setting up interviews with individuals, including everyday citizens as well as leaders of groups such as Dignity and Power Now.  My recent contact with someone who works alongside the founder of Black Lives Matter gives me reason to believe that this project can be pulled off with consistency and resilience.  

My aim is to gather my own understanding and perspective of the events taking place in the U.S which work to suppress black communities, whilst making media that possesses the power of impact on it's audiences.  I believe in the ability to create and distribute stimulating media with the accessibility to today's Worldwide online networks. In going forward with the ambitious California project, I have encouraged myself to push boundaries and expectations in order to create something not only current, but relatable through my personal experiences in hope that I can educate others as well as myself by providing unfiltered access to this part of society.

What I Need & What You Get

I want my film to be seen, interpreted and understood both here and in the States, and submission to film festivals are the perfect opportunity for this to be done.  With help from you guys as contributors to my budget, I am optimistic that your generous contributions will be able to lift my project even higher off the ground.  Your contributions will also allow me to produce a more visually pleasing piece, with the possibility of access to bigger and better shooting kit.  

Expenses such as travel are also included in my goal, I have raised what I can through other means but your help would really make a difference.

Even if the goal isn't reached, 100% of your contributions will go towards the production and distribution of this film.  You will also receive perks which you can see on the right hand side of the page.  These perks will allow more of an insight into my experience with my first independent production.  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate don't worry!  You can still support my project through sharing this Indiegogo link with your friends and family.  Social media functions perfectly for something like this, and I will appreciate everyone's attempt to try and spread my ideas message.

Thank you for reading & donating!

I will be posting frequent updates on my progress leading up to the trip, and my blog will also be available to access shortly.

story:
Director's Statement

    My story is about the relationship between a young girl and God. In my story I will talk about the loss of a close one, losing faith, trusting and believing in anything around my main protagonist and reconnecting. The genre of this film is Drama/Spiritual/Faith Based. I would like the time period of this film to be current, because I think it can speak to a lot of young girls out there who have lost their dads. My protagonists goal is to get answers from God on why he would take her father away from her, especially before the big event she has been waiting for which is the Father/Daughter Dance at her school. This film will try to aim more towards being all action and less or no Dialogue. 

    The Theme in my film is Hope. When you read books/ the Bible on God you learn that God is Love and the greatest thing to have is Love or else nothing else matters. The other theme in this story is family relationships, specifically between a Father and Daughter. The subtext of the film or scenes in the film really boil down to anger, loss of identity and self and loss of faith in God.  

    Visually I want the performance’s and look to be very realistic and more focused on emotion’s and bringing the inner thoughts and actions to life. This film, will have neutral to dark grey tones throughout the film, because I want the audience to actually feel and see the space and what has changed in the characters life. For my music and sound, I want movement’s and wild sounds from what you are seeing in the film. I want musical instruments to play in the backgrounds when we show a sad part of the film such as the violin. I really want to capture the emotional state of both my protagonist and her mother during this film.     

What We Need & What You Get

Breakdown of Funding:

  • $5,000.00 is the budget of the film. The funding will go towards:
  • Paying some crew members, such as: Gaffer and Sound Mixer/Boom Operator and more. 
  • Permits/Locations
  • Rental Van Expenses
  • Insurance
  • Studio Teacher for my Child Actress
  • Editor
  • Composer
  • Sync Sound Mixer
  • Line Producer or UPM
  • Color Corrector

The Perks

  • You will get credit in the film
  • A DVD of the Short Film

If I am unable to raise all the funds, what I do raise will go to paying my studio teacher, permit/location and crew members. 

The Impact

This project will increase representation because my film reaches out to a wide range of people/audiences. My film is a religion based film and the story is being told from the eyes of the 12 yr. old girl who goes through the struggle of not having her father around and regaining her faith. 

Risks & Challenges

The obstacles that I see is the funding for the film, which is really important to me. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Ways that you can help:

  • Spread the word on social media 
  • Use the Indiegogo share tool to get the word out there for this story. 

Thank You!

story:
Majority of Litvaks left Lithuania for South Africa in the late 19th - the first half of the 20th centuries, right before the Holocaust shattered Europe, including Lithuania. For us Lithuanians, the fact that so many Litvaks currently live in South Africa is largely unknown. In the meantime, South African Litvaks still remember their homeland and hold on to old photos of wooden synagogues in their hometowns, portraits of their grandparents, and stories that have been passed down through generations. In this documentary, we want to include Robert (Ruvel) Videtzky. He is 93 years old and is one of a very few Litvaks who can recall, and share  their journey from Lithuania to South Africa.

Original image: Molėtų krašto muziejus

During almost a century, Litvaks successfully established themselves in South Africa. Some of them became well known in the arts or business worlds, others immersed into the political one, including fighting apartheid. While aforementioned Robert and others from his generation have memories of Lithuania or Lita, as it was called back then, their sons and daughters are actively exploring this Baltic country as it is now and its history.

Original image: Molėtų krašto muziejus

The vibrant Litvak community in South Africa finds its ways to cherish bonds with Lithuania. But what will the future unfold? Will the young generation be interested in their grandparents’ homeland? What does Lithuania mean for them?

Original image: Molėtų krašto muziejus

This documentary strives to answer all these questions and more, by giving a platform to the Litvak community in South Africa, to tell their story. Personal recounts and anecdotes will paint a tragedy - the Holocaust and war - yet hopeful - the new life in South Africa - picture of this part of the Lithuanian Jews’ history.

Jewish history is Lithuanian history. It looks like only now this phase is becoming common. Filming the "march of the living ones", the 75th Anniversary of Massacre of Jews in Molėtai, showed the concern and memory we have about our past. Litvaks from all over the world came to the march, many Lithuanians joined.

Our documentary is one more step towards a better understanding of our history, Litvaks being a part of it. Moreover, we aim to answer questions of today and tomorrow – how is the Litvaks community in SA doing nowadays? What bonds are left? Why some of them come to search for their roots, while others object even to talk about it?

Finally, we believe this documentary will contribute with better relation of Lithuania and the Republic of South Africa – countries that have so much to share together.

Now you have a chance to make this impact by contributing to the project.

Original image: Molėtų krašto muziejus

The first challenge we faced is finding more information about the topic of the documentary, especially the one presented in a non-academic, narrative way. This led us to decide that  a documentary is the best way to tell the story.

Now the main obstacle is a plain geographical one. After one year of researching, reading, writing emails and meeting people, we feel prepared to get out on the field with our project. But almost 9000 kilometers between Vilnius and Johannesburg means we cannot simply go shoot around for the weekend. We intend on spending three weeks in South Africa, were we will meet everyone we Skyped at their place of residence.

We are going to use all Indiegogo funding, directly, for the production of the movie. Our goal is the minimum sum that is enough to make the documentary. We are searching for other sponsors and partners, so even if we do not reach our goal of €23 000, we can use your donations and make it happen. Moreover, your support means public interest, and that allows us to apply for funds more successfully.

 

You can see all our exclusive perks on your right. Would you like something else in exchange for your support? Don't hesitate to contact us and tell what other perks we should include.

Little or big, your help is highly appreciated and every donation counts.

There are a few other ways how you can help us:

  • Join Thunderclap and contribute the spread of the message. Everyone who joins agree to share our message on their social network. All at one time! That makes the message to reach much wider audience.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word about our campaign!
  • Follow us on Facebook, share our page and info about our documentary on social media and invite your friend to do the same.
  • Maybe you know someone who could be interested in our project. Maybe you are a Litvak living in South Africa, or any other place around the world, and our project would be interesting to your friends and community. Tell them about it and don’t hesitate to reach out to us.
  • Let’s Skype if you have something to tell us!

We are four storytellers based in Vilnius, Lithuania. We all have different backgrounds, but we are here for one purpose; uniting us all – to make a documentary that will answer all the questions you read above, the documentary that will speak directly to you.

We have a strong belief that there is an important, yet untold story to tell. Your motivation comes from getting deep into this topic and finding it of great significance to both, Lithuania and South Africa.

Being a young team allows us to see this topic fresh and without prejudices. Since we cannot stand watching slumberous documentaries, we seek to make this one captivating and visually pleasing.

Above all of this, we believe we can make it happen, we want to make it happen and we will.

 

Ieva Balsiūnaitė is a Lithuanian journalist and a storyteller mostly focusing on visual projects. For more than two years Ieva has been working as a news reporter for the Lithuanian National Television (LRT), mostly interested in social, cultural and political issues. Last year she created the 24-minute documentary film “Second Home”, which tells the story of an Iraqi refugee family after horrors of war starting a new life in Lithuania. Ieva also has experience working abroad, including producing TV packages on the vibrant Tallinn Music Week in Estonia and reporting on migrant crisis and human rights issues in Sicily, Italy. In 2016, Ieva received a Bachelor’s degree in journalism & communication at Vilnius University. As a part of her undergrad studies’ exchange program, she also studied TV production in Istanbul, Turkey at Bahcesehir University. Ieva is currently living in South America, where she is creating a visual story on Lithuanian descendants in Montevideo, Uruguay.

 

Viktorija Mickutė is a journalist from Lithuania with more than six years of professional experience, which includes working for the Lithuanian National Television in Vilnius and Al Jazeera English in Washington DC, U.S. She was awarded with a Fulbright scholarship to study at the University of Missouri's School of Journalism at Columbia, Missouri, U.S. She received a master's degree after creating a 22-minute documentary film "Invisible Her" about wives of American war veterans suffering from PTSD. In Washington DC, Viktorija worked for Emmy Award-winning current affairs investigative documentary show "Fault Lines" and social media talk show "The Stream". Currently, Viktorija hosts her own live TV segment on global social media trends on Lithuanian National TV. She also worked on independent documentary projects and reports on international issues, for example, she covered the aftermath of the Brussels terror attacks in March, and reported on the Syrian refugee crisis from Turkish-Syrian border.

Jonas Jakūnas is a Lithuania-based freelance filmmaker who has been working on various visual projects for the last 7 years. After graduating from the University of Portsmouth (Bsc Hons TV & Broadcasting) in 2013, he started working as an independent filmmaker. In the same year, Jonas had his videos screened in an exhibition in London (Creating Balance project). In 2014, he worked on a full-length documentary film “Arvydas Sabonis. 11”, which was mostly shot in the USA. In 2016, Jonas came back to the USA to shoot a TV series “Vatnikas” with popular Lithuanian comedy artist Oleg Surajev. The project took one month to shoot.

Lukas Keraitis is a student of Creative Industries at Vilnius Gediminas Technical University, Lithuania, currently spending a semester at the Sao Carlos School of engineering, Sao Paulo university, Brazil. While still at school, he worked as an advertiser for the classical music festival “Beatričės vasaros" where he produced short animated TV commercials and managed the festival's communication. For almost two years, Lukas had been hosting the radio show "Pats Sau Bosas" at "Žinių radijas" and interviewing young aspiring entrepreneurs. He also plays in the emerging alternative rock band "Abudu" and so far has produced two music videos for them.

We are super thankful for all who supported or supports us. Indiegogo backers are the one we bow to, but without some people, we wouldn't have even come this far.

BIG THANK YOU GOES TO:

Gavin Morris / South African Jewish museum, Leonas Rėčkus – Napo, Artūras Bulota / Talent Garden Kaunas, Viktorija Kazlienė / Molėtų krašto muziejus, Arnold Garber, Darius Degutis, Amit Belaitė, Neringa Jurčiukonytė / Nacionalinis socialinės integracijos institutas, Stephan Brown, Karina Simonson, Faina Kukliansky, Antanas Tamošaitis, Eli Rabinowitz, Monika Striaukaitė.
story_txt:
Majority of Litvaks left Lithuania for South Africa in the late 19th - the first half of the 20th centuries, right before the Holocaust shattered Europe, including Lithuania. For us Lithuanians, the fact that so many Litvaks currently live in South Africa is largely unknown. In the meantime, South African Litvaks still remember their homeland and hold on to old photos of wooden synagogues in their hometowns, portraits of their grandparents, and stories that have been passed down through generations. In this documentary, we want to include Robert (Ruvel) Videtzky. He is 93 years old and is one of a very few Litvaks who can recall, and share  their journey from Lithuania to South Africa.Original image: Molėtų krašto muziejusDuring almost a century, Litvaks successfully established themselves in South Africa. Some of them became well known in the arts or business worlds, others immersed into the political one, including fighting apartheid. While aforementioned Robert and others from his generation have memories of Lithuania or Lita, as it was called back then, their sons and daughters are actively exploring this Baltic country as it is now and its history. Original image: Molėtų krašto muziejusThe vibrant Litvak community in South Africa finds its ways to cherish bonds with Lithuania. But what will the future unfold? Will the young generation be interested in their grandparents’ homeland? What does Lithuania mean for them?Original image: Molėtų krašto muziejusThis documentary strives to answer all these questions and more, by giving a platform to the Litvak community in South Africa, to tell their story. Personal recounts and anecdotes will paint a tragedy - the Holocaust and war - yet hopeful - the new life in South Africa - picture of this part of the Lithuanian Jews’ history.Jewish history is Lithuanian history. It looks like only now this phase is becoming common. Filming the "march of the living ones", the 75th Anniversary of Massacre of Jews in Molėtai, showed the concern and memory we have about our past. Litvaks from all over the world came to the march, many Lithuanians joined.Our documentary is one more step towards a better understanding of our history, Litvaks being a part of it. Moreover, we aim to answer questions of today and tomorrow – how is the Litvaks community in SA doing nowadays? What bonds are left? Why some of them come to search for their roots, while others object even to talk about it?Finally, we believe this documentary will contribute with better relation of Lithuania and the Republic of South Africa – countries that have so much to share together.Now you have a chance to make this impact by contributing to the project.Original image: Molėtų krašto muziejusThe first challenge we faced is finding more information about the topic of the documentary, especially the one presented in a non-academic, narrative way. This led us to decide that  a documentary is the best way to tell the story.Now the main obstacle is a plain geographical one. After one year of researching, reading, writing emails and meeting people, we feel prepared to get out on the field with our project. But almost 9000 kilometers between Vilnius and Johannesburg means we cannot simply go shoot around for the weekend. We intend on spending three weeks in South Africa, were we will meet everyone we Skyped at their place of residence.We are going to use all Indiegogo funding, directly, for the production of the movie. Our goal is the minimum sum that is enough to make the documentary. We are searching for other sponsors and partners, so even if we do not reach our goal of €23 000, we can use your donations and make it happen. Moreover, your support means public interest, and that allows us to apply for funds more successfully. You can see all our exclusive perks on your right. Would you like something else in exchange for your support? Don't hesitate to contact us and tell what other perks we should include.Little or big, your help is highly appreciated and every donation counts.There are a few other ways how you can help us:
Join Thunderclap and contribute the spread of the message. Everyone who joins agree to share our message on their social network. All at one time! That makes the message to reach much wider audience.
Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word about our campaign!
Follow us on Facebook, share our page and info about our documentary on social media and invite your friend to do the same.
Maybe you know someone who could be interested in our project. Maybe you are a Litvak living in South Africa, or any other place around the world, and our project would be interesting to your friends and community. Tell them about it and don’t hesitate to reach out to us.
Let’s Skype if you have something to tell us!
