story:
The Story

We all have had times where we feel like giving up when things begin to get too hard and domino effects of bad circumstances happen. There are times where we feel we have to rethink our life and career goals based on feeling letting down or afraid of whether or not we will make it to where we want to be. 

The Good Life touches these feelings as we immerse ourselves in the story of Craig, an ex-nascar driver of the 70's struggling to feel passionate about anything since his career failure and divorce, and Haley, a spunky teenager who won't let anyone put her passions of roller dancing down and will do what it takes to make her dreams happen. We watch as she struggles to convince her uncle to partake in being her guardian in order to make her dream come true and ultimately watch him become inspired by her strength and will towards something she really loves. 

Keep up with our updates on Facebook! @TheGoodLifeShortFilm 

 

Writer // Director

Brittany Porter is a student finishing up her last year at the Art Institute of CA - Hollywood working towards a degree in Digital Cinema & Video Production. She grew up always knowing that she wanted to pursue a career within the entertainment industry, but it wasn't until she reached high school and watched her first Stanley Kubrick film, that she realized her heart gravitated towards film and design. Throughout the last 3 years, she has focused on making each project the best it can be all while continuously strengthening her skills within the art department. In the last year she has been able to freelance as a production designer of many short films, a web series, and is currently designing her second feature as well as set dressing and lending a helping art hand wherever needed. The Good Life will not only present her ability to direct a more narrative short film aside from her past experimental shorts, but also give her the ability to bring together another amazing crew who can be proud of the entire ending product.  

 

The Plan

Principle photography begins at the beginning of December, dates and locations are locked and we are currently in the auditioning process. 

The budget for The Good Life is mainly divided into 5 categories: Locations, Rentals, Production Design, Crew and of coarse, Food!

Locations: Locations have been locked and we have found beautiful places that fit the 1970's feeling from a house built during the 1960's and a roller rink that has the right disco vibes.

Rentals: Rentals include any equipment we will need to rent additional to what the school already provides. To keep the roller rink scene safe, we plan to do this with a steadicam and already have the perfect steadicam op.!

Production Design: The 1970's, yes, period piece. Locations are ready to be dressed and we've been scoping out swap meets and thrift stores for the perfect vintage finds at a deal. Our 1970s race car will come at a cost and specific period piece items and clothing still need help in contributions. Let's bring this 1970's rollerskate / race car dream to life. 

Crew:  As a group of creatives, we have all helped each other in some way in each of our own graduating films and outside projects, so we have a large number of us who are excited and dedicated to bring this story to life at little cost and with passion in order to make something great for each of our portfolios. We do have outside talent/crew budgeted here, such as those bringing their own kits and a roller skate dancing double for the rink.

Food: 4 long days and a group of talent and crew need their fuel to make this short film the best it can be.  

 

Risks & Challenges

We have thought out the major risks and challenges that we may face during production, such as making sure that we convey the 1970's in the most genuine way possible, permits and insurance that come with all locations, and keeping the team and talent safe while filming at the roller rink. We are confident and have taken many months under the guidance of great school instructors to make sure we address any issues that may occur in these areas. From locking in professional skate dance doubles and making sure that all insurance forms have been filled out, we are prepared and excited to bring The Good Life together.

story:
Who is the director ?

Pierre Rehov, an independent producer and director that has set out to expose the propaganda machine behind the fake news that you see every day on your television, in magazines or newspapers. 

For over 10 years, since the uprising of the second Intifada, Pierre Rehov has set out to debunk most of the mythologies which poison the political situation of the Middle East. While a large majority of international media correspondents are in a situation which does not allow them to tell the truth about the Israeli-Arab conflict.

In the words of Michael Margolies of the New York Press "If you're tired of the New York Times-NPR Slant on Israel and the Palestinians, here's good news: documentary filmmaker Pierre Rehov has been challenging prevailing myths since 2001. With ten films already to his credit and another on the way, this serious, never boring, and above all else courageous documentarian is starting to make some serious waves"

Renowned author Phillys Chestler, once called him " A lion in exile ". Although, he does not feel as being in exile anymore... since he made alyia to Israel !

Temple Mount

Recently, under the pressure of Arab dictatorships, and despite the advice of many world leaders, UNESCO has come with a resolution denying all connection between the Jewish People and Jerusalem, and mostly between the Jewish People, the Christians, and Temple Mount, which appears in this resolution only under its Muslim name : al-Ḥaram aš-Šarīf ( The noble Sanctuary ). The same goes with the Wailing Wall, the holiest place on earth for Jews, to which UNESCO referred only according to Muslim mythology (Mohammad is said to have attached his horse to the wall, before flying to heaven...)

While Jerusalem appears more than 700 times in the Bible, the name of the city doesn't appear even once in the Quran. It’s a disgrace to UNESCO and all the countries which voted for the resolution or abstained (shame on Europe, except for Germany and England), and it is a deplorable decision that is over-politicized, while ignoring historical and archaeological facts.

 

It is time to tell the truth in its historical context, about Temple Mount. This is a disgrace to anybody who thinks of themselves as a civilized, intelligent person. The contributions that we will receive shall go into making an elaborate documentary film on this touching matter. The true story of Temple Mount will be expressly unveiled and made available to the public this way.

Our goal is also to use the donations to massively promote the film to reach greater audience. It should be seen by at least ONE MILLION VIEWERS.

What we need

Your contribution will go towards completing the documentary explain the integral facts about the Temple Mount. This will establish the truth, once and for all and make it a point of historical reference. It will serve to educate the ignorant and those swayed by the politicised news reports.

We need funds at different levels:

  • To create the documentary film on the Temple Mount
  • To successfully produce and finish the film
  • To upload the film on social media ( Youtube, Vimeo, Dailymotion, Facebook etc... )
  • To renounce seeing any royalties in the future ( which represents a loss of $15,000 a year )
  • To promote the uploads through the same systems (buying clicks, uploading banners... )
  • Massive online publicity

We need $45,000 for this feat to be achieved and successfully executed. Our plan is ready and the production unit are all on standby to start on it. All we need is the donation. This is not our first, we have done similar ones in the past with massive success record. You can see the testimonial section or our site for this ( www.MiddleEastStudio.com).

Why support us

 

  • You support the truth
  • You want people to know the truth
  • You hate political news manipulations
  • You want our voice heard

“The most shocking moments of Rehov’s films involves blatant Palestinian efforts to manipulate the media” –Hanna Brown, Jerusalem Post

Risks & Challenges

Unfortunately, with almost NO TV NETWORK outside Israel, accepting to air our films, due to political correctness, pro-Arab views, fear of terrorism, or, simply, amateurism and lack of knowledge, we have resorted to taking the bull by the horn in our little way. Tiny drops makes the ocean. We host our films on various media where the general public can access it easily (Youtube, Vimeo, Dailymotion, Facebook etc).

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute financially, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help. So even if you love this idea but lack the resources to pledge to its success, there are some other ways you can use to ensure this.

Help Us By Sharing!

Please, use your social might! Tweet about us, like us on Facebook, or write a blog post!

You are more popular and more important than you could ever know! Thanks for helping us get the word out.

  • It’ll be a real help to this campaign and to me if you share the information with friends on social media –Facebook, twitter, Myspace, etc. This will draw a crowd of fellow passionate persons that can do what you might not.
  • Word of mouth publicity is also equally effective.
  • Talking about it and sharing the link with friends, family and co-worker will jumpstart this campaign and ensure its success.

You are more popular and more important than you could ever know! Thanks for helping us get the word out.

THANK YOU SO MUCH !

Thank you for taking the time to go through our project. We truly appreciate it!

We have a promise to keep. Our promise is to get this video. We will not relent nor compromise its integrity.

We will, with your esteemed help promote this film to be seen by at least ONE MILLION VIEWERS.

In order to get this done, we need your help.

 We have come to you in order to raise the needed funds.  These funds will cover the costs of shooting the video and promoting it despite the odds. Your contributions are deeply appreciated.

We thank you so much!

Testimonies

“The most shocking moments of Rehov’s films involve blatant Palestinian efforts to manipulate the media” 
Hanna Brown 
Jerusalem Post

 

“The information that Rehov does provide is based on interviewees who use bona fide images and documents to substantiate their claim” 

Tamar Stenhal 
Camera

“There is only one filmaker who has presented the truth in the matter of the Palestinian-Israeli conflict, and his nom de guerre is Pierre Rehov” 

Phyllis Chesler 
Author of The New Antisemitism

 

“Everyone is asking the same questions: How should we respond to terrorism? Should we be afraid of it? What does it mean for our future? Pierre Rehov, a French filmmaker, by no means purports to answer all of these questions. He’s headed in the right direction, though – Suicide Killers, his latest documentary, approaches the problem of Islamic extremism in a way that is very different from the typical Western approach.” 

Amanda Schuster 
European Weekly

“Seeing Pierre Rehov’s documentary film ‘The Silent Exodus’ about the expulsion and flight of a million Sephardi Jews helped me gain a better understanding of the tragedy of a community that was integral and fundamental to Arab society.” 

Magdi Allam 
Il Corriere Della Serra

“I am so used to seeing lame and superficial propaganda that blames Americans and Israelis for the acts of terrorists, that this totally caught me off guard. It is very refreshing to see someone who actually takes terrorists at their own words and who examines the pathologies within a culture that spawn the thirst for mass death and suicide.” 

Jamie Glazov 
FrontPage Magazine

“Everyone is asking the same questions: How should we respond to terrorism? Should we be afraid of it? What does it mean for our future? Pierre Rehov, a French filmmaker, by no means purports to answer all of these questions. He’s headed in the right direction, though – Suicide Killers, his latest documentary, approaches the problem of Islamic extremism in a way that is very different from the typical Western approach.” 

Amanda Schuster 
European Weekly

Unfortunately, with almost NO TV NETWORK outside Israel, accepting to air our films, due to political correctness, pro-Arab views, fear of terrorism, or, simply, amateurism and lack of knowledge, we have resorted to taking the bull by the horn in our little way. Tiny drops makes the ocean. We host our films on various media where the general public can access it easily (Youtube, Vimeo, Dailymotion, Facebook etc).

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute financially, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help. So even if you love this idea but lack the resources to pledge to its success, there are some other ways you can use to ensure this.
Help Us By Sharing!
Please, use your social might! Tweet about us, like us on Facebook, or write a blog post!

You are more popular and more important than you could ever know! Thanks for helping us get the word out.

It’ll be a real help to this campaign and to me if you share the information with friends on social media –Facebook, twitter, Myspace, etc. This will draw a crowd of fellow passionate persons that can do what you might not.
Word of mouth publicity is also equally effective.
Talking about it and sharing the link with friends, family and co-worker will jumpstart this campaign and ensure its success.

You are more popular and more important than you could ever know! Thanks for helping us get the word out.
THANK YOU SO MUCH !


Thank you for taking the time to go through our project. We truly appreciate it!

We have a promise to keep. Our promise is to get this video. We will not relent nor compromise its integrity.
We will, with your esteemed help promote this film to be seen by at least ONE MILLION VIEWERS.
In order to get this done, we need your help.
 We have come to you in order to raise the needed funds.  These funds will cover the costs of shooting the video and promoting it despite the odds. Your contributions are deeply appreciated.
We thank you so much!

Testimonies
“The most shocking moments of Rehov’s films involve blatant Palestinian efforts to manipulate the media” Hanna Brown Jerusalem Post
 
“The information that Rehov does provide is based on interviewees who use bona fide images and documents to substantiate their claim” Tamar Stenhal Camera
“There is only one filmaker who has presented the truth in the matter of the Palestinian-Israeli conflict, and his nom de guerre is Pierre Rehov” Phyllis Chesler Author of The New Antisemitism “Everyone is asking the same questions: How should we respond to terrorism? Should we be afraid of it? What does it mean for our future? Pierre Rehov, a French filmmaker, by no means purports to answer all of these questions. He’s headed in the right direction, though – Suicide Killers, his latest documentary, approaches the problem of Islamic extremism in a way that is very different from the typical Western approach.” Amanda Schuster European Weekly
“Seeing Pierre Rehov’s documentary film ‘The Silent Exodus’ about the expulsion and flight of a million Sephardi Jews helped me gain a better understanding of the tragedy of a community that was integral and fundamental to Arab society.” Magdi Allam Il Corriere Della Serra
“I am so used to seeing lame and superficial propaganda that blames Americans and Israelis for the acts of terrorists, that this totally caught me off guard. It is very refreshing to see someone who actually takes terrorists at their own words and who examines the pathologies within a culture that spawn the thirst for mass death and suicide.” Jamie Glazov FrontPage Magazine
“Everyone is asking the same questions: How should we respond to terrorism? Should we be afraid of it? What does it mean for our future? Pierre Rehov, a French filmmaker, by no means purports to answer all of these questions. He’s headed in the right direction, though – Suicide Killers, his latest documentary, approaches the problem of Islamic extremism in a way that is very different from the typical Western approach.” Amanda Schuster European Weekly

story:
What is Secret?

Secret is an 18 minute short film that was written by Cesa Pledger. Nicola and Kimi are each struggling with the loss of a parent. Nicola is watching her mother, Cheryl, slowly die from dementia; Cheryl is only 66 years old. Kimi also lost both of her parents a few years ago. She recently decided to look for answers to her unresolved questions about her family. Both women find it very difficult to connect with anyone during this time. As their paths collide, perhaps they will be able to connect to each other.

 

Origins

Secret is a film written by Cesa Pledger about her own experience with her father as he died slowly from a form of dementia at the same age of 66. During this time, Cesa had to go through her father's belongings and decide which items to keep. While looking through old pictures, she began to wonder about how much she knew about her father. Cesa wants to share her story of the last six months with her father. While it was heart-wrenching, it was beautiful, healing, and therapeutic for her. 

On the other side of losing your parents, what if you never really knew who your parents really are? 

Who are we?

Cesa Pledger, Writer, Actor, Filmmaker, Coach 

Cesa Pledger is an actress, writer, and director living in NYC. Secret will be her directorial debut in film. Cesa graduated from the University of Florida with a bachelor's degree in Construction Management and an MBA. After working for over 5 years in the construction field in NYC, she decided to leave her career to follow her dream of becoming an actor and creator. She has acted on Off-Broadway stages and many short/feature films. She is also the creator of the web series, Welcome Home, on YouTube.

In 2011, Cesa Pledger helped Eden Marryshow make a dream a reality by co-creating Dream Big, Go Hard!. A workshop that helps people of all ages expand their level of consciousness, identify their desires, and harness the driving force to achieve. 

Ysmael G Reyes, Producer, Actor

Ysmael is an Actor, Writer, Producer (in no particular order) from New Jersey.  Son of Dominican imigrants, Ysmael went to college to become a Doctor but decided he'd much rather play one on the screen.  Now a Maggie Flanigan Studio graduate and Oscar watcher, Ysmael is on the right track, or "a" track.  Too tall for real life, too short for the NBA.  Ysmael is proud to be part of this project.  Cesa is the bomb and has really brought an amazing story to tell.

Eden Marryshow, Executive Producer, Actor, Coach

For over a decade, Eden served New York City’s Department of Education where he taught special needs children with patience and compassion. Demonstrating outstanding prowess as a teacher, Eden also embraced his position as father figure and role model to many of New York City’s most marginalized youth. Following the tragic death of one of Eden’s most resilient and promising students, he resigned from the public school system and pursued his burgeoning career as writer, filmmaker and actor.

Naming his company 511 Films after his first class of students, Eden wrote, acted, directed and produced two independent feature films This Thing Called Love, and EKLYPSE.  Other film credits include HBO’s The Normal Heart, Slick Naim’s Full Circle, My Darling is a Foreigner, Alone, Emile and the City, Out There, Freeloader, Gowanus 83, Loft and Lotto Land. Television credits include Blue Bloods, Famous Farrah, Unforgettable, Gotham, Boardwalk Empire and Nurse Jackie. 

In 2011 Eden coined the mantra, “Dream, Big, Go Hard!” to inspire people to expand their level of consciousness, identify their desires and harness the driving force to achieve. With the help of Cesa Pledger his movement, Dream, Big, Go Hard!, was born. He is a motivational coach within the performing arts community, and the world at large. The workshop has also brought him full circle, back to the schools of his early career to teach youth and young adults to stay focused while using their gifts and talents to improve the world.

Current Cast Members:

Cesa Pledger playing the lead role of Nicola Ward.

Jean Goto playing the lead role of Kimi Sullivan.

Lisa Lamattina playing the role of Nurse Cathy.

Eden Marryshow playing the role of Michael Ward.

Sasha Dominy playing the role of Meghan.

Kimberley Mitchell playing the role of Samantha.

Ysmael G Reyes playing the role of Gill.

Saim Hyder playing the role of Pete. 

Anna Dart playing the role of Natasha.

Cristina Garcia Léon playing the role of Mrs. Baker.

Charlotte Hampden playing the role of Cheryl Audrey Adkins.

How you can help!

Thanks to the help and support of so many amazing people, we've already secured many production items free of charge and our original campaign paid for everything through production. Now, we are looking to raise some of our finishing funds, including:

Editor: FRANK HEATH - The editor of the critically acclaimed independent film, Donald Cried.

Color Correction: Technicolor PostWorks New York

D.I. Conform & Colorist:

SEAN R. SMITH

D.I. Producer:

ANTHONY LaGREGA

Sound Mix: 

Sound Effects Editors:

RANDLE AKERSON

F. HUDSON MILLER, MPSE

DAVID KERN

DONALD J. MALOUF

Supervising ADR & Dialogue Editor:

VAL KUKLOWSKY

Dialogue Editors:

JOHN KWIATKOWSKI

FRANK SMATHERS

CHARLES W. RITTER

ADR Editors:

G. W. BROWN

JULIE FEINER

ELIZA ZEBERT

Supervising Foley Editor:

PIERO MURA

Foley Editor:

MATTHEW HARRISON

The Impact

With your help, we will be able to create a film to the highest standard as filmmakers. Also, you will be contributing to the support of films created by women with diverse casting. We met our previous budgeting goals and a shoot period of only 6 days. We want to add our new team members for Post-Production that provide the highest quality in their field making this film as impactful as possible. Any donation, big or small makes a significant difference to us.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you just can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can’t support us:

Share our campaign on below Facebook, Twitter, or anywhere you hang out online.

Tell your friends. Tell your family. Tell your co-workers. Tell everybody!

Be an integral part of bringing Secret to life

story:
Short Summary

Viral Films UK, Dark Sun Entertainment and Death Vault Productions present:

"Run" a Short horror film about a young woman who has to stay one step ahead of a powerful supernatural being. 






The crew behind Run is: James Craigie (Writer/Producer), Michelle Barry (Cinematographer/Producer), Adam Woodhams (Music Score/Sound design) and Daniel Mark Young (Director/Editor/Producer).


Our goal is simple, to make an entertaining short film experience that will have viewers on the edge of their seats. We are extremely passionate about making films and have already produced a couple of shorts that are available online (See Below).



We are a group of film lovers and more importantly horror geeks who love scary movies, with "Run" we want to produce a heart-pounding, tense and yet actually scary experience utilising great cinematography and amazing sound design and music. 

Basically, we want to make horror films scary again!

Cast:

Mari Beaseley as Suzanne

Luke Burridge as Tom



What We Need & What You Get

Here's a breakdown of what we need:

  • Lens Hire (3-4 day period)
  • 3 Axis Gimble Hire
  • Lighting Equipment Hire (3-4 day Period)
  • Costumes
  • Make-up FX 
  • Smoke Machine hire (3-4 day Period)
  • SFX post production budget
  • Sound Mix Budget
While the project itself will cost over £1000 to produce we already have over half the money for this project. The £600 we are trying to crowdfund is for the above items needed for production and the few elements we require in post-production to add the polish we need so that our project stands out.
In return we are offering a Thank You on twitter via our personal accounts, A credit at the end of the film as well as extras like Executive producer credits and even Digital Copies of the short film including extras like Behind the scenes footage, also early access to all this a month before its official release on Youtube & Vimeo.
We would love to offer more, like T-Shirts, DVDs/Blu rays etc but we just don't have the money to produce those, if we did we wouldn't need your help. So starting at the low price of £5 (about as much as a cup of coffee) you can get a credit at the end of our short film.

The Impact

Your contribution (no matter how big or small) is extremely important, we want to make the best possible short film we can without spending ridiculous amounts of money, the money we hope to raise will make a massive difference to the overall quality of the final product and will help us achieve that much quicker. 

All the above elements in the breakdown soon add up and although we have some gear (i.e. Camera,Rig, Monitors, Editing and sound gear) these other essential parts will make our vision achievable. 

Risks & Challenges

Overall this project is the biggest thing we have attempted to date and obviously will have it's risks, rewards and certainly challenges.

The main challenges we have are within the production itself, the story is set at night and shooting in very low-light conditions proves to be tricky, our plan to resolve such issues is to film while a small amount of natural light is available to us and use some clever lighting techniques, then darken the footage in post production to make it look later in the evening than it really is. These tricks combined with some Colour correction will mean we can capture as much detail in the image and still achieve the dark, night-time look we want. 

Other challenges we face are within post production, we plan to have a few FX shots that are essential in selling the supernatural aspect of the story. While these FX are achievable they also require a lot of testing, preparation and time.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to help us out but can't contribute financially then we would really appreciate the following:

  • Spreading the word via social media, Facebook, Twitter etc
  • Sharing the link to this campaign.

We thank each and every one of you in advance.

story:
Hello, Friends!

First of all, let us thank you for your attention and sorry for incorrect English.

We are from Novosibirsk, Russia. Yes, this city is in cold Siberia, far away from you :) Like every person living here, we dream of the warmest days of the year. Especially if in those days is possible to get married. We dreamed about it for 4 years, but first we are study, then Anton went to Army. Now we are ready to do this!

We are big fans of Tolkien's works and would like to spend our wedding in the style of The Lord of the Rings book. We were inspired by this wedding and would like to repeat the same thing.

Сeremony planned for August 2016. We can not wait for this! If all goes well, as conceived, this will be the best day ever!

We already have a small amount of money, but this is not enough for the ceremony. Please, help us to make our dreams into reality!

story:
"Hey guys,

It's Adam here! I'm  undertaking this project from a Producer/Director roll... sounds daunting I know, but an up close and personal film of a transitioning trans man is something that could help thousands and even save lives.

I am a full time filmmaker and have been for the last 5 or 6 years working in a variety of areas in the industry from fashion, to music videos. 

The reason I got into filmmaking was to create documentaries. Documentaries aren't about glitz or glamour, they're about capturing real life and real people - and that is what the transatlantic Departures is building to be.

Dylan, who happens to be a trans man, is one of the coolest and bravest people I know and is doing what he needs to do to be happy. I have been lucky enough to have been asked to document the inspirational journey for both Dylan and his partner Billy. 

I have the massive blessing to have access to these people at an invasive and emotional time in their lives, with no restrictions. 

The tensions, the travelling, the laughs, tears and even the reveal are all set to be captured.

With this amazing access to these great people, I will be telling the story of what it's like to be a trans man, what the UK healthcare system is like, and just how far some people are willing to go to allow themselves to be there person they know they are.

I am not aiming to make a profit from this piece, for me it's a privilege to be able to documents Dylan's story. However, the project is taking up a lot of time, and is incurring a lot of costs already... and this is early days. All I need to do is to be able to make it so I'm not losing money, so I can pay bills, rent any extra filming gear we need and help with the costs of travelling to Florida to film the days surrounding the operation.

When we reach the end of the project, any money that isn't accounted for won't just be pocketed, it will be passed on to relevant charities to help others in similar situations to what Dylan is in now.

Please help if you can, I truly believe this is something special, I believe Dylan is a special dude and I am certain we can improve or even save lives by showing just what can be done when you need something badly enough.

Many thanks!

Adam Fitch

(Producer/Director for Departures)"

-------------

"Hi Dylan here!

Something just has to change - I want people to realise how important trans health care is and that it is not the same as elective cosmetic surgery or health care. These things are literally needed for us to continue with our lives.

Too many trans identifying people are being left without adequate care or access to facilities across the world.

This is highlighted by the fact it is easier for me to travel across the world for a procedure than it is to achieve the same care through the NHS.

My waiting times have also been fairly minimal compared to others in the system but it still pushed me to this crazy flamingo laced journey.

Many documentary films are outdated and focus wholly on the surgical aspects - this will be an honest story of daily struggles and triumphs that I face on my own personal journey, along with my partner Billy and of course our camera friend Adam, on the journey to and from surgery rather than focusing on the medical aspects of the surgery itself.

As a practicing artist, I struggled for a while on whether it was the right choice to make this film, and even to address the issue within my own art practice. I eventually came to the conclusion that it would be a complete waste of an opportunity if I didn’t do something with it. So this is it - let's film the how as well as the what and raise awareness to bring about change"

(Producer/Director for Departures)"-------------"Hi Dylan here!Something just has to change - I want people to realise how important trans health care is and that it is not the same as elective cosmetic surgery or health care. These things are literally needed for us to continue with our lives. Too many trans identifying people are being left without adequate care or access to facilities across the world.This is highlighted by the fact it is easier for me to travel across the world for a procedure than it is to achieve the same care through the NHS. My waiting times have also been fairly minimal compared to others in the system but it still pushed me to this crazy flamingo laced journey.Many documentary films are outdated and focus wholly on the surgical aspects - this will be an honest story of daily struggles and triumphs that I face on my own personal journey, along with my partner Billy and of course our camera friend Adam, on the journey to and from surgery rather than focusing on the medical aspects of the surgery itself. As a practicing artist, I struggled for a while on whether it was the right choice to make this film, and even to address the issue within my own art practice. I eventually came to the conclusion that it would be a complete waste of an opportunity if I didn’t do something with it. So this is it - let's film the how as well as the what and raise awareness to bring about change"

story:
In short, A Fantastic Wreck tackles what it's like to be a teenage girl on the small island of Kauai who wants love but searches for it in all the wrong places. 

A Fantastic Wreck is an indigenous, coming-of-age short film about Ruby, a teenage girl struggling with intimacy, who tries to keep her relationship with good-guy Kalei conflict free. But when her absent-minded mother invites Ruby's cheating ex to a family party, Ruby must decide whether she wants to take him back and perpetuate the cycle of maintaining meaningless relationships or face her intimacy issues head on and perhaps move on to something that's actually good for her.

Aloha! I'm Kelsey Duvauchelle and I am the writer and director of A Fantastic Wreck. I'm very excited to tell this story because it's one that is very personal to me. I'll admit, when I was sixteen I thought I had all the answers. Ha! Boy, did life prove me wrong. Ruby's story and mine are one and the same. We make mistakes, we stumble and fall, but ultimately we learn from our experiences and grow. 

With the help of my amazing producers, Taryn Alisna and Charli Knight, we plan to tell Ruby's story with a fresh and unique voice. Oh, and Kea Brown will be there too.       

  • Travel fees! (We're flying 10 people to Kauai and back to Oahu, and you know how much it costs to fly from island to island...)
  • Lodging (some of our incredible actors need to be put up)
  • FOOD (We have several scenes with many extras and we need to feed them for their time and effort)
  • Location fees 
  • Wardrobe 
  • Production Design
  • Festival fees 

  • Keep it! We don't want you to starve.
  • Tell all of your wealthy friends and relatives about this film and the awesome perks they can get in return!
  • You can help spread the word on social media (Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and don't forget about the IndieGoGo share tools)
  • Every little bit counts! Remember, small amounts add up if enough people are involved!

story:
Short Summary

"Josh's Journal" the movie, is the feature film version of the very popular, long-running webseries - "Josh's Journal."  For the past ten years, "Josh's Journal" has followed the Life of Josh in High School. Now, in the feature film, Josh is off to college. He will expereince new friends, new adventures, and all with a Futuristic Twist. 
Josh Abrams, Creator, Director of "Josh's Journal" has teamed up with E+ Productions to get his Vision to the Big Screen. E+ Productions is a part of DDSO-Employment Plus, https://www.facebook.com/employmentplus  providing employment training opportunities to adults with intellectual delays and developmental disabilities. Part of this training includes Video Production. The Crew of this feature film is comprised of students within the E+ Production workshops. This film is giving the E+ students the opportunity to get paid for production work. DDSO-Employment Plus: www.ddso.org

What We Need & What You Get

We've completed all of the Character Audio Work. Right now, we need money for:

  • PRODUCTION: Building Sets, Creating all of the Felt Characters, Paying Cast and Crew stipends for lending us their many talents. (80% of this budget goes back directly to the Cast & Crew - 69%  Crew & 11% to The Actors) 
  • POST PRODUCTION: funds are needed to Edit, create all of the many Sound EFX, and Music
  • DISTRIBUTION: Our plan is to  rent  the Crest Theatre here in Sacramento, CA. The Crest has been a film icon in our community for years. Many film festivals take place in this restored Art Deco venue.

The Impact

To all of us working on this project, this is more than simply "a film."

  • It provides paid work experience in the film industry to the disabled students working at DDSO-Employment Plus
  • 10 Years of Success with "Josh's Journal", the web series. Episodes have been screened multiple years at the Sacramento ComicCon.
  • Through this project, we are helping to build/promote the local growing film industry. Sacramento is making films!!!

Risks & Challenges

There are always risks attached to making movies, but E+ has assembled The Team to get it done.

  • We have more than 30 combined years of Film Production and Post Work.
  • We have brought in some of the Top Acting Talent in Northern California, Nevada, Mississippi, and Georgia to bring the voices of this film to life.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute? This doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Share The Word. Tell people about this page! Use Indiegogo share tools and often!
  • Go to the official facebook site for "Josh's Journal", the movie and LIKE,Invite Friends, and SHARE. https://www.facebook.com/joshsjournalthemovie
  • Go to the YouTube site for "Josh's Journal" and SUBSCRIBE
  • https://www.youtube.com/user/joshjournal
  • We thank each and everyone of you for all you are doing, will do, can do, and shall do. :)

story:
My name is Sarah Ann Warren and I am a female filmmaker local to the Louisville film community. I have spent the past two years working on several projects to learn what actually goes into making a film. I have met some amazing and truly talented individuals who have taught me so much in such little time. I am still learning new things everyday that I walk onto a set. Not only have I learned a lot of the technical aspects of film, a lot of finding myself has came about in my adventures of film making. I have found that I too, need to create. I need to tell stories in my own way. I don't always belong on the technical side of someone else's vision. I want my own visions come to life as well. And with that need and the drive to be the best I can be at what I love to do, I have decided to write my very first script called Pretense. Every experience is a learning one, and I am so excited to take on a new endeavor and to learn even more about something I love and am so passionate about.

Being as this is my very first project, I do not have the equipment it takes to make something like this possible. I have created this campaign in order to raise the money to create the best film possible. A donation, no matter how big or small, can help make an aspiring filmmaker's dream come true.  

What Is Needed 

I have set my goal at $2,500. This will cover getting equipment and also feeding and taking care of my actors and crew. To have a successful film, having a happy production team is key. They work long days without payment a lot of times so having food, snacks, and drinks can make the difference in morale and how they work together as a team. I have listed links below to the equipment I would like to purchase to make this possible. The equipment alone makes up about $1,300 of the goal. I would like to schedule shooting over the course of 7 days and put the remainder of the goal toward craft services, transportation of cast and crew, and the fees that come along with submitting to film festivals all over the world. 

Canon EOS Rebel T6i
Canon EF 50mm f/1.8 lense
Manfrotto Lightweight Fluid Tripod

The Impact

The balance between male and female filmmakers is extremely uneven. According to the Center for the Study of Women in Television and Film, only 26% of women were accounted for as directors, writers, executive producers, producers, editors and cinematographers working on independently produced feature-length films (documentaries and narrative features) in 2014-15. Also, women comprised 20% of those working in key behind the scenes roles on the top 700 theatrically released films and only 13% of directors on those films in 2014-15.

Not only will funding this film make it come to life, it can also be a message to every girl out there who has a dream of becoming a filmmaker but feels as though its not her place in the industry. We have a voice, and we owe it to the future of film to be heard and bring awareness to the group of women who have the need to express themselves through the art of film. 

Other Ways You Can Help

It is understood that some of you may not be able to donate with money, but if you are willing to donate just a couple minutes of your time to help spread the word about the campaign and the message behind it, you're just as valuable as those who donate monetarily. Indiegogo has incorporated share tools for almost every media outlet out there, be sure to utilize them! 

Remember, you do not have to donate toward a perk! You can donate any amount you see fit to. Thank you so much for believing in my dream, you all are truly amazing!
