story:
Short Summary

HI! My name is Jordan Chang and I'm currently in my final year studying Film & TV Production at Northumbria University. I am producing and directing a short film called '1.5 mm' (working title).

The film takes a look at the relationship between a father and a daughter, it explores the expectations and pressures of a competitive sport. It looks at the balancing act of having a job to fund the sport with the hours required of training to become one of the greats. 

I have fenced for over half of my life and it has been a part of my family even before i was born. I have represented England in this sport abroad and I believe that this gives me the capacity to realistically depict the fight scenes in this short film.

As this is a student film, we have no budget to make the film which is why I ask if you could so generously donate to make this film happen. Every penny helps!

All money will help with hiring out sport venues/ fencing equipment etc.
story_txt: Short Summary HI! My name is Jordan Chang and I'm currently in my final year studying Film & TV Production at Northumbria University. I am producing and directing a short film called '1.5 mm' (working title).The film takes a look at the relationship between a father and a daughter, it explores the expectations and pressures of a competitive sport. It looks at the balancing act of having a job to fund the sport with the hours required of training to become one of the greats. I have fenced for over half of my life and it has been a part of my family even before i was born. I have represented England in this sport abroad and I believe that this gives me the capacity to realistically depict the fight scenes in this short film.As this is a student film, we have no budget to make the film which is why I ask if you could so generously donate to make this film happen. Every penny helps!All money will help with hiring out sport venues/ fencing equipment etc.

story:
This story follows a day in the life of two young roommates Mar and Shane. Mar brings home Jessica, his usual chick. But, while Mar and Jessica are in the bedroom her jealous husband shows up at the apartment. Immediately things escalate into a deadly situation. Mar and Shane are now forced to figure out how to dispose of a dead body. The roommates decide to enlist the help of a local drug dealer and an ex-con, that's when things get even crazier. And just when they think things can’t get any worse, a snooping detective shows up at the apartment and discovers the crime scene.

99 Problems is a feature length comedy produced by Mazi O. & Phil "Success" Hardy. We begin shooting November 7th 2015.


The Director

My name is Mazi Oyo, I am an accomplished video director with over 400 music videos and interviews in my repertoire with over 60 million combined views. My video production work has been featured on every major Hip-Hop website including MTV, XXL, RapRadar, Vibe, and Worldstarhiphop.

Throughout my career I have been blessed to have worked with notable artists such as Jadakiss, Meek Mill, Raekwon, Black Rob, French Montana, Lil Kim, Maino, and Troy Ave., just to name a few.

This year I directed my first feature length film, an independent romantic comedy called “Dear Playtime”. More recently I was cinematographer for the short film “Going Home”. 

My body of work has allowed me to be featured and interviewed by several major media outlets including MTV, The Source, Sway In The Morning and New Yorks Hot 97FM. 


The Executive Producer

Hardy is a consultant and entertainment manager, “Success” began managing the careers of such artists as Littles of MOBB DEEP, Sauce Money of ROCAFELLA RECORDS, and DJ Absolut of New York’s radio station HOT 97. He has produced, consulted, and worked with other artists such as Ceelo Green, Busta Rhymes, DJ Kid Capri, Scott Storch, Maino, Raekwon, and Benzino, just to name a few.

In 2006, he was the driving force behind the success of the RICK ROSS single “HUSTLIN”. While in a Miami club “Success” heard DJ Khaled play the song “HUSTLIN” for the first time and knew it was a hit record. He got the song from DJ Khaled and sent it to NY Hot 97’s DJ Absolut to play on the radio which ultimately led to RICK ROSS signing a record deal with DEF JAM. 


The Movie

The 99 Problems movie is my debut as a writer, producer and director. I've always wanted to transition from music videos to shooting for the big screen. Many of my friends are either accomplished actors, or aspiring actors but one thing they all had in common was not finding enough work. I also felt like there was not enough opportunities for my friends so I set out to create a series of projects with this being the first of many.

99 Problems is a goofy urban comedy created for us, by us. Your contribution will not only be helping create an instant urban classic, it will be ushering in a new era in comedy. We live in what I call the "social media" days & times. A recent online phenomenon has made regular folks with just a smart phone and an idea become something called an "instagram comedian" or "vine celebrity" or "social media star". When I started this script I purposely created characters based on a cast of social media stars, mixed with solid experienced actors.


PRINCIPAL CAST:

Marc J. Jefferies-

Marc made his debut, as a toddler, as the title character Isaiah in the 1995 movie Losing Isaiah as a toddler. He was also featured as a child spokesman in commercials for PeoplePC.

Jefferies also appeared in The Haunted Mansion, Stuart Little 2, Charlie's Angels: Full Throttle and Spider-Man 2. In 2002, he played the role of Young Dre in the movie Brown Sugar. Jefferies has done voiceovers in the films Finding Nemo and Monsters, Inc..  His career also includes works on the small screen, including his role as Derrick on the NBC sitcom The Tracy Morgan Show.

In 2005, Marc portrayed a young Curtis '50 Cent' Jackson in Get Rich or Die Tryin'. In 2009 he portrayed the rapper Lil' Cease in the feature film Notorious, a biopic about The Notorious B.I.G. He guest starred as Wendell, a drug dealer’s doorman, in the TV series Dexter during its third season. Jefferies appears in the feature film Big Mommas: Like Father Like Son (2012).

In 2015 he played Bunch in Brotherly Love. He also portrays Darius on Treme, the HBO drama series set in post-Katrina New Orleans. Jefferies also had a role in the hit Starz series, Power.

Julito McCullum-

McCullum was featured in the miniseries "Miracles Boys", which was directed by Spike Lee, LeVar Burton, Ernest Dickerson, Neema Burnette and Bill Duke (2004). He then landed the role of Jamal in the Emmy nominated "Wool Cap" starring William H. Macy and newcomer KeKe Palmer. A year and a half later, Julito excelled with guest-starring roles in "Hack" on CBS, commercials, including the Jordan 20th anniversary commercial with Spike Lee. He was also in the movie "Akeelah and the Bee" starring Angela Bassett, Lawrence Fishburn and his good friend Ke-Ke Palmer. Julito’s most notable role was as Naymond Brice, son of Weebay on the hit HBO series, The Wire. McCullum most recently starred in Brotherly Love (2015). He is currently in the new HBO mini-series Show Me A Hero.

James “Lil Cease” Lloyd-

Lloyd (more commonly known as Cease) is an original member of hip hop group Junior M.A.F.I.A.. Cease released his first album, Conspiracy, with Junior M.A.F.I.A. in 1995 and was catapulted to mainstream attention with a memorable verse on "Player's Anthem", the album's highest charting single. Frequent name dropping from his mentor The Notorious B.I.G. helped Cease throughout his career as it helped keep the young rapper in the spotlight. Cease was featured on the Def Jam-released soundtrack for the 1997 comedy film How to Be a Player alongside LeVert, Cam'ron and fellow Harlem rapper Mase. He is also known for being a featured artist on Lil' Kim's record Crush on You from her debut album Hard Core, which was a number 1 hit on the Rap Songs chart. Lil Cease has had small acting roles in Paper Soldiers (2002), and State Property 2 (2005).

Tekomin "Tek" Williams-

Tek is best known as a member of the duo Smif-N-Wessun, and the Hip Hop collective Boot Camp Clik. Tek debuted on Black Moon's 1993 album Enta Da Stage with his rhyming partner Steele. In 1994, Smif-N-Wessun released their debut single "Bucktown", which became a Billboard Hot 100 hit, and gave Brooklyn the nickname "Bucktown, home of the original gun clappers". Smif-N-Wessun dropped their debut album Dah Shinin' in early 1995, a release that is now hailed as a classic underground Hip Hop album.

Shemar “Lowkey Mar” Phillips-

Phillips is a young social media comedian with a huge following on Instagram, Vine, Twitter, Youtube and Facebook, Lowkey Mar has been mentioned by Vibe as one of the top funniest accounts on Instagram. Don Diva magazine also acknowledged Lowkey Mar’s comedic ability. Recently the hit web series “Money & Violence” incorporated one of Mar’s famous lines “Drink some tea” into an episode. His latest parody music video has over 300,000 views on YouTube. Shemar recently appeared in the romantic comedy “Playtime”.

Also notable co-stars:

Shiggy, Jaden the God, Uncle Murda, Dylan, Jazzy Joyce, and Vita.


. 



The Funding

 I am looking to raise approximately $10,000 in this first round of funding. This money will cover equipment rental, the crew (camera men, make up, sound and lighting, etc.) It will also cover the principal actors transportation and things like food services. 


The Benefits

I have decided that I wanted to add some unique perks not traditionally offered but also add the normally expected ones as well. Things like thank you credits, producer credit, speaking/non-speaking cameo, product placements, attend wrap party with the cast, etc. 

 The Good Stuff
Our principal cast has a combined social media following of almost 2 million active followers on Instagram alone. The social media marketing campaign is designed to fully take advantage of their viral power. The movie will be distributed thru most digital outlets such as Google play, iTunes, Netflix, Redbox, Hulu, and others.


The Risks

The main risks would be if we somehow fall short on creating awareness. I feel like the combination of having seasoned well-known actors, social media stars, and successful rappers turned actors will help build up the proper amount of awareness. The promotion of this movie is a well thought out plan.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help. If you can't make a contribution, you can do your part by telling someone about the project or helping us promote on social media when the movie is finished. Thank you.

story:
About Our Film

We are creating a feature film version of the beloved classic Grimms fairytale, The Twelve Dancing Princesses.  This film will have all the romance and magical enchantment of traditional feature film fairytales with a strong message of empowerment for girls.  


We are also committed to diversity.  We have the good fortune to have 12 young ladies with prominent roles in our film and we would like them to come in all sizes, colors and ethnicities to reflect the diversity of our audience and highlight the sisterhood between all girls and women.


We are reclaiming the fairytale with its original story intact.  Unlike many fairytale movies, where the depth and power of the original story have been whitewashed, we are keeping some of the darker aspects of this story intact while still creating a family friendly film for audiences of all ages to enjoy.  


Our message of feminine empowerment touches all aspects of the production.  Our writer/director is a woman who feels strongly about creating content she would be happy to show her own daughter, free from the over-sexualized images or snarky tone being marketed to young girls today.  The film itself tells the story of 12 teenage girls on the threshold of womanhood who must make tough decisions, even when it's hard, and do the right thing as they grow into the kind of young women who can feel proud of themselves and serve as models for others.  They embrace a message of sisterhood, integrity and staying true to your heart! 


Our films shape our culture and with female directors only creating 7% of the content coming out of Hollywood, the feminine perspective is rare in film.  Despite the fact that movies with female lead characters make 20% more money than those focused on male protagonists, most female filmmakers are simply not getting funded by big Hollywood studios and financiers. This is why YOU donating to our crowdfunding effort is vital.  If women help women, we can create the kind of content we all enjoy, and with the tremendous box office potential of fairytale films, such as Frozen, Cinderella and Alice In Wonderland, we feel our film could be very successful in the marketplace.  Our vision is to take the profits of this film to continue making female driven content and help fund other female filmmakers in the future. 

Ask yourself, if things were reversed, and women created 93% of the movies we see, what would our world be like today?  



What We'll Use The Funds For:

Transparency is important to us. Making a movie of this size has considerable costs and the funds we are raising here will be put to many uses, such as:

• Pre-production expenses

• Equipment underwriting

• Camera tests


CHECK OUT SOME OF OUR PERKS:

Tote bag and stickers!


Signed limited edition Twelve Dancing Princesses Poster!

Official Prinroc t-shirts! 


Did we mention stickers???




Our Team

Nicole Coady - Writer/Director

Nicole Coady is a writer, director and producer with over 15 years of Hollywood film making experience.  USA Today hails her work as, "A delight!"

Nicole received her Bachelor of Arts from Vassar College in Film.  She went on to pursue a career in the film industry working for such companies as the Creative Artists Agency, producer John Hart's Hart Hubbard Films, and Tristar Entertainment before embarking on screenwriting.  She had the good fortune to have her screenplays produced by major Hollywood players, New Line Cinema and 20th Century Fox.  In addition, she authored scripts for two children's animated features showcasing the top selling Bratz line of dolls for MGA,
Livin' It Up With The Bratz and Little Bratz Party Time.

Building upon her years as a successful screenwriter, Nicole is looking forward to taking the next step in her carreer, directing The Brothers Grimm's Twelve Dancing Princesses, a fairytale she has loved since childhood.  As a former young dancer who studied with The Joffrey Ballet prior to attending Vassar, she is excited to bring her knowledge of dance and storytelling together through the medium of film to create a magical princess movie in the vein of such box office hits as
Cinderella and Frozen.  


Marty Hardin - Producer

Marty Hardin, co-founder and producer at Prinroc, Ltd., is an award winning filmmaker who began his career in advertising as an art director, and then later moved to other leadership roles as both a group creative director and as a producer. His film work has screened at over 100 festivals on 5 continents. Most recently, Hardin served dual roles as DP and producer on the feature film,
Brink, which is currently in post-production. 


Tom Padovan - Editor

Tom has over fifteen years of Hollywood post-production experience in 
product geared towards the family market. 

Just a few of his projects include: serving as the editor and
sound designer for Mattel's animatics, website content and trailers featuring Barbie and the Magic Pegasus. He also served as editor for Red Wagon’s,
Rudolph the Red Nose Reindeer and Casper the Friendly Ghost video
game's web content and national television commercials. In addition,
Tom edited three interactive feature films for top selling toy company, MGA, featuring the Bratz dolls, Livin’ it up with the Bratz, Glitz and Glamour and
Lil’ Bratz Party Time, which he also codirected.

Tom looks forward to bringing his post-production expertise in
family oriented content to The Brothers Grimms' Twelve Dancing Princesses. 


Pamela Coady - Music Supervisor

Pamela Coady gained a unique understanding of the specific demands of dance-centered entertainment during her tenure in the music department of top-rated shows, Dancing With The Stars and So You Think You Can Dance.

With over 24 film and TV music supervision credits to her name, Pamela's career as a music supervisor spans over 10 years.  She began her career at MTV, where she worked as the music coordinator for Dance Life.  She went on in her role as music supervisor to work on 10 additional shows for MTV, including such hits as,
Bridge and Tunnel. 

In 2011 she had the pleasure of music supervising the 63rd Primetime Emmy Awards and went on to supervise the music for 2011 & 2015 Film Independent Spirit Awards, and the 38th - 41st People's Choice Awards.  

As a long time fan of such successful princesses films as, Frozen and Cinderella, Pamela is very excited to be part of the Prinroc team as music supervisor for
The Brothers Grimm's Twelve Dancing Princesses!


Kimberly Hickock - Producer of Marketing and PR


For over 20 years, Kim has consistently found herself in the role of marketing expert and business strategist.  She's excited to bring this combined knowledge to the marketing and PR of The Twelve Dancing Princesses. 


Alyson Popa - Producer of Marketing and PR

Alyson has experience working for large pharmaceutical Clients, not-for-profit agencies, sales and recruitment, you name it she has done it! She works hard and fierce for her clients with an end-goal focused on finding creative solutions using every resource she has effectively and efficiently! Alyson's energy is unsurpassed and she has a gift for taking a grass-roots approach to help drive growth. She is not afraid to roll-up her sleeves and do what it takes to see a job through. 



Other Ways You Can Help

We are grateful for any support we receive and that includes liking us on social media or sharing this campaign with others who might be interested in funding a great fairytale with a girl power message!  You can like us at: 

https://www.facebook.com/12-Dancing-Princesses-772903212808530/timeline/

or Twitter @12dancingfilm

THANK YOU!

Choice Awards.

successful princesses films as, Frozen and Cinderella, Pamela is
very excited to be part of the Prinroc team as music supervisor for The Brothers Grimm's Twelve Dancing Princesses!

Kimberly Hickock - Producer of Marketing and PR





For over 20 years, Kim has consistently found herself in the role of marketing expert and business strategist.  She's excited to bring this combined knowledge to the marketing and PR of The Twelve Dancing Princesses. 

Alyson Popa - Producer of Marketing and PR

Alyson has experience
working for large pharmaceutical Clients, not-for-profit agencies, sales and
recruitment, you name it she has done it! She works hard and fierce for her clients with an end-goal
focused on finding creative solutions using every resource she has effectively
and efficiently! Alyson's energy is unsurpassed and she has a gift for taking a
grass-roots approach to help drive growth. She is not afraid to roll-up her
sleeves and do what it takes to see a job through. 









Other Ways You Can Help

 We are grateful for any support we receive and that includes liking us on social media or sharing this campaign with others who might be interested in funding a great fairytale with a girl power message!  You can like us at: 
https://www.facebook.com/12-Dancing-Princesses-772903212808530/timeline/
or Twitter @12dancingfilm
THANK YOU!

story:
Due to a conflicting EU trade mark (EU004146577), the commercial release of this title will be The Coming of the Martians - A Faithful Audio Adaptation of H. G. Wells' The War of the Worlds.


The Story

In 1897, author H. G. Wells wrote a science-fiction novel that would inspire countless modern stories within the genre for decades and still remains a source of artistic creativity to this day. Taking cues from historical events during the threat of war in Europe and the speculation of life on Mars at the the time, Wells created an interplanetary war story told in the first-person and in a real location. With this documentary style of writing, Wells described a realistic account of how invaders from Mars lay waste to southern England in a novel comprised of two books (Book I: The Coming of the Martians & Book II: Earth Under the Martians) under the main novel title The War of the Worlds.

This groundbreaking novel became an instant success placing fear into the hearts of children and adults the world over. In the 118 years since the novel was first serialized in Pearson's Magazine there have been numerous adaptations of Wells' original story in all kinds of media. Seven films, various radio dramas, graphic novels, television series and sequels or parallel stories all derived from the original text in some form.

The only issue with all of these adaptations is one of faithfulness to Wells' original story. Changes have included the tone and feel of the story, the geographical location, the Victorian time period in which the action is set, the fighting machine design, etc.

None of these adaptations have been truly faithful to H. G. Wells' original story; This is where we come in...


The Production

As huge fans of the original novel we are, like many others, disappointed with previous adaptations that have not remained faithful or presented it in such a way that the dark, often horrific tone and feel of Wells' original story becomes lost.

We intend to produce the definitive version of this wonderful classic science-fiction story as acinematic audio drama faithfully adapted in the correct period from the original source; the 1898 novel. This will be achieved with a fantastic full-cast of British actors, immersive sound design and chilling orchestral music all mixed in 5.1 surround sound from the outset.


What is Cinematic Audio Drama?

Unlike an audiobook that is narrated by a reader, our cinematic audio drama adaptation will sound just like a blockbuster film made only for your ears! With any visual adaptation you are always forced to see someone else's interpretation of imagery. We all conjure up our own individual images and pictures in our minds when reading Wells' story. Here audio drama excels over visual drama - with a great cast, a great score and our 5.1 surround sound 'cinematic' mix - you're immersed in the action, and, as they say: the sets really ARE better in your mind!

The faithfulness of the adaptation, the quality of the prospective cast, and the immersive quality of the production techniques are what separates this production from others! With your help, and your input, we will bring this chilling horrific sci-fi story to life in such a unique way that we hope reviewers the world over would consider it the most convincing, most faithful and technologically imaginative version to date.


The Releases

There are 4 different ways you can hear the production. Each release going up the reward level will have more features and/or improved quality. The releases, from lowest reward to highest, are as follows:

  • Digital download via Bandcamp (MP3, FLAC, ALAC, AAC, Ogg).
  • 2-disc CD release with Dolby Pro Logic II surround sound encoded stereo.
  • Limited Edition DVD (3000 copies) with up to DTS 5.1 surround sound + extras and special packaging.
  • Special Limited Edition USB (200 copies) with uncompressed 5.1 sound sound + exclusive extras.

The release date for all products is set for January 2017. Backers will receive them first and then the general public one month later.


My Background

My name is Martin Johnson and I'm a professional audio drama producer, sound designer, audio editor and music composer.

H. G Wells' novel was one of the first books I read outside of school literature back in the 1980's. I had no idea that there were adaptations of the novel until I came across the Paramount television series and then the 1953 film. The film, although iconic and remaining one of my favorite classic sci-fi films, is far from faithful. As soon as I saw the fighting machines I thought to myself "Well, that's not right!", but what a brilliant design for its time.

From that early age, The War of the Worlds is something I have wanted to produce as a faithful audio drama with the dark tone and atmosphere the story deserves. It wasn't until I worked onDoctor Who that I began to take the idea seriously. However, I wanted to wait until my experience in the industry matured further and I had my own audio business so that the story could be adapted correctly and faithfully.

For the last 8 years, through my own business Everybodyelse Productions, I have provided post-production services on some of the best-regarded audio dramas in the UK. 

I have worked with Big Finish on sound design, editing and music for the official BBC licenced Doctor Who audio adventures, with Bafflegab on The Scarifyers and with Hammer Films for their first entry in audio drama, Hammer Chillers.

In 2014, I successfully funded a Kickstarter project for my very own original cinematic audio drama, also mixed in 5.1 surround sound, called Osiris. The production received very positive reviews including a 7/10 rating from Starburst Magazine. The production also made the 'Best of 2014 in Science-Fiction Audio' in the British Science Fiction Association magazine, Vector. It was directed by Lisa Bowerman (Big Finish) and starred Christian Edwards (Doctor Who),Robert Whitelock (Hercules, Doctor Who), Liz White (The Woman in Black, Life on Mars) with guest stars Colin McFarlane (Batman Begins, The Dark Knight) and Georgia Moffett(Merlin, Doctor Who).

Below is a 7-minute sample of Osiris, which is Dolby Pro Logic II surround sound encoded, and a sample of the orchestral score. Please be aware that Osiris is a lot lighter in tone than 'The War of the Worlds' and these samples should only be used to get a feel for the minimum production quality expected of our project...

https://soundcloud.com/deadcatwalking/osiris-pilot-7-minute-preview

https://soundcloud.com/deadcatwalking/osiris-score-sample


Full Cast

Unfortunately, we cannot disclose casting information until after our studio recording sessions are completed. This is due to contractual reasons. However, rest assured that we will be using a very talented full cast of British actors, most of who will be well known for their film, television and audio work. Actors are the staple of any drama and most of our total budget on the production will go towards casting.


Production Team

For this big cinematic audio drama project we have industry professionals that I have a wonderful working relationship with. Also, I wanted to reunite a great production team that is known for giving fans of the sci-fi genre the best possible interpretation of an adapted narrative.


Risks and Challenges

We have a team of hard working professionals that have worked in the audio drama industry for many years. The only challenge we face is making our production the most faithful adaptation of H. G. Wells' story as he intended when written in 1987.


DISCLAIMER: This project is NOT affiliated with, sponsored, or in any way associated with the musical version of H. G. Wells' original 1898 novel. To avoid trade mark issues this project is using the alternative title "The Coming of the Martians" taken from Book One. Use of the artistic title "The War of the Worlds" to describe H. G. Wells' story does not imply any affiliation or endorsement with the musical and is within third-party use rights of EU trade mark law. (See Copyright & Trademark Notice, below)

story:
The Creators: Tracy Ofosuhene and Carissa Pinckney

Right before graduating from NYU, Tracy had this crazy idea to create a serialized comedy based on her bizarre and crazy college experience called Living with Strangers. She partnered with her very funny and talented friend, Carissa Pinckney, an NYUer as well, to write the show and possibly bring it to life.

What was their objective? To create a funny show that...

  • talks about EVERYTHING (politics, sex, love, relationships, money or lack thereof, etc;)
  • Authentically reflects the lives of young people and gives them a voice.
  • gives insight and understanding of the struggles young millennials face today.
  • told a story about a culturally diverse and INCLUSIVE group of people.
  • Pushes boundaries,  destroy barriers, and breaks down societal stereotypes.

  • all the characters, who are otherwise marginalized and vastly underrepresented in society AND the media in some way, shape, or form, are portrayed as MULTIFACETED, MULTIDIMENSIONAL, fully formed HUMAN BEINGS.

What Happens To The Money? 

LWS is a very collaborative project with a full production team that is dedicated to making the pilot episode, but will need a lot of help to do so. LWS needs funding to:

  • shoot in New York City for 10 full 12hr days.
  • obtain permits and locations in NY.
  • buy flights and AirBnB stay for the producers and the creators traveling from LA to NY.
  • pay crew, cast, and equipment for camera, art, sound, and wardrobe department.
  • General Liability INSURANCE - Equipment, Car, and Worker's comp. It costs $2,904
  • enough supplies for make-up/hair department. Mainly basic make-up, hair, and touch ups for the actors (main, secondary AND extras/background).
  • food for cast and crew of over 60 people. Required to feed everyone at least 2 meals a day, breakfast and lunch.
  • car, prop, and clothing rental as rent cop uniforms costing $400, an ambulance rental costs $1,500, a hospital gurney costs $457.28 and cop cars cost $1,000. Pilot has two cop cars so it will cost $2,000 for the cop cars.
  • lockdown a production "office" near set locations. The office maybe a production tent.
  • permit for dog/animal. Also, need funds to have a trainer for the dog on set.
  • marketing, contracts, and music licensing
  • post production editing and sound.

The Reason Living With Strangers Is IMPORTANT!

When Tracy and Carissa started writing together in 2012, the first thing they discussed was, "Why do we want to see a show like Living with Strangers on the air?" The Answer: "Because we don't see ourselves or any of our friends on screen. We feel like shows about people our age/generation are completely inaccurate and DO NOT reflect the world WE live in today, especially how they DO NOT show how our friend groups are an eclectic mix of people".

Living with Strangers is important because of everything Tracy and Carissa are aiming to do with the show. The is show is going to give a generation that doesn't feel like they are being heard and not understood a voice while authentically representing those who are underserved and marginalized in the U.S. because of their race, gender, sexual orientation, culture, economic status, etc;

The industry is finally realizing that audiences are looking for narratives that tell stories of different people. Shows like Insecure, Atlanta, Master of None, You're The Worst, Black~ish, Fresh Off The Boat, and Orange Is The New Black are pushing these boundaries and conversations, but there needs to be MORE! Living with Strangers will continue to push the uncomfortable conversations while balancing it with grounded, over the top humor. 

So if you feel the same way as Tracy and Carissa, and want to see more shows that are funny and authentically mirror the world today and further pushes for equal representation of all people in the media and society then help make Living With Strangers a reality and DONATE.

Money Isn't The Only Way To Help

If you are unable to donate, then there are other ways you can contribute. You can donate food, costumes, your time i.e. be a production assistant if you live or will be in NY during shooting, or help spread the word and get your friends and family to donate as well. We sincerely appreciate any form of help.

Thank you!

We sincerely appreciate any form of help.
Thank you!

story:
The Plan

 

Slowly but steadily the script for this film has been drafted and continually improved to a point where we are very excited to consider turning the words into vibrant 4K moving images. A lot of pre-production has already been done with the majority of the film designed, practicalities worked out and scheduling proposed. We look to shoot this early 2017 in the months of March and April, moving into post-production in May so that the film will be complete by June 2017. Everything that can be done towards the production has been at this stage so this is where you come in...

 

Why We Need Your Support

 

In order to bring this story to life, we need your help. 

Your contributions will go towards the production of the film and getting it seen around the world at select film festivals. By helping to fund a student film like this you are encouraging the next generation of innovative filmmakers, giving us the opportunity to get a step closer to where we want to be in the creative industry.

Most importantly, your support will guarantee an exciting and original script is brought to life in the best way possible.

 

The Team

Principal Character | Victoria Priddice

Having been interested in performance since a young age, Victoria is an experienced actress with a fantastic set of talents. Succeeding in performing arts at Bridgwater College, she is now in her second year, studying Acting at ALRA drama school. She is immensely excited to work on this film and looks forward to practising her skills in front of the camera.

 

Writer and Director | Ross Dixon

A 1st year Film student at the University of Westminster and  an experienced creator. Having worked in a wide variety of areas across the filmmaking industry, he is a very driven creative mind, always looking for new projects to get stuck into, learning new skills.

Most notable of Ross' filmmaking successes is in the creation of short film It's Just a Game (2016). He now hopes to build on the positives of this 'no budget' film with  For Mum supported by a fantastic network of fellow students and actors.

Some of his best work can be seen here rossdixonfilm.com

 

Writer and Director | Oscar Perillo

Hailing from a theatre background, Oscar's focus is on the importance of acting and it's his belief that the key to award winning productions is in the performance from the actors. In his previous productions, such as Don't forget to smile, and The night of the date, Oscar has focused upon directing the actors through their personal character development. He himself has performed in short films and theatre productions as well as teaching younger film makers how to interact with actors on camera. Having worked with both new and veteran actors alike, he hopes to work with many more during this production and learn from their experience. Passionate about this script and the characters contained within, Oscar is hoping that while working with Ross' technical ingenuity, they can together create a fantastic production.

 

Assistant Director | Olivia Parkinson

Olivia Parkinson is also a first year Film student at the University of Westminster, currently working on a short film of her own that she is writing and directing in January next year. She is also  busily working in post-production, editing an independent feature film. She says she is so happy to be involved in such an ambitious project and to collaborate with other people on her course. Olivia has also worked closely with the script through it's development and her passion for the film is fantastic.

 

Gaffer / Lighting Director | Zeynep Oğuz

Having worked as the director and the cinematographer of award winning short films like My Religion and The Hunter , Zeynep is the perfect person to plan out the lighting design of the many different locations we plan to shoot. Her recent involvement in independent fashion photography projects like The Story of Red, Blue and Purple or some music videos as the DOP/Gaffer are mainly projects experimenting with the use of different lights and colours.

As she wants to specialise in Cinematography and Lighting in the next few years while studying in the University of Westminster, we’re excited to work together to create the best look for our script.

 

Sound Operator | Max Mclachlan

Max created his first short film at 14, titled Evanescent.  It was screened at two separate film festivals across the UK, winning a prize for best student short film at both. Two years on, Max won the same award at the Edinburgh International Film Festival for another short film he co-wrote, directed, and edited: Looking Through the Grapevine. More recently he has worked as an editor on a short documentary for the Northern Film School (NFS) in Leeds, Man On Bike. It was selected to be one of four films to represent the NFS and has been showcased at the Aesthetica Short Film Festival in York, as well as Eat Our Shorts at the Regent Street Cinema in London. Currently studying at the University of Westminster, Max will be taking on roles in script development, editing and general assistance on the production.

 

Makeup/ Costume Supervisor | Molly Bradbrook 

Molly is an aspiring filmmaker with a keen interest in exploring alternative ways to tell stories. Looking to learn and develop creatively, she’s excited to get stuck into this project and is hoping to bring something interesting and unique to the crew.

 

BTS/ Photographer | Agne Denapaite

Agne Denapaite is passionate filmmaker focusing on directing and cinematography. Currently studying Film BA in University of Westminster. She created, directed and produced a number of short documentaries from East Africa including: “Black Diamond” (2016), “African Sakata” (2016) and was invited to represent the work on The National Television of Lithuania. Most recent work was directing live music video in a TV studio and working hard on University projects.

 

Executive Producer | Louis Holder

Louis is a filmmaker, broadcaster and independent film & arts activist. He has created, directed and produced many shorts, documentaries and featurettes which have featured at film festivals worldwide. He is an alumnus of the BFI Film Academy, has worked with institutions such as the BFI, Eastside Educational Trust, Twyford CE High School and City of Westminster College.

He studied Creative Media Production (Film & TV) at City of Westminster College, was also the President of the Student Union and Local Representative at NUS and strong voice on social media for the Creative Industries and is currently pursuing an undergraduate degree in Film. He is the perfect person to offer overall advice for the project to ensure it runs as smoothly as possible.

 

Thank you for taking the time to check out our project. Please share our campaign everywhere you can to help get the word out, helping us make the film a reality.

 

For Mum

We look to shoot this early 2017 in the months of March and April, moving into post-production in May so that the film will be complete by June 2017. Everything that can be done towards the production has been at this stage so this is where you come in... Why We Need Your Support In order to bring this story to life, we need your help. Your contributions will go towards the production of the film and getting it seen around the world at select film festivals. By helping to fund a student film like this you are encouraging the next generation of innovative filmmakers, giving us the opportunity to get a step closer to where we want to be in the creative industry.Most importantly, your support will guarantee an exciting and original script is brought to life in the best way possible. The TeamPrincipal Character | Victoria PriddiceHaving been interested in performance since a young age, Victoria is an experienced actress with a fantastic set of talents. Succeeding in performing arts at Bridgwater College, she is now in her second year, studying Acting at ALRA drama school. She is immensely excited to work on this film and looks forward to practising her skills in front of the camera. Writer and Director | Ross DixonA 1st year Film student at the University of Westminster and  an experienced creator. Having worked in a wide variety of areas across the filmmaking industry, he is a very driven creative mind, always looking for new projects to get stuck into, learning new skills.Most notable of Ross' filmmaking successes is in the creation of short film It's Just a Game (2016). He now hopes to build on the positives of this 'no budget' film with  For Mum supported by a fantastic network of fellow students and actors.Some of his best work can be seen here rossdixonfilm.com Writer and Director | Oscar PerilloHailing from a theatre background, Oscar's focus is on the importance of acting and it's his belief that the key to award winning productions is in the performance from the actors. In his previous productions, such as Don't forget to smile, and The night of the date, Oscar has focused upon directing the actors through their personal character development. He himself has performed in short films and theatre productions as well as teaching younger film makers how to interact with actors on camera. Having worked with both new and veteran actors alike, he hopes to work with many more during this production and learn from their experience. Passionate about this script and the characters contained within, Oscar is hoping that while working with Ross' technical ingenuity, they can together create a fantastic production. Assistant Director | Olivia ParkinsonOlivia Parkinson is also a first year Film student at the University of Westminster, currently working on a short film of her own that she is writing and directing in January next year. She is also  busily working in post-production, editing an independent feature film. She says she is so happy to be involved in such an ambitious project and to collaborate with other people on her course. Olivia has also worked closely with the script through it's development and her passion for the film is fantastic. Gaffer / Lighting Director | Zeynep OğuzHaving worked as the director and the cinematographer of award winning short films like My Religion and The Hunter , Zeynep is the perfect person to plan out the lighting design of the many different locations we plan to shoot. Her recent involvement in independent fashion photography projects like The Story of Red, Blue and Purple or some music videos as the DOP/Gaffer are mainly projects experimenting with the use of different lights and colours.As she wants to specialise in Cinematography and Lighting in the next few years while studying in the University of Westminster, we’re excited to work together to create the best look for our script. Sound Operator | Max MclachlanMax created his first short film at 14, titled Evanescent.  It was screened at two separate film festivals across the UK, winning a prize for best student short film at both. Two years on, Max won the same award at the Edinburgh International Film Festival for another short film he co-wrote, directed, and edited: Looking Through the Grapevine. More recently he has worked as an editor on a short documentary for the Northern Film School (NFS) in Leeds, Man On Bike. It was selected to be one of four films to represent the NFS and has been showcased at the Aesthetica Short Film Festival in York, as well as Eat Our Shorts at the Regent Street Cinema in London. Currently studying at the University of Westminster, Max will be taking on roles in script development, editing and general assistance on the production. Makeup/ Costume Supervisor | Molly Bradbrook Molly is an aspiring filmmaker with a keen interest in exploring alternative ways to tell stories. Looking to learn and develop creatively, she’s excited to get stuck into this project and is hoping to bring something interesting and unique to the crew. BTS/ Photographer | Agne DenapaiteAgne Denapaite is passionate filmmaker focusing on directing and cinematography. Currently studying Film BA in University of Westminster. She created, directed and produced a number of short documentaries from East Africa including: “Black Diamond” (2016), “African Sakata” (2016) and was invited to represent the work on The National Television of Lithuania. Most recent work was directing live music video in a TV studio and working hard on University projects. Executive Producer | Louis HolderLouis is a filmmaker, broadcaster and independent film & arts activist. He has created, directed and produced many shorts, documentaries and featurettes which have featured at film festivals worldwide. He is an alumnus of the BFI Film Academy, has worked with institutions such as the BFI, Eastside Educational Trust, Twyford CE High School and City of Westminster College.He studied Creative Media Production (Film & TV) at City of Westminster College, was also the President of the Student Union and Local Representative at NUS and strong voice on social media for the Creative Industries and is currently pursuing an undergraduate degree in Film. He is the perfect person to offer overall advice for the project to ensure it runs as smoothly as possible. Thank you for taking the time to check out our project. Please share our campaign everywhere you can to help get the word out, helping us make the film a reality. For Mum

story:
MRS. KRANTZ BAKES GREAT COOKIES

Written by Gerry Pearson. Produced by Lucky Dog Pictures.

  • Directed by Maria Sant'Angelo
  • Starring: Marye Barton, Doru Bandol, Pam Hyatt, and Peter Loung.

This is an ACTRA CO-OP project whereby all the ACTRA members involved are working on this film because they LOVE the project.  They are not getting paid unless the film makes money and then everyone shares in the profits.

We need your help! We need you to be part of our project to help us pay for production costs such as sound, lighting, editing, feeding our cast & crew while on set and so much more...

Our goal is to get "MRS. KRANTZ BAKES GREAT COOKIES" into all the film festivals around the world.  There are certain costs involved as there is a non-refundable fee required for each time a film is submitted to a festival.

  • DONATE and receive PERKS from us!

The Impact

With your generous support, this dark comedy will be able to see the light of day.  This short film has an important message to share with the world about domestic abuse as well as being a great bit of fun.

As the director of this film, I am convinced that with the caliber of performers I have assembled, along with Gerry Pearson's brilliant script, we will have a HIT on our hands!

Thank you for considering our project and supporting the arts community.

Did you watch our Teaser Video? 

This is what we have shot so far. Don't you want to find out what George is hearing behind the red door?  What is Mrs. Krantz actually up to while stomping in the garden?...  If you want to find out...donate and help us finish the film. You will be happy you did and we will be SO appreciative & grateful for your support!

Did you like the music?

Original Film Score composed by cast member Peter Loung.  Check out our perks as we have a limited quantity of him posing in sexy Calvin Klein underwear!!  He will personally autograph the picture for you, make sure to check this out in our perks section.

http://www.imdb.me/peterloung

Other Ways You Can Help

You may not be able to contribute monetarily, but that doesn't mean you can't help in other ways...

  • Please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools.
  • Tell your Facebook friends about our project.
  • Share our information with everyone you know!

story:
DON'T CALL ME A MINDLESS PHILOSOPHER.

I'm Gabriel Diaz, screenwriter, actor, and director from Montevideo, Uruguay.  I was 23 and in film school when I began working on Noctámbulo, a project which in hindsight was a willful abduction.  I had no clue how I got to where I was, but I landed at the right place at exactly the precise moment for what the Uruguayan audience was craving.  This upcoming project is more personal for me, as I seek to answer the universal question, "Are we alone in the universe?"  My goal is to go deeper into the UFO phenomenon by bringing to light controversial theories and findings that have not yet surfaced.  But before you sign off, I invite you to continue reading because this will not be just another film about aliens coming to rule earth.

THE PROJECT
LA ULTIMA FASE  is an independent Uruguayan/Argentinean science-fiction thriller, which delves into the UFO phenomenon that seeks to keep the viewer on the edge of their seat.   The careful balance between thriller, science fiction and drama reveal mysteries and secrets drawing from the styles of The X Files and The Da Vinci Code with the suspense experienced in Signs. This is unique to anything ever debuted in Uruguayan film and possibly in all Latin American markets. Our intention is to exhibit both in cinema, the domestic market, and international festivals.

Based on controversial reports about the UFO phenomenon.  Laura Pereira and her brother, Javier, begin a desperate investigation behind the disappearance of their father.

While they search for answers, the siblings become entangled with a prestigious UFO specialist, Francisco, who may have an explanation related to their father's whereabouts .

With their lives in danger, the three discover hidden secrets and truths that will change the destiny of humankind.

 

GENERAL PRODUCER'S NOTE

by Lorena D'Agata

La Última Fase is an independent, low budget, science fiction thriller, produced by Tres en Linea Films (Uruguay) in co-production with Cosmovita Films (Argentina). In collaboration with Martín Delon of Gaucho Productions (United States) as Executive Producer and Oliver Butterick of Wanton South as Associate Producer, who will provide the technical resources necessary for filming .Currently we are in the preproduction stage, forming the team of technicians and actors, together with Cosmovita Films, while Gaucho Productions is executing production financing strategies.

We consider Indiegogo an important fundraising tool and find it a very attractive platform to help expand our reach to other countries, allowing many to approach our project and contribute economically helping it to materialize.


We are also grateful to the Municipality of La Costa Argentina for the support they've given to La Ultima Fase since it made possible the filming of our teaser in December of last year. The filming of the feature film will continue beginning mid-2017 in the same location thanks to their generosity.

On a more personal note, La Última Fase, represents a professional challenge. The opportunity to be General Producer of this project and to carry out this venture, with full confidence, knowing it is a film project that we are not accustom to seeing on the big screen in Latin America, particularly for its history, genre and thematic addresses. It is that combination that makes the project unique; taking risks and finding different and attractive ways to make movies. This is a film that will become an incentive to exhibit and attract a broader audience.

I invite you through this platform to accompany us on this journey and support us so we can make La Última Fase a reality.

story:
Short Summary

Thank you for considering to support the Tampa Technique documentary that explores key racialized moments in Tampa’s history through the lens of Central Avenue, which was the historically black business district that was physically and symbolically demolished in 1974. The "Tampa Technique" was a strategic, bi-racial approach to integration different from other Southern cities that centered on economic goals through an organized, methodical approach that was praised nationally but backfired locally during key moments of disruption. This story focuses on seminal moments for blacks in Tampa ranging from lunch counter sit-ins to school integration to a 1967 civil disturbance to urban renewal that displaced and disrupted the city’s minority communities. Central Avenue was constructed through segregation and destroyed through integration, which is why it will be the hub of the story.

I am an instructor at the University of South Florida in mass communications and was a broadcast journalist for 12 years before moving into the university in 2012. This documentary is part of my dissertation project for my Ph.D. However, this story has become more than a project for me over the past year thanks to the remarkable people I have met who persevered through the civil rights movement as well as institutional, systematic, and structural forms of racism.

The contributions to this project will help cover three primary expenses (copyright, production costs, festival distribution). First, copyright material through the local newspapers and television stations will help provide the visual elements missing from this film through the eyes of journalists. These materials are expensive. For example, one-minute of video of the 1967 civil disturbances costs $2,500. Copyright-protected music is also necessary for this project. Second, production costs will go toward a co-worker who is currently helping me for free with this project because of what the story can do for the local community and the impact we think it can have on local knowledge shared by people who lived it. A small amount of production costs cover equipment, primarily memory cards to record the interviews. Third, to ensure that this story reaches a wide audience, we would like to submit it to several local, national, and international film festivals to share the story and get it distributed. One significant cost for festivals is marketing and promotional material, which include the DVDs and film post cards that you could receive as thanks for your contribution.

What We Need & What You Get

The estimated expenses we hope to cover in this project will focus on direct copyright expenses ($8,000), production costs ($5,000), and festival distribution and promotion ($2,000). I realize in the long run it will cost more than this. I just hope to cover the largest potential overhead costs to ensure the best visual product. Any money that is raised beyond the $15,000 will cover additional overhead expenses for more copyright material and festival distribution, but more important, I will contribute 10% of any excess contributions to the Saunders Foundation, which is named in honor of Robert W. Saunders. Mr. Saunders was the NAACP Florida field secretary from 1952-1966 and was a Tampa native.

For your contribution, you will receive at least a personal shout out on the Tampa Technique Facebook page. Beyond a minimum $5 contribution, you are eligible for credit in the film, a Tampa Technique DVD, admission to a documentary screening, or recognition as an executive producer of the film! Additional description for what you receive for your support are outlined in the campaign details.

The Impact

This story is significant because of how the city of Tampa approached racial integration compared to other cities across the South. The Tampa Technique is unique for its methodical and orchestrated approach that was embraced by the white and black elites. However, the technique did not positively influence most of the city’s black residents. While it avoided national negative headlines, locally it backfired during the 1967 civil disturbance.

This narrative of underrepresented voices in the civil rights movement is like many other cities across the South. Tampa is not lumped into the national conversation regarding race relations. However, the Tampa Technique is what should be discussed based on its overall effectiveness in race relations with the goal to maintain economic upward mobility for a burgeoning Southern city at the expense of many minority residents.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to help with a financial contribution but you like the story we want to tell, we ask that you help spread the word through social media to anyone you think would like to help. Indiegogo allows you the share this campaign in a variety of ways. Any help you can provide is greatly appreciated.

story:
A huge thank you to all our backers! In this first phase of the documentary project, the pre-production and the actual 10-day race filming phase, we reached $3333 of our $8888 ultimate goal!  We created a new campaign for the post-production phase.  Check it out!

Facing Infinitus Documentary - Post Production

Follow the action as we move along towards our final destination. Back the project in this exciting phase of post-production. And share it!

 

Film Summary

Facing Infinitus explores the unique motivations of people inexorably drawn to a race deliberately designed to break competitors both mentally and physically.  Every mile takes us a step closer to understanding why these runners have committed themselves to more than just an ultramarathon. This documentary reveals that sometimes it takes such an event to prove we can overcome our fears, push our limits, and commit to something bigger than ourselves in racing and in life. This is the story of ordinary people with extraordinary spirit.  Everybody has their own race to run. When you support Facing Infinitus, you will join a movement that is dedicated to empowering people to overcome obstacles in life.

 

Facing Infinitus Teaser 1

 
 

What We Need

I have the privilege to have met Micah Ness from Silverline Films, an amazing adventure videographer. He is able to follow athletes on the course and capture the most vivid moments of each runner’s journey, along with the beauty of the outdoor where the race occurs.

The $8888 we are raising will be use to cover:

  • Silverline Films fees for their trustworthy services:

-Pre production: interviews, shooting during training and prepping for this race.

- Production: 10 days non-stop of shooting during the event.

- Post production: The creation of an inspiring and compelling end product, involving lot of hours of editing.

- Travel, lodging, and food expenses for Micah Ness from Silverline Films. Don't let him starve! ;)

  • The cost involved for me to run this event: entry fee, travel, lodging, 10 days worth of food for the race (I will burn 10 000kcal per day), race gear, etc.
  • Film’s promotional tools like website and business cards.

 

Facing Infinitus Fundraiser Video

 

The Impact

By contributing to the making of this inspirational documentary film, you become part of a community of people devoted into empowering themselves and others to face obstacles in life, and conquer them! You don’t want to end up watching your own life passing by. You want to make things happen, and fill your life with your conquered dreams! Become a leader in this empowering community. This is your opportunity to start to walk the talk. Now!

 

Challenges

The more support we get from you, the better quality film we can create.  That means using different cameras, including drones. The more support we get from you, the longer the documentary will be! That means more stories, more excitement, more motivation! The more support we get from you, the more noise we can make around this inspirational film.  That means offering special screening in different locations, and enter some film festivals.

We challenge you to dig deep and provide the support needed to create a documentary that can have the impact to change people's lives. Stop thinking!  Start doing! Take on the challenge!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help. If you are in this situation, you can still help by getting the word out and make some noise about this campaign! Use the Indiegogo share tools and all other means you know to spread the word!

We thank you for your contribution, and are looking forward to share with you the inevitable success of this project.  The success that will be created all because of you!

story:
Over the last year, we’ve spent time in Scotland’s Highlands and along the journey, we’ve been getting to know these affectionately named “Highland Tigers”. 

We feel it’s vital to tell their story; raising awareness of their critically endangered status to a wider audience is crucial to preventing their extinction.

 

What is a Scottish Wildcat?

Scottish Wildcats are often thought of as ‘mini tigers’. They are an apex predator and the only big cat left in the UK. Unlike their cousins, the domestic cat, they are in fact bigger and look a little bulkier too. Domestic cats are a separate species descended from the African Wildcat (Felis silvestris lybica) and were brought to Britain around 3,000 years ago. The Scottish Wildcat on the other hand has been found in Scotland for the past 7,000 to 10,000 years and in fact was once native to the whole of the UK.

At a distance, Scottish Wildcats can look like big tabby cats (and are often mistaken for these). However, when you look closely you may spot these distinct differences: 

  • Generally larger than the average cat by up to 50%
  • Larger head and jaws, with ears positioned on the sides of it's head rather than on top
  • A big, bushy tail with distinct rings along it and a club shaped, blunt end. This is typically shorter than the domestic cat tail too
  • Defined stripes down it's sides and around its head. They never have spots, but do have similar coat colours to Bengals

 

Why are you making a film about Scottish Wildcats?

The Tigers of Scotland is a film and natural history project we felt was incredibly important to make happen. This cinematic wildlife documentary will explore the Scottish Wildcats and the lands that they call home, the myths and folklore inspired by them, as well as the efforts and the struggles to conserve this fragile species which, without proper awareness, we will lose within the next few years. There are now thought to be less than 100 of them left in the wild.

We've spent several weeks filming in the remote, far North of Scotland and have completed shooting. Production was self funded and now we're in need of your assistance to complete post production.

 

Why are there less than 100 Scottish Wildcats left?

With less than 100 left - did you know that Scottish Wildcats are rarer than pandas, gorillas and rhinos?

For hundreds of years, Scottish Wildcats were shot and killed for doing what they do naturally – hunting birds and small mammals. Estates would proudly list in ledgers the amounts of predators and vermin killed on their land, with the biggest recorded killing on the Glengarry estate in 1840. 198 Scottish Wildcats are listed to have been killed on the estate in a four year period - that's double the number currently estimated to exist in the wild today. Gamekeepers are generally now much more open and interested in ensuring their activities are wildlife friendly than they were 150 years ago, though mistakes can be made. As humans continue to build roads through their territories, being hit by a vehicle is now much more likely than persecution.

Another problem is habitat loss, mostly caused by us humans. While they are quite adaptable creatures, humans are constantly changing the landscape and the Wildcats just can't keep up. Areas that just 40 years ago were perfect habitats for the Wildcats and many other creatures have been destroyed by people, so they adapted to the new landscape and now people are once again talking about changing that environment.

Domestic and feral cats however are now their biggest threat. As they are genetic cousins, they can breed with domestic cats and produce fertile offspring. There are many dangers to this, but the main one is that we're simply losing a species through poor and diluted genetics. In addition, unvaccinated domestic and feral cats can transmit diseases that Wildcats wouldn't have otherwise come into contact with.

 

Why have I never heard of Scottish Wildcats before?

It's possible that you might not have heard of them because we Brits in particular like to hear about more exotic animals on other continents; sometimes that means that the wonderful wildlife in our own country is easily overlooked.

Furthermore, these animals are incredibly elusive and difficult to find. Many of the locals in the areas we've been filming had no idea they even had wildcats on their doorstep or simply had never seen them in all their years living there. Not only are they shy, stealthy animals, but their sheer lack of numbers only compounds their obscurity.

People may also be confused with domestic tabby cats or Bengals - and as glances are often fleeting, a person might not realise that it was actually Wildcat they had seen. Equally, it's just as easy to mistake a Bengal or tabby cat for a Wildcat with a fleeting glance too.

 

What's the campaign for?

The campaign directly funds the amazing team we have assembled to help piece together the film in the best possible way. Whilst it might have been possible for us to have edited the film ourselves, hiring professionals means the film will be completed and polished to the highest possible standard.

Whilst we've self funded production, we need help with post production which is where you can help. In order to be as clear as possible about where the contributions will be going, we've created the below chart to show you how and where we're distributing the funding.

 

How does this project help the Wildcats?

As part of our campaign, we pledge to donate 5% of what we receive to two of our favourite charities: Aigas Field Centre and Five Sisters Zoo. Both organisations have been a major part in the production of the film and your contribution will directly go towards caring for the Scottish Wildcats. Whatever perk you choose, not only will you be assisting in completing the film, but your generosity will be helping to save the Wildcats themselves.

Aigas Field Centre is part of the Scottish Wildcat breeding programme. This is one of the main conservation efforts and most effective method for saving the species from extinction. Aigas have two breeding pairs of Wildcats on site, along with a plethora of other wildlife including pine martens, eagles and beavers.

Five Sisters Zoo have a number of Wildcats on display. Unlike many zoos, Five Sisters' animals have large enclosures and their welfare is kept in the highest regard. They've recently saved and re-homed several circus bears and lions which now have 2-acre spaces to roam.

Those claiming the higher level perks can also adopt their own Wildcat from Aigas Field Centre. This further funds food, enclosure building and maintenance, animal husbandry costs and veterinary fees. As part of this, you will receive a personalised thank you letter from Aigas Field Centre, information about their project, Wildcat postcards and a biannual newsletter updating you on the Wildcats' progress.

 

How can I support this campaign?

We've lined up a number of perks for you to choose from. Every perk offers the same rewards as all previous perks, plus the extra additions - so every perk includes a donation to the two charities, for instance.

Many campaigns offer lots of goodies - and sometimes lots of junk. Typically for other projects, this is paid for out of contributions, eating away at the main intended purpose of funds raised. With our campaign, we've decided to keep physical items to a minimum - and to meaningful ones at that. This is better for the environment, and it means that the money is truly spent on the film itself. 

The film and the soundtrack are both available as rewards in digital form. We don't need to produce DVDs or CDs, nor do we need to pay for postage to send them out. Not only does this save you money, but it also means you'll be able to receive a much higher quality copy of the film than from a DVD.

Take a look at the Perk Packages!

The film will be finished around September time and will have two official UK premieres; one in Manchester and one in Scotland. Whilst venues and dates are yet to be confirmed, details of these will be announced and contributors will be informed at a later date.

As part of the script, our writer (and professional poet) John Rice has written a poem about the Scottish Wildcats exclusively for the film. A limited number of these will be printed and signed by himself and displayed in a bespoke frame made locally by our friends at Framing Manchester. Furthermore, this will feature an exclusively commissioned illustration of a Scottish Wildcat to complement the poem.

 

Who’s involved in making this film?

LEANNE GATER

DIRECTOR, PRODUCER & CINEMATOGRAPHER

Leanne Gater is an award winning wildlife photographer and filmmaker. Her photography has been exhibited all across the world, including Times Square in New York and at the Louvre in Paris. More recently, she was named in the top five wildlife filmmakers by Movidiam.

An accomplished wildlife filmmaker, she has produced, shot and edited her own wildlife films on Red Squirrels and Puffins. Additionally, she has chartered boats to film whales off the coast of Whitby, plus tracked and filmed wild red deer, pine martens and even reindeer all over Scotland.

ALEX STONE

CINEMATOGRAPHER & PRODUCER

Alex Stone is an award-winning Cinematographer and although he normally shoots narrative fiction films, his expertise as a cinematographer will be invaluable for creating a visually engaging project.

He has a keen aptitude for the outdoors and regularly enjoys filming and photographing both landscapes and wildlife, often whilst wildcamping and living out of a backpack.

JOHN RICE

WRITER

John Rice is a successful and acclaimed Scottish poet and writer, whose work frequently features wildlife and the natural world.

He has held a number of notable positions in the Arts world and has had several books published for both children and adults. He joins the project as a writer as his experience both with wildlife and writing will be extremely beneficial to weaving a compelling narrative.

IAIN GLEN

NARRATOR

Iain Glen is an acclaimed Scottish stage and screen actor, best known for his role in Game of Thrones as Ser Jorah Mormont.

He lends his voice to the narration, guiding and informing the viewers throughout the documentary with an authentic Scottish accent!

SOPHIE MAPPLEBECK

COMPOSER

Sophie is an accomplished musician, having written many of her own songs and performing regularly with a band. Alongside her performing work, she is an excellent sound designer and composer. As the sound designer, she worked on Don't Take Me Home, the feature film about the Welsh football team, and as composer she has most recently completed the music for Teacher's Pet in just 48 hours, as the film was entered into London Sci-fi Festival's 48 hour competition.

Thank you for your time and I hope you will consider contributing to the project. Only with the support of people such as yourself can this project be completed and shared with the world.

story:
Dissolve, a film based on the effects of dementia will be our entry for this years Røde Reel competition. 

We are known as Studio206, a small production company located in London GB and we've been making films for the last few years now. We work closely with industry professionals within Pinewood and other London base studios alike. 

Studio206 was set up with the idea of creating art and telling stories through unique ways. With this story we hope to achieve that by showing you the audience a first hand account of what Dementia is actually like and how it affects and individual and the people around them.

www.studio206.co.uk

We aim to create an amazing piece of art as well as at the same time, show the audience what happens when this life destroying disease hits. Dementia destroys lives across the world and there is currently no cure. In our story, with the use of polaroids and flash backs;  we show that memory triggers are a thing and can help with long-term memory retrieval. 

PRODUCTION 50%

This includes everything to do with the shooting days. Talent and Crew payment & Expenses. On set food and equipment hire. 

POST PRODUCTION 20%

This includes the whole editing post stage, from locked picture to sound, colour and score.

DELIVERY 15%

This includes the final film delivery to festivals, cast and backers.

CHARITY DONATION 15%

15% off all donations from you guys will go to a charity helping to support dementia.

 

Thank you for your support with the project. Keep up to date on social media.

FACEBOOK - www.facebook.com/Studio206/

TWITTER - www.twitter.com/Studio206_

WEB - www.studio206.co.uk
